No cables are supplied for connecting the TV to a PC.**InfoLink RSS: The Samsung 650 Series LCD TV features an Ethernet port which allows you to connect the television to your home PC's network through a router so you can use the InfoLink RSS function of the television. The InfoLink RSS feature gathers up-to-the-minute content from USA Today and displays it on the television screen so you can always stay connected to the News, Weather and Stock Reports while watching TV at home.**1-Tuner PIP: This TV has one built-in tuner, which does not allow PIP to function in the same mode. You can only watch an analog TV broadcast  in the sub picture window while watching a different video source from the Component, HDMI or PC input on the TV's main window. You can change the size of the PIP window and even view the two pictures as a 4:3 or 16:9 split screen. You can also move the PIP window to each corner of the screen. In addition, you can switch the audio over to sub PIP picture window.Note: While the V-chip is in operation, the PIP function cannot be used.**Digital Signal Strength Meter: The digital signal strength meter can be used to help you find the antenna position that delivers the highest HDTV digital signal strength.**Analog Channel Fine Tuning: The fine tuning feature allows you to manually adjust analog channels for optimal reception. A separate fine tuning setting may be put into the TV's memory for each analog channel.**Input Source Names: You can assign a name for the component connected to each of the inputs. When input naming is completed, you will no longer have to remember which component is connected to each input when selecting a source to watch. Source names you can choose from include: VCR, DVD, Cable STB, Satellite STB, PVR STB, AV Receiver, Game, Camcorder, PC, TV, IPTV, Blue-Ray, and  HD DVD.**Channel Labels: Each analog channel programmed into memory can be labeled with a name up to 5 characters. Digital channel names are already assigned and cannot be edited.**Favorite Channel: You can create a list of your favorite channels and recall the list using the FAV.CH button on the remote.**Program Reserve: The television allows you to reserve a program you want to watch at a later time which changes the channel automatically to the reserved program at the selected time while you are watching another channel.**V-Chip:The V-Chip automatically locks out programs that are deemed inappropriate for children. You can set up the parameters for the V-Chip using the TV Parental Guidelines, MPAA (movie) ratings, Canadian French, or Canadian English ratings systems. The V-Chip function is protected by a 4-digit PIN.**Energy Saver: This feature adjust the brightness of the TV in order to reduce power consumption. When watching TV at night, set the Energy Saver feature to High to reduce eye fatigue as well as power consumption. You can set this feature to High, Medium, Low or Off.**Sleep Timer: The sleep timer switches the television off after a specified amount of time. The sleep timer can be set to 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, or 180 minutes.**On/Off Timers: The three On/Off timers allow you to program the television to turn itself on and off by selecting a specific on time and a specific off time. You also choose the On Timer's channel and Volume. The on and off timers work independently of one another.**On/Off Melody: A unique melody plays when the TV is turned on and off. You can turn this feature off if you preferINPUT/OUTPUT:**Quad HDMI Inputs: The Samsung LCD television features three HDMI inputs on the rear-panel and one HDMI input on the side-panel. The HDMI 2 input can also be used to connect a device with a DVI output (a DVI-to-HDMI adapter cable is necessary). If a DVI-equipped device is used, separate audio cables will also be needed from the device to the "DVI In" RCA stereo audio jacks. No audio cables are needed for an HDMI-equipped device. The HDMI inputs can also be used to connect a PC to this TV. The HDMI jacks will accept 1080p, 1080i, 720p, and 480p signals.**Dual Component Video: The two Component Video jacks will accept 1080i, 720p, 480p, and 480i signals. Separate RCA stereo audio inputs are provided for each Component Video input. The Component Video 1 input can also be used as a composite video input.**Digital Audio: The optical digital output (with plastic cover) on the rear panel will output Dolby Digital (when available) or 2 channel PCM.**PC: This input consists of a stereo mini-jack and an analog RGB (D-Sub 15-pin) jack. This jack allows you to connect a personal computer with a D-Sub 15-pin output. When using the RGB (D-Sub 15-pin) jack, you must use the PC Audio 3.5mm input for your audio connection.**LAN (Ethernet): The television's rear-panel Ethernet port allows you to connect an Ethernet cable from the TV to your home PC's Network to obtain Samsung's InfoLink Service.**EX-LINK:The EX-LINK port connects to an optional Samsung wall mount bracket which allows you to adjust the TV viewing angle using the provide remote control.**Wise-Link: This side-panel USB port allows you to connect a USB mass storage device to the television so you can view photo files and play audio files through the TV.**Side Panel A/V Input: The television features a side-panel A/V input that consists of a composite video or s-video connection and a stereo audio connection.**Headphone Jack: Also on the side-panel is a 3.5mm headphone jack for connecting an optional set of headphones. The TV's speakers automatically mute when a pair of headphones are connected to this jack.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, not so great sound
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose the Samsung LN52A650 over the Sony Bravia XBR4because of the great reviews by other customers and the Touch of Color cabinet. The picture is as good as others reported. But inquirers shouldknow the sound comes out the bottom. Maybe if mounted on a wall it wouldproject forward but in my set up it has as much sound in the room behind asin the room in front. After more research I opted for a Samsung 2.1 home theater system. I chose the HT-X200 because I wanted something simple andthe "anynet" feature. It has good sound, not the full 5.1 affect but does a good job and I am happy with the whole set up now.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely stunning...but...
Reviews.Author: Ohio Wolverine
Reviews.Content: The picture, sound, everything about this TV is absolutely stunning.  Well worth the price.  Amazon's shipping and service were excellent (I live near their Kentucky hub, so had the set in 2 days).  My only issue is with the Picture-in-Picture (PIP).  Amazon/Samsung (which probably wrote the copy) need to make it clearer on the website that the PIP only works if one of the signals is analog.  Unless you have analog cable or getting analog OTA signals, it's useless.  I'd really give this 4 7/8 stars, but can't give it 5 because it's not perfect.  Unfortunately, there's nothing between 4 and 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever - better than plasma
Reviews.Author: D. DiMarzio "David"
Reviews.Content: Amazon is the best place to buy a TV.  I ordered this on a Tuesday and was watching TV Friday evening. Free shipping that only took 3 days?...WOW  The Picture quality is excellent, and I believe it's better than plasma, trust me I own one,  much brighter, no glare, weighs less and saves you $$ on electricity. What more can you ask for, amazing.Don't hesitate on the price because if the price goes down within 30 days of purchase they will refund you without  question, trust me I've already received 2 rebates totaling $260.00.

Reviews.Title: This TV is perfect!!!
Reviews.Author: Joe Mantiera "Joe"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv and just got it today. From what I have seen so far, this is by far the best deal I have ever gotten. The price on amazon was about 300 dollars cheaper then I have found anywhere else and I saved on sales tax and shipping.( the price dropped 243 dollars since i ordered it and Amazon quickly gave me a refund without any hassle at all). The delivery guy came today and took it out of the box and made sure everthing was perfect with it before he left. He also took the box and garbage with him.I fired it upand the picture is absolutely beautifull. I am have it set up with a Blu-ray player and a Onkyo 7.1 surround sound system. It looks and sounds amazing. I recommend this to anyone looking for a new tv.

Reviews.Title: Home Theatre Heaven...
Reviews.Author: Rocket Surgeon "Crazy Eddie"
Reviews.Content: My Series 6 52" Samsung LCD must already have the new firmware, as in many weeks I've not seen any auto-shutoff yet. The 120Hz, 4ms, Touch of Red is, for my opinion, the BEST LCD on the market, surpassed only by the Series 7 add-ons, but still has the exact same picture quality.I purchased a Samsung upscaling 1080P DVD player that was perfectly mated straight out of the box, and the TV remote already worked for both.This TV puts all other brands currently available to shame. I checked them all out at the local Best Buy, then saved a ton of money at Amazon. I waited years for the house big screen, having a dolby speaker setup already built into the ceiling when finishing the rec room. IMAX has got nothing on my cave as the 1000 watt surround system gives me perfect Home Theatre Heaven. Worth every penny, and other brands costing more will be a year or three catching up. Thank you Samsung, Amazon and 6ave. I can rewatch my entire DVD collection like I'm sitting at the IMAX seeing it for the first time. Not a single complaint.

Reviews.Title: Best TV on the Market Today
Reviews.Author: G. Aven
Reviews.Content: I am an IT guy who researches for months before I make a purchase like this.  This TV is everything that it is advertized to be.  The picture is the best on the market today.  I watched it side by side with the Sony XBr4 and several other leading brands.  The touch of red is very stylish but not over bearing.  I have a blu-ray playstation 3, and HD FIOS and the TV picture is perfect.  I also have an amplified external antenna and the HD picture over the air is awesome as well.  What else is there to say.The only complaint I have over my old Sony HD is that the sound component in does not work unless there is also a video source.  In other words I can not just plug my ipod or sound from my computer without also having a video signal.  Oh well I guess I will have to also buy a 7:1 home theater system.  I was using an old amp and speakers.(1 Month update) - Connected my HP dv6000 laptop with internal HDMI HD card and the resolution is fantastic.  Connected new Panasonic Lumix DMC TZ5 with 16:9 pictures at 7.5 M and 4:3 at 9.1M also fantastic picture.  My iPod now plays music if also showing a slide show so I have not upgraded my sound system yet.  The SRS surround sound option is also great.  The Playstation web browser is extremely clear (1080p), better than my HP laptop which does have a lower resolution (720p).I have seen some comments about "jitters" for the NBA playoffs, this is probably someone who did not set their auto motion setting correctly, or does not have HD.  My FIOS HD for the playoffs is unbelievable (no "jitters" or "flashes" as one reviewer noted) it is so good.  My delivery was also flawless, early, efficient, and clean, with pleasant people.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: S. Delahoyde
Reviews.Content: Nothing short of incredible. The picture, particularly when you're watching a Blu-ray movie, is just jaw-dropping. And it even handles standard-def stuff off the cable box (even after the heavy compression with the DVR) really well. 'Touch of Color' thing is nice too -- very subtle, but sets it apart from other TVs and makes the set look a little more like a piece of furniture. Only gripe at all is with the remote, particularly when using the little round slide wheel. It could use a little more resistance, as it tends to fly by the option you're wanting a little too quickly. Luckily, it also operates as a push button device, so you can just as easily scroll up and down by clicking on the wheel.We ordered (straight from Amazon) on a Wednesday and it said that it would be about two weeks before it shipped. Turned out, it was there by the following Monday, which made us very, very happy. Been loving the thing ever since.

Reviews.Title: Don't Hesitate
Reviews.Author: BBCleveland
Reviews.Content: We have had this set for over two weeks now. Our initial opinion remains unchanged - The picture quality is simply phenomenal! And we have yet to make any of the picture adjustments recommended by CNET, AVS and other sites. Seeing HD on this set makes you hunger for more HD programming. We have experienced none of the shutdown, purple haze, flashlight, mura, etc. problems reported here and elsewhere so perhaps Samsung has resolved some of their early production issues. In fact, we have no problems to report at this time. Our set came with the 1003.M firmware update installed (there is one more recent update that seems a little buggy so I won't download that unless needed). I selected the set after exhaustive research online plus in-person side by side comparison. I chose it over the Sony XBR4 and various top quality plasmas. The Series 6 colors are vivid and crisp, the blacks are black and the motion is true. With this LCD set, there is no lengthy break-in period and no potential burn-in problems that are still reported for new model plasmas. In my opinion, there is currently no other product that can match the picture quality and feature set of this set at anything approaching the current market price. The much-discussed, red, 'Touch of Color' bezel is 'Much Ado About Nothing'. It's so subtle and tastefully done, I don't know what all the discussion is about, positive or negative. The Amazon purchase and delivery process was effortless. CEVA had it set up in our bedroom within one week of our order. Even though our original purchase price was the best available from a quality vendor, Amazon has already processed three pricing credits for us totaling $180 - as easy as can be.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, Excellent service from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Striider "Striider"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this set on a Wednesday and had it in my home on Monday.  CEVA wasn't able to deliver until Friday, so I went and picked it up myself because I couldn't wait that long!  There were no hassles picking it up at their facility, which was only 15 minutes away from my house.  The box was in perfect condition with no marks or scrapes to worry about.This set is amazing in every way!  From the moment I turned it on, I knew I had a keeper.  At first the picture was very bright and cartoonish, but after turning down the brightness and adjusting some other things, it is perfect for everyday content (HD cable).  A small warning...every artifact present in the source material to this TV will be obvious to you right away.  My wife doesn't notice things like that, but I do.  But what's more important is that all content will look better than you have likely seen.  Even standard definition looks MUCH better on the Samsung than my old HDTV.  Do yourself another favor, and purchase a blu-ray player to really see what this tv is capable of.  Blu-ray looks absolutely realistic and beautiful on this set.  I have walked up close to it many times to look closely for defects, and can find no flaws.  I have no detectable clouding and no flashlighting at all.  Some people are complaining about glare, but it doesn't bother me a bit.  My last set had a gloss front too, so maybe I am used to it, but only on very, very dark scenes when the sun is shining outside my kitchen do I even notice the glare.  This TV is in my living room, not a dedicated home theater.As far as features and settings, this set has more bells and whistles than a brand new Escalade.  I haven't quite figured out the AMP feature yet, and on my standard setting I keep it on low and things look great.Movie mode looks a bit dull at first, but you quickly get used to it and feel like you are watching in a theater.  Somehow it softens things around the edges, while still keeping the picture sharp and clear.  Magic maybe?When I first hooked it up, I plugged it into my home network, and didn't have to configure a thing.  All the weather functions and stock prices and news just worked.  Simplicity is nice to see in a set this complex, and the interface for the internet functions are easy to use and customize too.Enjoy your new set - this one sets the standard for everyone else!

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal
Reviews.Author: J. Cavaliere
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for about a week now, it replaced a 1st generation Mitsu DLP.  The picture quality is an order of magnitude greater, and I was already impressed by the 1080i on my wd-62525.  The settings out of the box need to be adjusted; everything looks a little washed out/cartoony at first.  However I found a great list of settings for close to reference quality picture.  I've included them below my review if anyone else might want/need them.Ceva's delivery service was excellent.  They called me 2 days after I ordered the TV to schedule delivery, which was a week before Amazon showed the estimated delivery date. When it arrived, they took the TV out of the box, put it on my entertainment center, and patiently waited as I went through several screens to test the TV for any possible defects.I will never buy electronics from a store again. And, as of right now, Amazon has a loyal customer for all my home theater needs.  I would definitely recommend picking this TV up here if you're interested in buying it. On top of the great service, I couldn't get anyone to touch the price by close to $1000.Enjoy!--Picture menuMode: MovieBacklight: 3Contrast: 93Brightness: 44Sharpness: 0Color: 52Tint: G50/R50Detailed settings submenuB

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Tom Mensch
Reviews.Content: Best picture of all the 52" lcds I've seen.  Crisp, sharp, looks good even before I've adjusted it at all.  No dead pixels.Plays a sound when turned on/off (there might be an option to turn it off but I haven't found it).Color around the edge isn't too noticeable except in bright direct light.Can't give arbitrary names to inputs; must select from a list and there is only one 'Game' selection, so if you have XBox 360, PS3, and Wii you have to guess which is which when selecting inputs (or remember the input number).Switching inputs is not bad on this tv, much better and less annoying than other tvs I've used.

Reviews.Title: WOW !!!
Reviews.Author: Pilihp Nivrap
Reviews.Content: This LN52A650 is an absolute knock out LCD TV.  I have nothing but praise for the picture quality and did extensive research before buying.  Bravia fans, eat your heart out because this picture quality leaves you in the dust.  Buy one and you won't regret it. The delivery service that Amazon used was efficient and professional.  Amazon is the way to go as BB and other bricks and morter stores can't come close to Amazon's price and shipping resources. TV is number one in my book especially at the price.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD!
Reviews.Author: L. Howe
Reviews.Content: I've spent more than 6 months researching for a 1080p LCD to replace my current 2-year old 42 inch Olevia 720p LCD.  A couple of months ago I narrowed it down to either a 650 or 750 Samsung based upon all of the positive reviews these two models have gotten everywhere.  I followed the AVS Forums for these sets, and although there have been some issues noted about these LCDs, it appeared that they got the worst of them fixed with the latest software updates.  So, although I had decided upon a Samsung, I still couldn't decide upon which model.  I also was debating about which size, 46 or 52 inch, to get.After much internal debating and comparisons at brick and mortor stores, I finally decided upon the 52 inch 650.  There really was only one feature of the 750 that interested me at all, and that was the DLNA option, but after reading some reviews of that technology, particularly with the Samsung LCD, I determined that it wasn't quite ready for prime-time, so that ruled out the 750 for me. The only decision left was what size to get.  Since I currently had a 42 inch, I was thinking a 46 would be a nice increase in size, but after viewing both the 46 and 52 Samsung side by side, and thinking how small the 46 looked, I decided to go for the larger model.  I'm happy I did too!  Although I have a small living room, my viewing distance is still 11 feet.  While others might disagree when they see it, I don't feel that the 52 inch overwhelms the room.Although I could have found this TV for a lower starting price, and no tax (I live in NY) at another website, I decided that Amazon's free "white glove" delivery was the decider.  Even with the NY tax added to the price, no brick and mortor could touch it, and based upon the reviews here on Amazon, I felt more comfortable purchasing a large priced item from here than from another website.  I have to say though I was a bit disappointed in the local delivery service (Eagle).  Only one guy delivered the set, so in the interest of not damaging the set, I ended up helping the guy bring it into my house, and set it up on the stand.  He also told me that they didn't hookup the sets, which seemed contrary to what I was reading on Amazon's reviews, but since I only had to connect the power and one HDMI cable, that wasn't a big deal.  He did stay and let me go through some visual inspections and check for a couple of the issues that I had read some people have had with this set.  Mine was PERFECT -- YA!!  I am very happy with this LCD TV.  The colors are tremendous, and the blacks are sooo deep, at least as deep as I've ever seen in an LCD TV. I think I made the right choice!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: A. Mizrahi "gadget man"
Reviews.Content: I am a bit reluctant to write this review because I am superstitious and do not want to jinx it, but this TV is great.  It arived ahead of schedule, and the white glove delivery people (they had gloves but not really white - sorry about that) brought it on the elevator to my unit, unpacked it, placed it on my cabinet where it goes, and turned it on to see that it was OK.  The whole bit about having it shipped (from who knows where) as opposed to buying it at a local store, was one of my main worries, and it turned out just fine.Now to the TV itself.  The picture is fabulous.  I can not coment on the sound because I have the sound come through my surround sound system, and have turned it off at the TV.I have 3 sources of propgramming.  The main one is Direct TV HD, and it comes in at 1080i when the programming is in HD.  The picture quality is excellent.  My second source of programming is a Samsung blu-ray DVD player (1080p) and it is fabulous.  The third source, which was a big surprise to me, was over the air TV.  I am situated in the center of the city of Denver, and even with a really rinky-dink antenna I get all local digital channels really well.Only one word of warning - with this (and any other) HD TV, you will notice that with programing that is not HD, particularly old classic programs, the picture actually looks worse that it might have on a good quality analogue TV.  Right now having a program be in HD has become a significant criterea for me to decide to watch it.I recommend this set very much.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LCD HDTV - Great Amazon Price!
Reviews.Author: Westwood
Reviews.Content: I had been debating about purchasing a new flat panel TV for quite some time. Once I made the decision to go with LCD instead of plasma, I began reading tons of information and reviews online. It was clear that Samsung had something special here with this unit.The 650 series had everything I was looking for. It had 4ms response time, 4 HDMI inputs, deep blacks, and 120Hz frame rate. It was the favored flat panel of reviewers everywhere, both professional and consumer. Samsung I believe, has caught and now passed Sony in the technology, features and most important, performance in their LCD HDTV's. And I might add, hundreds of dollars cheaper! Samsung clearly gives more value per dollar.Amazon had the best price anywhere I'd seen, and in the days following my purchase, the price was lowered even further. Amazon customer service was always friendly and happy to refund the difference. CEVA was prompt to call me for scheduleing delivery, and allowed me to take delivery on a Saturday, so I wouldn't have to miss work.Now that I've been viewing this unit for the past couple of weeks, I can promise you, I've never seen better picture quality. Its just fantastic!I've read some people complain about the remote control, and it concerned me. Yeah, I don't really like the wheel, but its not as bad as I thought it would be.Overall, I couldn't be more happy with this TV, and the entire buying experience with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Jim Mckee
Reviews.Content: this is a great tv. picture and sound exceeded my expectations. some earlier reviews complained about the sound but in my opinion it is very good. white glove delivery service is great. i ordered this tv may 25, 2008. may 26 was memorial day holiday but the tv shipped that day anyway. the delivery service called me the afternoon of may 28, only 2 days later and wanted to deliver the tv the next day. you can't expect any better service than that. i watched the delivery man unload the tv. it was strapped to the side of his box van so it couldn't move or bounce around. he unloaded it on to a 4 wheel dolly and wheeled it right up to my back door, unpacked it and connected it to make sure it was working properly. he even offered to help me put it in my entertainment center but i wasn't ready for that. after ordering the tv the price dropped and i was refunded $148.72 by amazon. this is a great company to deal with. do not be afraid to order this tv from amazon. i saved almost $800.00 from the local retailers price. i don't think you can find a better deal or a better tv. you might find a better price from some of the unknown online retailers but i suggest you pay close attention to their consumer reviews.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52 inch 650 LCD
Reviews.Author: TV Crazy
Reviews.Content: Dealing with Amazon on this purchase was so simple and easy. I have never made such a large ticket item purchase with Amazon before and was nervous. But everything went smooth and delivery took only 6 days.I shopped around and no one could beat Amazon price. Sears would match it but wanted $60 for delivery. Amazon offered free shipping to boot.The product is awesome. Very satisfied with the quality and set-up was easier than I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: Good while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Midwest IT Guy
Reviews.Content: First of all, I bought this TV from Amazon several weeks ago for a hundred dollars more and just got a refund on the difference. So you can feel very secure that you're getting a good price from Amazon. Other than that, the TV was a little slow in arriving (9 days to Chicago), but it was free shipping so what do you expect?As far as the TV itself, the best thing by far is the picture. I haven't even properly calibrated my TV yet and it looks great. Standard def looks much better and HD looks simply incredible. You've got tons of connections on the back and I don't see myself running out of spaces to plug things soon. The InfoLink feature is a neat addition. I've got my TV hooked up to a wireless bridge and I'm able to check the weather at the push of a button.A couple of things to keep in mind though. If you plan to wall mount this (as I did) make sure you have a long philips screwdriver. The TV comes with the stand already attached and the screws are very deep. Secondly, be aware that the PIP on this TV is practically useless since one of your sources has to be an HDMI or component source and even then you may only view analog channels on the other source. Other than those minor details, I've no complaints.*UPDATE 10/2011*Unfortunately, my set is now afflicted with the power problems you see many other reviewers complaining about. It seems Samsung TVs across several models have problems with their capacitators failing after a short time. The symptom is the TV will not power on and just keep clicking. It looks to be a very common problem and the fix is to replace the failed capacitators for a few bucks plus labor. If you are comfortable with de-soldering and soldering on a circuit board, you can save money and do this yourself, but for others, this repair will cost you a couple of hundred.Since the failure in many cases happens after 3 years or more, you will inevitably have to foot the bill as was what Samsung support told me. Apparently, though some customers have had their TVs repaired by Samsung outside of warranty, just not myself. Which sets qualify or do not qualify for this courtesy repair does not seem clear. Support told me although my model was the same as other customers, the part installed was different. I asked for the part number that they were doing the repair for and mine, but they said they would have to escalate the issue. I told them to escalate, so now I am in a waiting game. I would recommend you try to contact Samsung support and see if they can repair your set even if its warranty has expired. If not, then at least they have another complaint on file so that they can see, this is not just some isolated incident.As a result, I am dropping my original review from 5 stars to 3. The performance when it works is great, but I was one of the many to get a set with poor parts and although Samsung support was polite, they failed to explain why they would fix some TVs but not others.

Reviews.Title: Huge disappointment!
Reviews.Author: R. Scheuer
Reviews.Content: Based on all the positive reviews, purchased this Samsung LCD TV. The TV arrived with no problems, very good delivery service. Removed the TV from the shipping container, set it up and turned it on. What an awesome picture, both HDTV with our Direct TV hook up and Blu Ray disc with the Samsung blu ray player we purchased with the $150 discount Amazon offered.Unfortunately, the TV only works for the first 15 minutes and continually turns on and off. Updated the firmware per Samsung support and still does not work. Samsung support said it would be 10 days until an authorized dealer could send someone out to repair the set. Amazon did offer to replace the TV, but no delivery until at least the 24th of December. While trying to make a decision about an exchange vs repair, the local authorized dealer called and said they would have someone within 3 days to repair the set. So we went for repair, repair guys show up only to tell us they can't actually repair the TV without hauling it into their shop. Another week. Too late for a speedy exchange, and if the set is not repairable, we still have to wait for an exchange from Amazon. After doing a little research on the web and Samsungs' own forums, it appears that this problem is common.If I could do it again, I'd get a SONY! Do a little research yourself before buying this model. No problem with AMAZON at all.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Smell Fire "Smell"
Reviews.Content: After looking at flat screen TV's for several years, I finally decided to make a purchase. I usually spend way too much time researching these types of things.  The Samsung and Sony TV's seemed to stack up the best.  I had been looking at the Samsung LNT5271F quite closely, but was afraid to make the purchase due to the dead pixel problems it was reported to have.  The Sony TV's had that unpleasant looking clear plastic edge around the TV.  I just couldn't commit to any of them.Then I noticed this Samsung LN52A650 that had the 120Hz refresh rate.  I did some research into it and was very impressed with the great reviews.  I couldn't find one locally to look at - so I did something I normally wouldn't do. . . I bought this TV sight unseen from Amazon.Without getting into all of the details that others have written, I can tell you that I love this TV!  This TV has an incredible picture.Buyers won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV while it lasted, but lasted less than 5 years
Reviews.Author: tim747
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer said, quality issues on this TV.  I am going to stay away from Samsung product going forward.  The capacitor problem that is well advertised on the internet, but Samsung claims only impacts less than 1% of TVs, disabled my TV over the last week by causing it to cycle on and off.  After the repair guy fixed that problem by replacing capacitors, the screen barely turned on with any brightness.  The TV become unusable.Samsung says they will only cover the capacitor and no other parts.  Tough situation for Samsung because I have bought 5 TV's from them over the last 8 years and I will be moving away from them for life!  Any company that knows there is a problem with their design and quality, but forces the customer to eat their problem doesn't deserve my loyalty.I eagerly await the LG TV I just ordered off Amazon.

Reviews.Title: In regards to ON/OFF cycle or power loop, from bad capacitors
Reviews.Author: mark a flessner
Reviews.Content: Bought mine 37 months ago... went to turn on and just started with the on/off cycle power loop, and never did anything else. No warning signs.After looking on here at the bad one star reviews, I could tell the majority of them pointed to the same issue with the capacitors being low quality.I contacted Samsung first via IM chat (pretty nice actually), then was given a number to call after acknowledgement that it was a known issue.Phone customer service from Samsung again confirmed it was a known issue for that model number. They stated support of a one-time repair to replace the bad capacitors at no charge, and performed in home (also nice). A local party will contact within 1-2 business days to set up repair visit.Called on a Friday evening, local repair called back Monday morning, repair successfully done by Tuesday afternoon.While the repairman worked on my tv, I asked his opinion of Samsung. He said he'd buy from them again, no doubt. Somehow that made me feel somehow better (or rejustified in my purchase).Anyway, I'm leaving this a one star review for any others that still have to go through this same ordeal. My personal rating is really 5 stars, even after this minor hiccup. I can say I feel lucky the repair went so smooth. However I must give kudos to Samsung for backing up their product with great service.*****-

Reviews.Title: SUPERB PICTURE!  Amazon WHITE glove service, a JOKE!
Reviews.Author: S. DeStefano
Reviews.Content: It's only been a week since receiving the LN52A650 and all I need to say is what an INCREDIABLE picture. This is my second Samsung (the other is a FPT-5084, 50" Plasma, bought last Feb.) and I'm glad I choose this one.You will NOT be disappointed.However, the WHITE glove service, well that's another story.  Yes, it was free and perhaps on that point alone I shouldn't be complaining, but then again I didn't write the "policy".The delivery van pulls up to the house and out comes an elderly (no offense) man, probably in his 60's.  Oh yeah, did I mention "man", that's right one delivery person. So after answering the front door, I said to him "are you by yourself"?  Yeap, just me, he says.  So I had to decide right there whether or not to offer him some help, otherwise, I'm not sure how the TV was going to make it up the front steps and into the house safely.  So I asked him if he needed some help and he very quickly replied, "Absolutely".Are you kidding me Amazon?  If this had been my wife at home or if I was physically unable to carry this bulky 100lb box up a flight of stairs, what would happen then?  What was he going to do drag it up the front walk, up the stairs and into my living room?Then after getting the TV in the front door he was quick to hand me the clipboard for a signature so he could be on his way.  When I asked him that we probably should take a look inside he replied, "you'll be all set, if there's any problems just give us a call and we'll come pick it up.OH, so what about the part of taking the unit out of box, set it up in any room (including 2nd floor), make sure it works and take away any packaging?  Isn't that what's written in your "WHITE" glove service policy?So Amazon, it sounds like you need to take a better look at your shipping vendors, some people get the true service and others get screwed!  Yeah, it was free!  That about all it's worth too!PS. The TV however, is awesome and deserves the five stars!2/1/09  Price is down another $120.00, what a bummer.  Amazon.com should bring back their 30 day price guarantee!

Reviews.Title: Best 50-60" High Definition TV For The Price
Reviews.Author: K. Voiles
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for a couple of weeks now, and while I won't claim that I know everything there is to know about the settings on the TV or that I'm done tweaking the picture, I CAN say without a doubt that the picture is superb.  Straight out of the box, the colors are brilliant but not oversaturated.  The picture at 1080i (which is what most local stations are broadcasting over the air) is crisp and looks amazing!  We will likely not bother with satellite/cable for a good while, seeing how many stations the internal digital tuner picks up in our area with our rooftop antenna (Twin Cities metro area).  We are currently getting about 19 digital channels, and nearly all of them are sharp and come in very clear and detailed.The ToC bezel on the TV is hardly noticeable in our walkout basement.  In fact, I don't notice the red coloring at all while it's on the wall.  In a well-lit room I should think it would be quite subtle and elegant, and nothing to complain about.On the topic of complaints I've read by some here, I'd like to address the remote control for the TV.  Are you guys serious?  You paid $2k for an awesome TV and you're complaining about the remote?!  That's just being nitpicky and to be honest, I disagree whole-heartedly with those opinions.  I think the remote is quite modern and stylish.  It looks sleek and sophisticated; perfect for this TV.  The delay when using the jog dial is a little frustrating, but really, it's a jog wheel on a wireless remote people.  Does anyone REALLY expect to not have a bit of a delay as the TV picks up what you are doing with the wheel?  They couldn't have implemented the design any better on a wireless device.  The other major complaint I've read about is about the glare on the screen.  This is ludicrous.  Yes, there is glare on the screen when it is turned off, but when the TV is on, the glare disappears.  Does anyone really care about the glare when it's off?  That's just silly.  We have a large window and glass doors less than 12' away from the right side of our TV and have no problems with glare.  If there is a glare problem, try changing the brightness/contrast/backlight settings on the TV!  Don't downgrade the rating of the TV just because you're unable or unwilling to tweak the settings to accomodate your surroundings, folks.  It's unfair to mark down the TV for this in my view.The on-screen menu is a joy to use.  Easy to navigate, nice to look at and has pretty much any setting you could want on an LCD TV.  You can even tweak the individual colors to get the picture exactly the way you like it, which is a huge bonus in my opinion.I bought this TV from Sears [...] , so I can't comment on Amazon's delivery service.  Yeah, I paid tax, but I'd rather be able to walk into a store with any product issues than deal with the headache of having to return it to an online shop and wait for a new one to be shipped out to me, etc.I've played Xbox 360 and PS3 games as well as streamed TV show episodes from my PC (via the PC/PS3 wirelessly), and have watched standard def (Series of Unfortunate Events) and Blu-ray (Transformers) movies on it, and everything has looked fantastic so far.  120Hz really does improve standard def TV, sports and gaming.  I turn it down to "low" or turn it off for movie watching, because it does look a bit wierd with movies when it is on.  The "soap opera" effect is pretty bad when the setting is on "high" while watching movies/TV.  Some folks might like this, but most people I talk to don't like it set on "high" for movies or normal TV viewing.  Gaming and animated movies are another story though.  120 Hz works excellently with these applications.All of my video sources are passed through or upconverted via my Denon 789/1909 receiver, and as stated on the AVS forums there is no issue with the HDMI handshake between the receiver and this TV.  Apparently Onkyo and Yamaha receivers have had problems with dropping the signal or clipping the picture when passing it to this TV, but I can confirm that no such problems exist with the Denon (thankfully!).While the TV is not overly heavy, it is large and awkward.  3 of us mounted it on the wall, one to guide it onto the mount and two to hold it up, but we might have gotten away with just two of us holding/mounting at the same time.  One of the screws didn't want to come out of the base at first, so two of us had to tilt the TV back and lightly jiggle it while the third person worked the base enough for the last screw to come out.  Kind of a pain, but we got the stand off in the end.  I highly recommend getting a tilting mount for this TV if you are wall-mounting it, because you will not be able to reach the inputs/outputs on the back of it otherwise.  I bought a tilting mount for 42 - 63" screens at Monoprice for $35 (don't ever overpay in a store for a mount!).  Had to buy different lag bolts, as the included ones were far too wide for my application (dry wall with 2" wood and poured cement behind it).  I bought six 2 1/2" long cement lag bolts (5/16" diameter) and rented a hammer drill with a 3/8 cement bit to drill the holes big enough to accomodate the wall anchors.  Worked a treat, and the TV mount is securely hung on the wall (my brother-in-law even hung on the thing to make sure it wasn't going to come off!).Hope some of this has helped folks with making a purchasing decision on a new LCD TV.  I'm thoroughly pleased with it, and I don't even have it completely tweaked to perfection yet. I'm not sure I'm going to have to change much honestly.You won't get a better TV in this size range at this price.

Reviews.Title: Don't even bother looking at other LCD TVs
Reviews.Author: iMinnesotan
Reviews.Content: After more that 500 reviews of this HDTV what more can I say? The 650 and 750 series TVs just popped amongst the other LCD TVs in the stores. The picture is bright and the colors are deep and rich. I'm writing this while watching the Broncos/Chargers game and I see no frame jitter, either. I purchased through Amazon.Some sales people tried to talk me into other brands because of the glossy screen and since our room is full of windows but I purchased it anyway. Do not think glossy as in glass TV tube; it doesn't even come close to reflecting light like glass. Even with sunlight coming in from three sides of the room and with the kitchen lights on over our shoulders glare is absolutely a non-issue.I have to admit that my old Toshiba TV had better sound. I have since switched my setup to always play TV audio through the AV receiver and this configuration makes sense, as the rich sound complements the big picture. I recommend either purchasing a sound bar or playing audio through a receiver.The 650 and 750 series TVs are so popular that the half dozen people that I know who chose LCDs for their HDTVs all have them and my sister just purchased the LN40A650 as well.For those building a system, here is my configuration:Samsung LN52A650Onkyo TX-SR706 AV ReceiverTiVo HD XLMirage Omnisat v2 speakers: FS, S8 sub, OS sateliteOld DVD playerBlue ray player eventually

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Luis Hernandez "DL"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought long and hard about this purchase.  We read many comments that were very helpful to us.  I hope these notes will help others.  The Samsung LN52A650 is a beautiful set.  The "touch of color" was a concern, but the accent is absolutely gorgeous.  One important feature we considrerd was the expected life of the cold cathode flourescent light (CCFL) and ease/cost of replacement. Samsung engineered this set so that the flourescent backlight is easily replaced.  We expect to replce it within 3-5 years.  The order/purchase through Amazon was flawless.  Excellent price, service and delivery.  We have been viewing our new tv for two weeks, and we are blown away by the vibrant colors and features this set provides.  We hooked up our sound through existing home theatre (Onkyo amp and speakers, Infinity subwoofer, LG DV/VCR player/recorder).  Sound and picture is remarkable.  There is no going back to regular tv.  HD content channels are the only way to appreciate this set.  I urge everyone to consider the 52" over the 46" screen.  At a viewing distance of 8-10', the 52" is perfect.  We also recommend you hang the set on the wall, especially if you live in earthquake prone areas.  The included stand is o.k., but we worried that a shake ot a bump would knock the set over.  Best to hang it on a wall for peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Great Product...
Reviews.Author: Edwin Osorio
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv on Nov 9. It arrived on Nov 15, pilot freight guys were great. They brought it up to my apartment, unpacked it (checking for broken screen) and they were off. I was sceptical about spending this much money online but I saved over $500 by buying on Amazon. will buy again and I just can't put in words how good this TV looks.PS: just note that although Amazon doesn't have the 1 month price protection anymore; they will honor the price on their website up until the time you get the TV delivered.(TV was 2019 on Nov 9 whent to 1908 on Nov 10. Amazon refunded the diference) FYI!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV with a "Little" Problem
Reviews.Author: D. Osborn "north coast guy"
Reviews.Content: GOOD NEWS: Make no mistake, the A650 is a great TV. BAD NEWS: the A650 developed a glitch on the screen shortly after I purchased it from Amazon. GOOD NEWS: going online to Samsung.com got me an extra 3 months on my warranty. BAD NEWS: Samsung.com customer support sucks. It took weeks to finally get a repairman in. GOOD NEWS: the A650 got fixed (it took two visits by the repairman to figure out what was wrong (the display) but he got it working and it looks great).

Reviews.Title: Just Awesome, can't think of a more creative word
Reviews.Author: Raoul Watson
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV --that about sums it up. Now I will go through the details. First, have the software upgrade available. I have received two of these TV's and the first one didn't require, the second one does. Simply download the driver from the Samsung support site and place it on a USB drive. If you select sw update from the setup menu, it will tell you if the version is the same, so it won't do it unless needed.I have a basement with a window and a light right on top of the TV set. This is the first big advantage of this TV --namely the construction material of the screen. The low reflective layer simply ignores the external light source and it is almost as of it absorbs the light. The result is that the image from the TV is unaffected by the external light. It is as vivid regardless whether it's dark or daylight shining on the TV --truly amazing.Another amazing fact of this material is it allows viewing from a very obtuse angle without losing clarity. Remember those airplane mounted LCD monitors which turns black when viewed from an angle? No such thing with this TV.The picture simply looks fake. This is not a negative comment. Remember those magazine advertisements which always claim "simulated TV picture"? They basically cut and paste a picture to the TV screen. guess what, this TV looks fake. It looks like someone took a large poster of clear photo, and put it on the screen. Simply flawless.I have played with the settings and found that the default "standard" setting is the best for my taste. You can make the screen a lot brighter if you want. I strongly suggest to not set the brightness too high which may lead to clouding. I have read reviews complaining about lcd clouding --where on very dark solid scenes, an uneven brightness is visible on the screen. Clouding is common due to the way LCD matrix works. One way to combat this effect is to avoid watching your television in completely dark rooms. Turn on a lamp with a low light setting to keep a small amount of ambient light in the room. Some LCD manufacters offer ambient light built in to their television (such as Philips Ambilight) but this option is not available on this TV. So if you review 100 different TV's (even though they are all the same model), it is not uncommon to find one or two sets which has worse lcd clouding issues than the other. Mine is just perfect.The response time and 120hz made a big difference. A tv with 60 hz refreshes the screen 60 times a second. On an LCD screen, a high action picture can produce a blur simply because the refresh cannot cath up to the changes of the picture composition. Those days are over. 120 times per second the image is updated so it doesn't matter what movement or action you got on the screen --it remains picture perfect sharp.I was rather worried about the "red" bezel but this was unnecessary. The color tone is very subtle.Watching TV is a pleasure. I appreciate the channel list which actually reads the broadcaster info (station ID and the current program). The majority of the screens are smaller than what the screen can accomodate. Most cable deliveries (unless you have FIOS) do not deliver the full 1080p but a quick blu ray disk play will eliminate doubt that this is the most amazing HDTV.The WiseLink option is extremely poorly programmed. I stuck in a USB drive with directories containing files mixed with pictures, music, etc. The system is over protective to the user and attempted to make life easy by tabulating *ALL* the pictures and music for you. I prefer to be able to browse my thumb drive directories. It is extremely annoying trying to get to a particular picture you wanted to see and having to go through literally thousands of JPG files. Remember, if you have files such as offline internet browsing files, every single button and pictures are saved as a JPG. This is a major flaw in the software rather than the TV. Hopefully the programming team can revise the software and allow direct browsing. Again, I have to clarify that this shortcoming is a software issue rather than TV performance.When the TruSurround XT SRS sound option is enabled, the sound coming from the standard speakers is very commendable. The sound surround reproduction is rich as has dimension. This is probably moot for most users who will connect an AV receiver. Just make sure you have an optical cable to connect the TV to your AV receivers so you can get the best sound from the TV to your receiver as well.One sound option that is really nice is the sound leveler which can be set to "ON" in the setup (the default is off so look for it under sound). With this option on, when you channel browse, you no longer get surprises on those channels which are much louder than its neighbors (or much lower). Adjusting the volume from channel to channel is a thing of the past. A very nice welcomed addition.For those who struggle with component video cables please don't. You are shortchanging yourself. Please connect this TV using an HDMI cable. And don't go cheap on the HDMI cable. Make sure you get one with enough bandwidth to handle 1080p. It may cost more but it's worth it.The 50,000 to 1 contrast ratio is not just hype. I have a Sharp Aquos in the house as well and I have great respect for that TV but it can't compete with the dynamic contrast ratio which makes a big difference in picture clarity. I don't think I have seen a unit which can produce a sharper picture than this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, great options, mediocre speaker sound.
Reviews.Author: M. Patel "TV Conniseur"
Reviews.Content: After months of shopping around, I bought this TV from Amazon.  I did look online at other e-tailers.  I was horrified to learn that they sold a TV w/o a stand (just the panel).  You also have to PAY for upgrade shipping at other e-tailers.  With Amazon, not only did I get the LOWEST price, but I also got a price adjustment TWICE as Amazon dropped $150.  The delivery is great, white glove AND it arrived ahead of schedule.  Overall a great TV.  Connectivity was a bit problematic on the HDMI Port 1.  After switching to another port, it worked fine.  The picture quality is as promised, if not better.  The audio quality is short of weak.  If you have a large, vaulted ceiling living room, then it will be difficult to hear the TV, so adding a sound system is a MUST.  Also, the remote with the turn-dial is difficult.  It is not immediately intuitive, esp if you are used to using buttons for navigation.  Overall a great product at the right price.  Do read the Cnet review on this to get the optimal settings.  I think it's worth the 15 minutes to become familiar w/ it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: draco_cj
Reviews.Content: Pros: Big picture, readable even in direct lightCons: Slow warm up, attracts dust, remote compatibility, HDMI switching a bit slowOverall: Outstanding value!The TV I replaced with this was a 27" CRT, so I really don't have much to compare it with, but all I can say is WOW I can see faces, read the TV guide channel from across the room - a huge improvement, literally.  I've not seen any HD format material on it yet, so I've no way to verify that except what I saw in the store on the 46" version of this set.  They were showing a Bluray disc on it.  I have only regular format cable and regular DVD material I've seen on it (oh, and a Wii using component inputs) and I can see details I've never seen before.  We'll see what happens in Feb 09 when the formats switch.OK, the cons - the CRT TV was pretty much instant on, instant off.  This one blinks about 2 sec, plays a little sound, then about 8 sec later you get a "searching for signal" screen, then your show pops up about 2 sec later.  Power off takes a bit less time, about 5 sec.  The "auto" power save feature is pretty worthless as it is driven by the material played, not by the ambient light in the room - if they had a lux sensor on the tv then you might actually save some power when the room is dark.  I've seen some folks complain about the screen as being too reflective.  Yes, it is reflective, not exactly matte finish, but I've not seen any interference from light shining through the window about 10 feet away.  The odd thing about the remote isn't the remote so much as it's compatibility with other remotes - I've tried setting up my DVD and DVR and receiver remote to operate it, and it is hit or miss whether I'll find a code that will not only turn the tv on and off (the ability to switch channels and the built in tuner are fairly useless for me since I have cable) but control the volume.  That is, just about all of the codes will allow you to press the volume up or down one step, but if you hold the volume button in one direction or the other, you only get one step of movement from the TV.  So you have to keep pushing the volume button.  A bit annoying.  Of course, this isn't an issue with the TV's remote, but it doesn't control any other components, so I rarely use it except to control the backlighting.  Finally, it seems to be a bit "smart" in that it knows when I turn on the DVD player (which is piped into the HDMI2 port) and will switch to that signal from the cable signal (which is piped into the HDMI1 port).  However, the source selection screen just sits there for about 30 sec before it goes away - a little too long if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but 2 things could be improved.
Reviews.Author: M. M. "DVD collector"
Reviews.Content: The picture is great, the style and look of the unit is clean and classy and I really like the "Touch of Color" accentaround the bezel. If I had any issue with it at all, it would be 1: the volume of the unit is relatively low compared to my unit I replaced and 2: The Remote could be a little touchy when you are switching inputs. Otherwise I have no complaints. OK maybe one. I wish it were bigger, but that is my problem.FYI, I do TV commercials and wouldn't you know it, but I just did a Samsung commercial and of course they are coming out with a new version and of course it's half the thickness of mine, but I didn't like the new "Touch of Color" version. It looks like a cars stop light. I think you would be very happy if you decided to purchase this unit.

Reviews.Title: I'm lovin' it!!
Reviews.Author: L. Tindall
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for 30 days now and I am so happy with it.  I wanted to allow time for any problems to surface such as the auto-off problem that I had read about in earlier reviews.  Samsung must have done the firmware fix at the factory or I was just lucky.  My experience with this purchase from Amazon was totally positive in every aspect.This was my first major online purchase so I was a bit nervous.  I had been researching and comparing Samsung, Toshiba, Sony and Sharp 52" LCD HDTV's for the past 6 months.  Comparing price and features the Samsung LN52A650 is certainly the one with the most bang for your buck.  With Amazon's price plus free shipping and zero tax none of the local big stores could come close.  And I had been watching the sales.  We're not rich so when we make a major purchase it has to be right.The TV was delivered exactly one week from the day I placed the order.  Eagle called the day before to give us a delivery timeframe and they were on time.  We live way out in the country but that was no problem for them.  They have GPS. They unboxed the TV in the house and let us inspect it.  It was perfect.  Then to my surprise they set it on the stand, plugged it in and turned it on to make sure it worked.  They suggested we keep the box in case there would be a problem and we would need it to ship it back.  Well, I'm happy to report there are no problems.I love This TV.  The picture just blows me away.  The colors are crisp and so accurate.  You can see all the detail....hairs out of place on the news anchor people, zits, the flaws that make them finally look like real people.  The set is beautiful to look at even when it's turned off.  We have it mounted on a stand with a post and bracket that we purchased at Walmart.  There are windows across the wall opposite the TV and when the Florida sun shines in during the mornings we have to close the shades as there is some glare.  I thought this might be an issue since this model doesn't have the matte screen like the Sony does.  But after comparing pictures at the local stores I was sold on the Samsung because the picture is just so much more crystal clear.  And it looks great at every angle.  It's the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: Never seen anything like it...
Reviews.Author: Macadameane "electronic enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN52A650 is spectacular.  I have had the tv for two weeks (having purchased through Amazon.)  Deep blacks have really improved my picture from all sources.  This TV also handles SD signals well.  I was afraid that my Wii video might look more aliased ("jaggies"), but it handles it very well.Bluray is like no other.  I love the auto motion plus (120Hz technology), but it does take time to get used to at first.  The picture is SO smooth that it makes movies have a documentary feel to them.  It looks live.  I think Americans (like me) in general, aren't used to that live feel for movies.  After careful observation, it is superior, and I shudder when I switch the 120Hz off because it is so chopped up looking in comparison.  1080i sources are also greatly improved because of this and feel more like a progressive scan source.  Video games on the PS3 look great too.The only disappointment I have is that the Optical audio output will only route Stereo audio coming from a 5.1 digital source (via HDMI).  The only time it will output 5.1 digital (or higher) is from an off-air coax connection.  Lame eh?  This hasn't hurt me because I can just hook them directly to my sound system, but I was hoping for a smaller cable mess.Best picture quality hands down.  It is very close to plasma TVs so don't get a plasma; they are heavy, dim, and have possible issues of fading (needs recharging) and screen-burn.  Most Blurays (and other widescreen movies) don't come to you in a full 16:9 frame, which means there will be letterbox bars.  This can damage a plasma screen, but you can leave an LCD on all day.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 - absolutely great!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Frederick
Reviews.Content: I just received it and got it set up with no problems.  The delivery was great, so kudos to Amazon for doing that so smoothly and quickly.  The TV itself has been great and the color is superb.  It was easy to get going with it and have it learn the new channels.  My suggestion is not to just fumble around and try to figure things out, but to go through the quick setup guide the provide.  That will answer most of the questions you have on how to hook something up.  I just hooked up my Wii system to it, and I must say that the colors are spectacular.  My only problem with the system is that it looks so good that I tend to just sit and watch TV because it looks so good.  The only nitpick I might have is it would be good if Samsung also put a small section in the quick setup guide on hooking up a game system, since they address just about every other possibility.  Other than that, no complaints at all.  Plus, the TV just by itself looks great; very nice job by Samsung.  Overall, very happy and would definitely recommend it to anyone interested in a great TV at a cost that won't bankrupt you.

Reviews.Title: Great price; beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: A. Wong
Reviews.Content: Pros: quick delivery, great price - and got a refund during first 30-days when the price dropped - Thanks Amazon! OTA HD is beautiful. SD broadcasts on analog cable is surprisingly good on strong stations. Standard DVD playback using a 1080p upconvert DVD player looks great (HDMI cable purchased separately). Little or no pixelation visible at 8ft viewing distance. HTPC connected via HDMI2 using a DVI to HDMI cable (purchased separately) works great. Windows desktop at 1920x1080 looks great; playback of video needed some tweaking of the PVR software (something about square pixels).Cons: Screen and bezel pick up dust like mad. Remote control needs a better layout and the menu wheel really needs to be eliminated. PIP option should be more easy to access (should put it on tools menu). Would have been nicer to have two coax antenna inputs so I could connect analog cable and OTA at the same time and switch from the remote as another input source. (I have to use a manual coax switcher)After a long time researching, I pulled the trigger and am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very Very Very Nice
Reviews.Author: B. Sheets "Windsheet5"
Reviews.Content: Received my Samsung 52A650 yesterday. I have never seen a picture this good on a TV.  It really is very good. I do not have Blue ray yet.  Have been watching regular DVD's played thru a player I got when I ordered this TV. It upscales the image to 1080p. It is hard to believe that blue ray will look better!  You can see so much detail on this TV. Absolutly beautiful.  I do not have cable either.  Just HD TV over an antena.  But that also loooks awsome.Check out the AVS forum for owners comments and advice about this TV. Like any high end new release product there can be issues. But they seem to be a low percentage of those sold. Good to know what to look for.  They also have suggested image settings and sound settings.  Will try some of those out today.If you are comparing this set with plazma and trying to decide which way to go, don't hesitate any more.  This baby handles motion very well. Samsung seems to have hit one out of the park with this TV.  All the advantages of an LCD (lighter, no image retention issues, runs cooler, better PC image, better reflection carateristics in high lit rooms) plus good performance now for high motion action like sports.

Reviews.Title: Great HD Set, Do the Upgrade
Reviews.Author: cbr46
Reviews.Content: Our Samsung LN52A650 HDTV worked great without issues right out of the box.  The clarity is phenomenal but the sound is "ok".  The TV has plenty of AV inputs including 3 HDMI inputs, plus USB and ethernet connectivity if desired.  We were a bit skeptical with the spontaneous off and sound popping problems reported in early reviews.  We did notice some popping when switching menus in TiVo so we downloaded the latest firmware off the Samsung support site, installed it through the TV's USB port and the popping disappeared.  This FW version also corrects the spontaneous off issue.  If you like baseball, golf or hockey this is the ticket in HD mode - Every detail, every face in the stands, every blade of grass is incredibly clear with no blurring during high speed action.  The unit has been working GREAT for weeks now and we are ecstatic with the picture.  The sound, on the other hand, is good enough for viewing but certainly not home theater standards.  Overall we are extremely happy.  Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Scott Gostkowski "Scottro"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV from Amazon in early April. The picture quality is simply unbelievable. I mean let's face it, the sound isn't "amazing" but it's a fricken flat panel display...all that really matters is the picture. I also own a Samsung 4253 model plasma TV which I had researched probably more extensively than this model, but the fact is it still beats out the more expensive Sony XBR models and the Panasonics. Before I saw this TV in the store I couldn't really tell that much of a difference b/w 720p and 1080p, but once I saw the beautifulpicture this TV displayed I knew I had to upgrade. Playing games on Xbox 360 makes you feel like you are right there in the action and watching blu-rays with the AMP turned on...action sequences look almost 3-D. Highly recommended buy for the money, Amazon has already lowered the price $300 since my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: W. hegamyer
Reviews.Content: Just received the TV for use as a monitor for a conference room in  our building. Arrived in four business days in perfect shape and the setup was a five minute task and the image quality is much better than expected. Very user friendly and the setup prompts are intuitive. We did not open the manual and have the unit operating as one of two monitors for one of our computers. This is the ultimate in conference room presentation equipment. We are using a Bluetooth Logitech keyboard and mouse so the look is extremely sleek. Could not be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Best LCD you want to own
Reviews.Author: R. Chow
Reviews.Content: This LCD is awesome.  The picture quality is everything as expected.  You will be amazed on how the picture looks.  Even the digital (non-hd) channels look great on the screen.  I was a little skeptical about the hint of red in the frame, but after I got in the room it actually was barely noticeable and it blended well with my entertainment stand.The only negative thing I had on this transaction was with the shipping of the LCD.  Amazon advertised "White Glove" shipping.  CEVA (the delivery service) shipping bill lists "delivery inside only" which meant one guy whose task was to leave the LCD in the box inside the house.  I've contacted Amazon and I only got was an email saying they sent my message to their shipping department.  I don't know what this means and what will come of this.Other than this technicality this LCD will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: Best TV out there, latest technology
Reviews.Author: HistoryBuff
Reviews.Content: I've only had the TV one week now,  it looks great on HD channels,  I haven't had any problems , setup is quick, intuitive and very easy. Connected it to cable and the QAM tuner found all HD and analog channels. Another cool feature is the connection to Internet router which went without any problems and ....voila, real time news, stock quotes and weather...Absolutely stunning and breathtaking...Full heartedly recommend this TV.These settings really work in my medium lighted family room:--Picture menuMode: DynamicBacklight: 6Contrast: 60Brightness: 38Sharpness: 48Color: 28Tint: G52/R48

Reviews.Title: It is great for a year or so...
Reviews.Author: sucuba
Reviews.Content: After doing some research, we chose this to be our entrance into the flat panel television market. It was a mistake. For the first year, it was wonderful. Today, our TV no longer works. Why is that? It has only been in our house since June 2008!!Turns out there are many other tv's like ours that has the same problem. It started power cycling on and off. The trouble shooting idea Samsung gave on its website was no help. Turns out, after looking for help on the internet, it is a widespread problem that Samsung doesn't care too much to correct. The capacitors fail after about 13-14 months, and it is conveniently out of warranty. So, now I sit here with a beautiful 52" tv that has a black screen.Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: No Regrets!
Reviews.Author: OLY
Reviews.Content: I absolutly love everything about my new Samsung. Was considering the 47" 120HZ LG or Samsungs 50" Plasma. I have no regrets with the samsung LN52A650. This TV is in a south facing sunroom/living room. Which is why I choose the LCD over the plasma. I will say though we still close the shades as the screen does reflect a little more than I had hoped. The biggest complaint I had at first was when watching Movies the TV had what everyone refers to as a soap opera effect. This was quite annoying but after visiting many web sites found out that if you turn off automotion plus (this does not turn off the 120hz)The soap opera effect goes completly away. We only turn it on for Sporting events or when the kids play there Play Station 3.  If I needed to go buy another TV today it would be a Samsung LCD!!

Reviews.Title: On/Off Loop
Reviews.Author: Jason Livingston
Reviews.Content: I got this TV on 2/17/09 it was the best picture I've seen on a TV. On 2/18/09 the TV shut off and started the On/Off loop. Contacted Samsung about the problem. They wanted me to upload the update to the TV. It is impossible to upload to the TV when its in this loop because you cant get to the menu. On 3/06/09 they sent a service tech to switch out the power and main boards. It didnt work. Now Im in the process of getting a refund.

Reviews.Title: Holy crispy images Batman!
Reviews.Author: Joshua M. Gates
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very crisp! In the limited time I've owned it, it has far surpassed my Bravia V in almost every way image quality wise! If you're a big fan of CG movies, this is THE set to have! With AMP off, I experience zero controller lag on my ps3. I much prefer not to use the gaming setting, as some games require a bit of tweaking so as not to be too dark (Resistance 2 anyone?). Even with Gaming mode off, this set seriously puts the everloving trounce on the Bravia. Bu-rays that aren't meant to play at 24p, such as Planet Earth and CG movies, are completely breathtaking with AMP on. Smooth as silk, like you're looking through a window! The buttons on the tv are heat activated, how freakin' cool is that! Just gently touch the bezel on the icons. That kind of thing appeals to the geek in me. Extremely wide viewing angle makes for a fulfilling experience, even if you aren't dead center of the screen.Cons: Remote response is laggy. If your main purchasing criteria is based on how quickly the tv responds to remote input, you will not be happy with how slowly the menu scrolls respond to your inputs. Coming from the Sony XMB, I was quite disappointed that Samsung's menu system is so slow. But once everything is dialed in, I consider that a small gripe compared to the advantages this system has to offer. Oh, and I hope you're handy with a microfiber cloth, cause the bezel is a dust magnet with no equal! Glossy Screen won't be a bonus to everyone. I'm nocturnal, so most of my watching is done at night. However, during daytime watching in a loft with no curtains, the glare was not distracting in any way to me. During gaming it might be more of an issue than casual tv time.Other Notes: Pilot shipping wasn't given all the necessary paperwork to make the shipment to my home on the estimated delivery date. Delivery was delayed by 2 business days, which doesn't sound like much until you're waiting for a $2000 HDTV over a weekend to arrive in 1 piece. However, the agent in my area was sincerely apologetic about the delay and Amazon did their best to keep me appraised of the situation, including putting me directly in touch with the delivery company. I would say, if you order from here, add at least 3 days to the estimated delivery date to avoid disappointment and stress.

Reviews.Title: This is the TV you've been looking for!
Reviews.Author: Matt Combes
Reviews.Content: This TV is just amazing. I had been planning on purchasing a new TV to upgrade from my 50" LG plasma, which was only 720p. My top pick was going to be a Panasonic Viera plasma, based on reviews over at CNET.com, but I wanted to see it in person so I trekked on over to Best Buy to check it out. I was not impressed after looking at the Panny they had up ... nor was I much impressed even by the Pioneer Kuro they had right next to it, which was supposed to be the best of the best. No, surprisingly enough, when I sat back and scanned all of the TVs they had up, my eyes kept being drawn over to the Samsung LCDs. The 650 and 750 models they had up were brighter, more colorful, and just "popped" right out at you. So I took a closer look, dug the 120hz feature, and decided to investigate more.I did a lot of searching around online for both reviews and pricing. Sure enough, I found the best spot for each here, on Amazon.com. There were so many reviews, mostly 5-star, and the price was definitely lower than any big box store and most places online. Once I realized how often the price fluctuated, I watched it daily like a stock ticker, waiting for the prime opportunity to take advantage -- which came 2 days after Christmas, when it hit the lowest point I've seen on Amazon to date. A great post-Christmas gift!There was a bit of a hang up with the delivery, which involved me having to call Pilot to ask when my TV was getting here because nobody had ever called me to set up a delivery 7 days after ordering. Since Pilot didn't have a location near my city, they had contracted a local delivery service, Queen City Delivery, to handle it. The QC rep advised me that they would get to me the very next morning, and they did. There were 2 guys, and they were more than happy to do the white glove delivery, putting the TV up on the stand and all ... although I didn't have them check the operation of the TV due to the fact it was 15 degrees outside and the TV was ice cold (and according to the manual needs an operating temperature of at least 50 degrees). I waited a couple hours for it to warm up before I started playing.Like I said, this TV is amazing. I had to play around with some settings on my cable box to get things to look proper on-screen (resolution-wise), but once I got that down, it was just a matter of toying around. Standard Def, of course, looks kind of crappy at 52" and stretched (I don't do 4:3, thank you), but it looks better than it did on my old LG. Where this TV really shines, though, is in playing upscaled DVDs and Blu-Ray. This TV coupled with my Playstation 3 is a winning combo. When my DVDs are upscaled to 1080p, with the right picture settings, they look SO close to Blu-Ray quality. There are still obvious qualities that allow you to tell that it's not, but for DVD quality it's great. Blu-Ray, on the other hand ... that's where it's at. Stunning. I've been watching seasons 3 and 4 of LOST on Blu-Ray and with the 120hz feature on (usually low or medium), and my personal picture preferences, it's drool-worthy. The blacks are very black (again, better than my LG and rivaling even the Panny I was looking at), the colors explode, and every detail is right there for you to inspect.I also use this set a lot as a computer monitor for my MacBook Pro. It's gorgeous in 1080p. One of the reasons I was more willing to get this set is that LCD is less susceptible to image retention and burn-in than plasma, which I noticed a lot when I was using the LG plasma as my monitor.Oh, that Touch of Color bezel? I'm not a fan of red at all, but got this TV despite that because the picture looked THAT good. But you know what? I can't even see it. I mean, if you're looking for it, it's there, but because my living room has ambient flourescent lighting rather than any kind of direct lighting, the red almost blends right into the black. And the gloss? Again, because I have no direct lighting and no windows behind me, there really isn't any. Now, I will say that if I have the lights on, and I'm watching a really dark, shadowy scene, you can quite easily make out reflections. However, it's that big of a distraction and if I really want I can just turn off the lights. The remote is actually pretty nice. The scroll wheel gets some flak, and deservedly so because it sucks, but the good thing is that you can still use it as a clickable direction pad -- you don't have to use it as a scroll wheel. Switching inputs is slow, and I wish you could cycle the 120hz settings or your personal picture settings with just 1 button, but these things are not enough to deter me from giving this set a 5-star rating.BUY THIS TELEVISION. Seriously. You won't regret it. Most of the 1- and 2-star reviews for this television have to do with the shipping company or Amazon, neither of which have anything to do with this product. And those who have had problems with the product most likely got an errant lemon and are too impatient to deal with the warranty service. I have had no problems so far (granted, I've only had it for 2 weeks). The TV came with the latest firmware, so I didn't have to update it. I can't rave enough about this product. No more TV upgrades for me for a long time!

Reviews.Title: 52" of HD goodness.....
Reviews.Author: Brian Fox
Reviews.Content: This was my first Amazon purchase over $200, and I couldn't be more satisfied.  I researched for several months like many others, to learn as much as I could about the current specs and to see all the different models in person.  I haven't owned a new tv since the 19" back in high school a decade ago (roommates won out), so I wanted something that would handle movies/computing/gaming for some time to come.  I also knew that my father, who was shopping for his first HDTV, would more than likely go with my decision as well.We picked his up Christmas Eve from Best Buy, along with the 32" Whalen corner stand.  Unpacking and setup was easy enough, you simply pull out the two plastic retainers and the box lifts off.
