Cable coax directly from the wall, or hdmi from the cable box both have a great picture, no issues with cable box compatibility with Time Warner.I ordered mine from Amazon on Dec. 26, and Pilot delivered it in a pickup truck on Dec. 31st, just in time to watch the Huskers beat Clemson the next day.  Pilot probably did a better job than if I would have bought it from a retailer, as the box wasn't bent or gouged anywhere.  I also didn't see any dead pixels or any other flaws in either of the 650's we bought this Christmas.  For a stand I chose the Whalen BBL44BP from Best Buy, since Amazon didn't carry it, which is a 44" wide base with chrome reclining legs and black tempered glass.The picture is incredible, and the tv itself is well made and looks great.  It's not facing any windows in my house, so the glare is a non-issue.  It did take me a little while to realize there are no buttons on the tv, instead in the lower right hand corner there is a touch sensitive pad for power/volume/channels.  It will leave fingerprints using them, but they work fine.Hooking up to the xbox360 via the component cables will give 1080p output, contrary to some of the rumors that you absolutely have to have the xbox hdmi cable to get above 1080i.  I have the optical audio from both the tv and the xbox running to a Yamaha receiver.Connecting to the computer via a standard VGA cable works great, and is perfectly readable from 8ft back at 1360x768 (slightly wider resolution than a standard widescreen monitor, which I normally ran at 1280x768 or 1440x900).The backlight and brightness settings were a little brighter than they needed to be across the board, so after some minor changes everything looks great.  The built in speakers are small, and sound as generic as I expected.  They work fine for normal low to mid volume purposes, but lack the bass and midrange for movies or games.  Not a big deal to me, so I normally turn them off or all the way down to let the receiver do the work.Other tv functions include the ability to connect directly to a LAN for software upgrades, InfoLink news and weather, which is kind of nice, but a little redundant as it's already hooked to a computer.  Same with the Wiselink USB port, which lets you plug in any usb music or picture storage device and browse through pictures or play mp3's.I also haven't spent much time with the Automotion settings, or had anything that would output at 120hz to justify that aspect of the 650 over the 550.  It did seem to help the clarity during standard dvd playback, when the background and foreground were moving at different speeds.  Otherwise, I assume it's something that will be taken advantage of more in the future, or with a bluray player to eliminate the 3:2 pulldown inherent in 24fps film.I compared this tv with several Sony's, and the LG70, before deciding on Samsung.  The 750 series' extra software, and the 850's slimmer profile weren't worth the extra money, in my opinion.  Assuming that I don't run into any unforeseen repairs, this seems to be an outstanding tv that I look forward to keeping for quite a while.

Reviews.Title: Everything as promised
Reviews.Author: Tina C.
Reviews.Content: The TV is excellent, the picture quality is wonderful.I want to comment on the delivery and set up. Some reviewers were very disappointed, but I definitely had the "white glove" treatment.My TV was brought all the way through my house, set up where I wanted it and they even hooked up the cable and other accessories. It was so nice not to have to deal with all of the packaging which they removed.I highly recommend purchasing from Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" Flat Screen TV
Reviews.Author: Ruby I. Elrod "ruby2sday"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this television and saw the recommendations of Consumers Report and decided this is what we wanted for our 50th wedding anniversary.  The price was great.  Circuit City had the same television advertising $500 off and it was still more expensive than what we paid plus free shipping.  We ordered it on a Sunday and it arrived on Thursday.  The shipping company called on Wednesday and told it would arrive the next day.  The only suggestion I would have is to have two men deliver the television.  Our delivery man was 65 years old and had to have help in getting it up the front steps. My husband is elderly and has a herniated disk but the two of them managed to get it into the house.My husband hooked it up and we couldn't be happier with the television. The color is beautiful and we would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and Great Price from Warehouse Deals
Reviews.Author: Eric Fawcett
Reviews.Content: I bought an open box unit from Amazon Warehouse Deals for $1604 and about $68 shipping.  I was a little nervous about buying something used and repackaged in a new box, but after having it for a week I couldn't be happier.  The description noted "cosmetic blemishes on main unit."  After doing some research I concluded this could be anything from cat hair on the body to scratches/chips/knicks.  The only "cosmetic blemish" we (me and the delivery guys) ever found was some sticker residue from the "Full HD 1080p"-type stickers that used to be on the front.  That was easily rubbed off with a finger.The TV itself is purely beautiful.  I upgraded from an old Sanyo 32" SDTV that I've had for about 10 years so, of course, I've just been totally wowed by having a nice HDTV in my home.  Picture quality is astounding on all sources.  Non-HD cable channels are lacking in quality, but that's the same with any TV.  The standard definition channels come through very nice on this TV and it doesn't bother me to watch them at all.  If anything, it definitely looks better to me on the HDTV than on the SDTV.  It has lots of picture options and modes for sports, movies, etc.  The body of the TV is very nice.  The red Touch of Color is a nice effect and definitely adds to the beauty.  The red is not insanely bright so it's noticeable but it's nowhere near an eyesore.The 120hz refresh rate is great on this TV.  I spent a few hours at Best Buy and Circuit City evaluating 120hz TV's.  It's not hugely noticeable on regular things (sitcoms, SD channels, etc).  It makes a noticeable difference when watching sports in HD.  It makes an incredible difference when watching movies in HD and on DVD (I don't have a Blu-ray Player so standard DVDs here).  Some people don't like the way it makes movies look since it does take away that film "feel."  Personally, I like it much better because it makes things very smooth.  It's easily turned on and off via the remote and actually has 5 settings: Off, Low, Medium, High and Demo.  Turned to Low and Medium you retain about 50% and 25% of that film "feel" respectively.  On High you've got the full 120hz, and Demo shows you 120hz enabled on one half of the screen while the other half has it disabled for comparisons.I've seen a lot of complaints about the speakers in this TV, and while the speakers aren't amazing, they aren't terrible either.  They are perfectly fine for average TV viewing.  Personally, I don't feel the need to turn on the stereo and crank up my speakers just to watch G4, VH1, Discovery Channel or some other generic TV viewing.  They sound fine to me and are plenty loud enough for general viewing.The remote control is very nice.  I only use it now to change sources since I use the universal that comes with my cable service for pretty much everything else.  There are touch-sensitive "buttons" on the right side to use for power, volume, channel and a handy source button if you ever need to control sans remote.The TV stand is good and has a nice swivel.  I don't use the stand anymore since I mounted the TV to a wall.  A plastic cover is provided to cover the hole where the stand goes.  Mounting this TV was pretty easy.  I used the Peerless SF6640 Universal mount purchased from Amazon.  Installing the brackets to the TV was simple.  The back of the TV isn't cluttered with unnecessary markings or anything and is the same size everywhere the brackets went.  Hanging the TV on the wall was a two-person job simply because I didn't want to risk dropping it.  It's 64 pounds without the stand, and, while I could lift it and mount it myself, it's just easier and safer to do it with two people.One of my main concerns with the mount I got was the clearance for cables plugged into the TV.  The mount offered 1.7" of clearance to the wall.  I organized my cabling very neatly and ended up with about 0.25" of clearance from the cables to the wall.  The included power cord is a right-angle cord and easily fits with the wall.  The input panel is slightly set in so it gives a little extra room there (about a quarter of an inch).  The component and HDMI cables are curved from the connector to the center of the TV.  I didn't have to make any hard curves or bends to get it to fit, but they are not ideal in my opinion.  The cables and inputs are in no danger of being damaged, but I would've liked to have 0.1" more just to keep things from having to be curved much at all.  On the back of the TV in the center is an attached table wrap that makes routing your cables down and away from the TV easy and neat.The delivery service was great.  They set it up on my temporary stand and powered it on to make sure it worked.  I let them take the box after they informed that if I needed to exchange the TV, Amazon would just send me a new TV in a new box anyway and I could just use that box to return anything.Overall this is one of the best purchases I've ever made, and I got a stellar deal at $1604.81 before shipping.  I will be incredibly happy with this TV for many years.

Reviews.Title: Resolved the Plasma vs LCD decision
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Have been watching prices and technology for years. After lightning destroyed my 27" analog JVC and reading speculation about upward price pressures, decided to act.  Had settled on Panasonic plasma when I discovered this model - what luck! The model has the best of both worlds - brilliant picture and pop of plasma, but with low-power consumption and freedom from burn-in worries of LCD. I no longer felt like I was compromising. And the extra dollars for 52 inches over 46 well spent.Positives:- Best designed remote I've ever used.- Menus are well designed and transparent.- Great speakers even though I normally use a 5.1 sound system for movies and extended viewing.- Screen reflections a small fraction of the flat CRT it replaces, virtually unnoticeable in a room with only east windows.- Delivery was timely and uneventful - I had prepared several solid color jpeg's on a USB flashdrive to verify zero pixel defects before the delivery guys left. Never thought I would order a large TV from an online merchant; now I would never do it any other way.- Amazon quickly adjusted a few minor price decreases without question after delivery.Extra features:- The Wiselink support for MP3 and JPG viewing is interesting but very basic and will be used minimally. I tried a 8GB USB flash drive full of photos and waited 20+ minutes while it was creating thumbnails of all the pictures. Probably useable for a few hundred photos at a time.- The RSS news/weather feed doesn't seem compelling enough to hunt down the WiFi dongle required for wireless use.- The picture-in-picture facility is limited to an analog feed in the window. As an over-the-air viewer this feature becomes irrelevant in 6 months. Seems like an odd feature to bother including.Negatives- none

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dave & Pam
Reviews.Content: AWESOME TV!!!!  I haven't bought a TV in about 12 years, so I took months agonizing over the decision.  I was between this one and a Toshiba but the rich feature set turned the tide to the LN52A650.  I've tried out about every thing except the PIP and it all works as it should.  Picture is fantastic especially on HD content, but even most analog cable channels look dang good.  As others have said, the onboard speakers aren't the greatest, but they're not bad, I hooked the TV into my stereo which sounds great and will more than do until I get a full on home theater system.A note about CEVA shipping, I followed the tracking closely and my TV arrived at the local terminal on a Wednesday.  I waited for a call until Thursday noon, and was told they wouldn't have the two man truck coming to my area until the following Thursday.  I think I could have talked them into sending it earlier if I'd help unload, but decided agianst it.  When the day came, the delivery window was 11-3 and they showed at about 3.05.  They unloaded, unboxed, and made sure the unit worked.  My advice would be to call as soon as tracking on the CEVA website shows its reached the local terminal.  If I had, I think I could have had the TV a week earlier.  A google for CEVA Trak or tracking should lead you to thier website and you can navigate around thier site to find the local phone number, then ask for who=ever schedules deliveries.  Amazon tracking seemed to lag behind the CEVA tracking by at least several hours.Overall, I am very satisfyed with my purchase and would not hisitate to reccomend this TV, and buying it from amazon to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Yes........you should buy this TV.
Reviews.Author: Kendall "Kendall"
Reviews.Content: Let me start this off by saying... when it comes to "tech stuff", I'm a bit of a moron. So, if you're looking for a review that was written by someone who knows "stuff", quit reading. I've had this tv for about a week now and both me and the wife LOVE it. The picture is amazing!!!! All we did was unpack it, plug everything in and turn it on. It was super simple to set up and the picture is awesome, even with factory settings. I've read a bunch of reviews that talk about the picture even being better after "tweeking" it, but I can't imaging it being any better. My wife and I don't agree on everything though; I HAVE to turn the 120Hz off when watching movies and some tv shows, it's just too life-like. My wife however loves it. I love the way that it makes sports, reality shows and news look, just not movies and most tv shows. But, just turn it off and the picture looks perfect (to me anyway). Lastly, Amazon's price beat the brick and mortor stores by almost $1000. I ordered it on a Sunday and Ceva had it deliverd by Thursday. We are extremely happy with this TV from Samsung and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Best TV and the price makes it even better!
Reviews.Author: D. Myers "Dean"
Reviews.Content: I researched this purchase for 3 weeks, looking at every brand and comparing the features.  This HDTV was hands down the best even before I looked at price.  I've had it for a month now and have not had any problems.  The picture is great, the features a plentiful, and I am really happy with my purchase.  I love buying from Amazon, they make it so easy.  My advice is buy the Samsung LN52A650 and buy it from Amazon, it's a lot easier and cheaper from any retail outlet.

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing.  The best out there.
Reviews.Author: S.R.
Reviews.Content: This TV is the best LCD on the market right now.  And, buying through Amazon cannot be beat.  Their price is  significantly lower than any price you will find in any retail store.  I even have a friend that can get a corporate discount through Best Buy, and Amazon's price is still WAY lower.  To top it off, Amazon throws in their white glove delivery for free.  They unwrap the tv, set it up where you want it placed, and make sure it turns on and receives signal when hooked up to your cable box.  The tv even arrived sooner than the quoted delivery date when I first placed my order.  As for the product itself... AMAZING.  I do not see how it could get any better than this.  The picture is flawless.  With the 120 hz filter on, it even looks TOO real.  It blows my mind that you actually have to NOT take advantage of all the options available on this tv in order to get the best quality picture for watching movies!

Reviews.Title: Flat out amazing
Reviews.Author: Benjamin A. Dennis
Reviews.Content: After obsessing over which tv to purchase for over a year, whether to go plasma or lcd, what size to get, etc. etc. i have found my match. The clarity and smoothness of the picture is amazing, the colors are vibrant, the blacks are very deep, it's just amazing. the touch of red on the surround is barely noticable and i get comments on it all the time. I'd recommend the tv to anyone. just be ready to spend money on a good hdmi cable, you really see any imperfections in the picture if its not coming from a good source.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME, SIMPLY AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: David B. Camarillo "notredave"
Reviews.Content: This TV is as good as all the reviews say it is.  Picture on blu-rays is so clean that they have a bit of a 3-D feel.  If you're looking for a 50-55 inch HDTV, BUY THIS ONE!!!

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: S. Bagchi "Audio_phile"
Reviews.Content: Have been using it for a week now and cannot get over how good the picture is. Ordered it in the middle of May and received it around the 25th. The shippers dropped and bashed a corner. Called Amazon and they sent another one which reached me in about 10 days. No damage on this one. The shippers also packed and picked up the damaged TV.The picture is fantastic and have not come across any cons as yet.Would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: great lcd
Reviews.Author: Pranav Amin
Reviews.Content: i heavily researched comparable bravia and aquos models and finally decided to go with this one. definitely a great choice, this tv is fantasic

Reviews.Title: Happy owner
Reviews.Author: J. Silcox "JAS"
Reviews.Content: As with many others, I did a lot of research, looked at many products, but the 50,000 - 1 contrast was the deciding factor. Also the price was lower than prior models of the 52" Samsung. Went to BB, but they could not match Amazon--got it within a week. Takes some time to set up, but the picture is wonderful--colors great. The sound is not as good as the picture. I put it in an entertainment center and with the speakers on the side, I went out and bought a center and two bookcase speakers to enhance the sound. Sitting pretty now.

Reviews.Title: absolute beauty !
Reviews.Author: Photon
Reviews.Content: i ordered this on amazon last friday (5/31) and the delivery dates given by amazon was 6/10. guess what ? CEVA delivered it today (6/4) almost a whole week ahead of schedule !the tv is an abolsolute beauty and i have yet to play with all the settings etc. The glare is not at all noticable and the frame with TOC is just a piece of art, especially how they put default controls embedded inside the frame (you wont see them unless you look closely). Also the blacks are very deep and you cant make out the difference between the frame and the screen when there is a black color displayed !this is my first hdtv and cant wait to explore all the possibilities ! thanks a lot to all the reviews, i was able to nail my choice down quickly !

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: W. Scherer "Roader"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a month now and absolutely love it!  I've been seriously researching HDTVs for about 8 months and my first choice was going to be the LN5271F, but never pulled the trigger because of the numerous problems users were complaining about on the AVS Forum (great place to research TVs even though the owners tend to be very picky and notice flaws normal users such as myself wouldn't),  and the price was slow to drop to a level I could afford.  I'm glad I waited because it brought me to this TV.  It received much better feedback from users on the forums and even some of the professional calibrators mentioned it is the best LCD tv they have ever worked with, rivaling even the top notch Pioneer plasmas in picture quality.I currently have HD cable (1080i), Wii (480p), and the computer (1080p) hooked up to it.  It has a fantastic picture from all sources.  I can't stress this enough, it is amazing.  I find myself watching a lot more TV now because of this.  Black levels look great and the picture is very vibrant and sharp.  The AVS forum also has a calibration thread for this TV which helped me dial in the picture and then making small adjustments to get the picture to my satisfaction.  Each source can be calibrated (to varying degrees) and the TV remembers them all.This TV comes highly recommended.  Pricing on Amazon is great and delivery was a breeze.  Also, Amazon has a 30 day price match which has put almost $200 back in my pocket.If you are on the fence on this, come off an buy it.

Reviews.Title: Great Service, Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tech Dude
Reviews.Content: Ordered the TV from Amazon, Recieved the shipment in three days in excellent condition.  TV set is beautiful, I have been using the TV for a week and a half, picture quality is amazing.  The TVs price has been reduced twice during this time and Amazon has given me the difference for the price reduction without any issues or problems after contacting them.  30 Days Post sale price guarantee works well.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Glad I Waited "Glad"
Reviews.Content: I delayed purchasing an HDTV for some time and am very glad that I waited. Purchasing this unit from Amazon was a surprisingly pleasant experience. The unit arrived one week earlier than the date quoted on my order confirmation.  When the delivery service called to arrange delivery, I asked to be the first stop and the front door rang at 8:30 in the morning and the delivery was handled in a very professional manner. The experience erased any concerns that I had about ordering over the internet.The 650 is a great television. Set up is easy. Paired with a Bose Lifestyle 48 and a Panasonic BD30 Blue Ray, the experience is excellent. Two of my neighbors have Sony XBR's; one a XBR5 and the other an XBR4, both 52 inch models. Catch an NBA playoff game on the 650 and you'll be a believer. The Samsung exceeds both Sony units in picture clarity and motion handling and the TOC feature is better looking than the plexi frame around the XBR.I have added a wireless bridge for the info-link feature making it a great information resource.  I received the unit two weeks ago and have not experienced shut-off, so it's a non issue. The 650 is a great experience that will be entertaining for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable HDTV - Samsung gets nod over Sony
Reviews.Author: Kenneth C. Newland "Chris"
Reviews.Content: Searching for the right HDTV took some time for me, roughly 1 year in the process.  I ultimately chose the best HDTV:  Samsung's LN52A650.2007 models, both Sony & Samsung didn't seem to work out all of the kinks in their products.  120Hz refresh was ok on 2007 models, but overpriced.  I chose the Samsung over the Sony for numerous reasons, but two main reasons:  Styling and Price.Reason #1: StylingAs great as the Sony 52XBR4 was in reviews I just didn't like the glass bezel, just unattractive to look at.  I particularly like the curve that Samungs have at the bottom of their TV's, distinctive and stylish, unlike a plain rectangular screen.  The TOC is rather pleasant, not overwhelming, but just a hint of color.Reason #2: PriceDespite being a fan of Sony...Sony consistently sells their products at a premium.  Samsung models typically are priced cheaper with just as many options as Sony tv's and it's no wonder Samsung is beating Sony; just look at the bestselling HDTV's here at Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: Joannie "Teacher and Mother"
Reviews.Content: This TV is visually appealing and has a great picture in High Def. There is a major issue with the remote control though. Samsung should absolutly redo the spin dial that has a mind of it's own. We just use our cable box remote to perform the daily TV functions and that solves the problem.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: J. Abramson "lajoe"
Reviews.Content: 20 Month old TV picture died (still has sound). No service in San Diego, and no response from authorized repair center after 3 calls. Bad circuit board which seems common if you Google search Samsung TV problems. Samsung service told me I was out of luck. Parts/labor to repair was quoted at over $500 when I finally got a Sears repair man to come out. For a premium quality product like Samsung, they take no pride in quality and have poor customer service. BUY AT YOUR OWN PERIL....."

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Yancy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product on Amazon a little over a month ago.  The shippers arrived at 7 am on a Sat morning without warning and I was not home.  Fortunately, my son was house sitting.  The outside of the box was damaged and I was pretty nervous unpacking it, but the TV was/is fine.Everything seems to work as advertised and the picture is spectacular.  If you are a do-it-yourself installer, take the time to make sure all your inputs are set correctly.  I thought the picture was great, then I figured out that my cable box and Xbox 360 were only outputting at 480i.  The difference between 480i and 1080i is amazing.Minor complaints: there is no difference between 60hz and 120hz operation.  I've really tried to see the difference, but now believe it's pure marketing BS.  Also, as others have noted, the remote is somewhat difficult to use and it takes too long to switch between inputs.  But, those are minor complaints.

Reviews.Title: Power cycles a common issue
Reviews.Author: J. Jozwiak "Joz"
Reviews.Content: I've had this unit for 16 months now. Though I was very happy with the image initially I now have power issues. The TV tries to turn on but can't. I can hear it clicking to power up but never happens. It simply keeps clicking with no picture. I've tried unplugging the unit and then trying again but that hasn't helped. I have seen many issues concerning this problem from other customers. The typical solution is to have it serviced and pay $500 for a new part. This is a major design flaw for Samsung not to correct. Since this is an inherent design problem they should service these as if under warranty. 16 months is far to short of operation for a $2500 product. I can't recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Startup Problems after 16 Months
Reviews.Author: William J. Shea
Reviews.Content: We purchased this set July 11,2008 from Amazon and have been very satisfied until recently.  About one week ago, the unit started to cycle on and off a few times at start up.  A little research revealed this is a very common problem with Samsung LCD sets and is frequently caused by capacitors on the power supply board going bad.  Naturally, it only happens after the set is out of warranty, so the repair is several hundred dollars.The failed capacitors are usually detectable visually and many folks have successfully completed the repair themselves for a few bucks (new caps and maybe some soldering tools), according to a tech report web site.  You do have to lay the set down to take the back off in order to get to the circuit board.  This site contains detailed instructions and pics and links to videos.  Here is the link, although it might get deleted:  [...]I am going to see if the problem gets worse and will attempt the repair myself if needed, being adventurous (and chea - er, thrifty).  I will post follow ups.This is a real shame because we really love the set - note the attributes are all five stars.Followup:  Replacing the two 1000uF 25V capacitors (CM851 and 852) fixed the problem.  Total cost:  $1.79The back was easy to remove and the circuit board was right there, with no cage to remove.  The taller two 1000uF caps were distorted at the top and one had just started leaking black stuff.  My soldering skills are rusty so I had a neighbor remove/replace the caps.  Really, really simple fix!!

Reviews.Title: Not very happy with this purchase.
Reviews.Author: T. G. Russell
Reviews.Content: Well, less than six months after making this purchase, here I sit on a long Labor Day weekend with a dead tv. Back in May, I turned it off to go to work one day and when I returned that evening, nothing. No power. A week later, the Samsung tech came out, replaced the power board and left. Problem solved. Now, almost 3 months later to the day, same problem. The tech wont be here until the 10th to replace the power board again. My low rating is not about the performance and picture. That is among the best I have seen. My gripe is about the reliability and the fact that I didn't spend the extra money for an extended warranty. When you spend this much for an item, you shouldn't need an extended warranty, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Fine while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. Miller
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this TV until this week.  We were watching the US Open when the TV went totally dead with a brief hissing sound.  It is just over eight months old.  The repair service carted it away today (09/05/2009) and I probably won't get it back for several weeks.Seriously consider an extended warranty on this and other very large screen TVs.

Reviews.Title: frustrated with samsung
Reviews.Author: S. Desroher "sue d"
Reviews.Content: we purchaced this samsung 52 in tv and within a week had a 2-3inch wide pixelating line running from top of screen to the bottom just to the left of center after trying several adjustments and checking our hdmi cable we contacted samsung.  they sent someone out to investigate the problem only to find out the the tv was defective.  the lcd panel was defective.  samsung would not replace the tv they would only repair it. we had purchased a new tv not a reconditioned one and we were not compensated at all.  the repair and decision from samsung was not handled in a timely manner either it took also a month and required many phone conversations with samsung saying they would call back when in fact that was never the case.  we would not recommend buying a samsung tv since the company does not stand behind their merchandise.

Reviews.Title: Incredible HDTV
Reviews.Author: kalistoga
Reviews.Content: We did a fair amount of research on both LCD and Plasma before buying the LN52A650.  We were leaning towards Plasma until we looked at this model.  Although admittedly the top of the line Plasmas might have a slight edge in presenting fine detail, this TV is simply more enjoyable to view.  We found it's bright, anti-glare screen gorgeous and far superior to all others in the store. With 1080p, the details are sharp and crisp enough for just about anyone. After getting it home, we couldn't be more pleased.  The picture is breath-taking!We were slightly concerned over reading of complaints of glare, but we are not having this problem.  The set replaces a large rear projection screen, which gave us horrific glare off of our front window and we were concerned that this unit would do the same, but am very pleased to report that glare is minimal. Compared to my LCD computer screen, I guess it gives off more glare, but then it is 52" and has a glossy trim...both of which are bound to catch more light. However, this is basically a non issue for us...we are thrilled with the reduced glare we are experiencing compared to our rear-projection.We were also hesitant on its red-trimming....concerned it would look ugly in our living room.  I can say, you barely notice it is red trimmed.  The red tinge is subtle, and for all intents and purposes, the set looks black.The remote is nice...easy to use and agreeably good sized (I hate tiny remotes with buttons you need a magnifying glass for).When the set is turned off, there is a very small red light at the bottom right that stays illuminated. We like this since it is easy to accidentally leave a tv on all night (when cable is turned off) without this type of feedback.There is one important negative. The sound quality of the speakers is not very good. To be fair, we have been listening to a 5-speaker home theater system for 8 years, so perhaps our ears are spoiled.  However, compared to our rear-projection, the speakers on this are very inferior.  If you are not going to use an external sound system, I would recommend listening to the set in a brick and mortar store before buying.I would highly-highly recommend this television.  Exquisite picture, solidly-built, huge 52" screen, nice menu features, plenty of ports in back, comes assembled in box (swivel stand is already attached), & easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Reliable, Excellent picture, Top rated (consumer reports)
Reviews.Author: M. Cabrera
Reviews.Content: I'm giving you some free info, but this TV is the highest rated in consumer reports in the LCD 52" class, even higher rated than the 750, even higher rated than the Sony XBR bravia's. Now a lot of people don't take kindly to consumer reports, but it has never failed me. I originally bought a sony bravia 32" LCD when they first came out because they were top rated at the time, and it still shines bright 2 years later. Particular reasons the 750 (which is more expensive) was rated lower are it does not have a swivel base, and a lot of people complained about the bevel glass edge on the 750 which tended to cause an annoying reflection inside the TV during late night/ dark viewing. Really the picture on this set is phenomenal (HDMI 1080p of course). The 120 Hz really does make a huge difference. Motion is so crisp that it hurts your eyes. It takes a few days for the damage to be done to your retinas, but after that you get used to it. You really should sit back at least 7 feet from this TV otherwise your brain just melts. The infolink feature is nice, but not really practical considering you could just turn to the weather channel or stock channel, etc.. And the 4 HDMI inputs are really nice as for most setups no split box is needed. You can barely notice the "touch of color" red edge, hence its name. Alot of people are waiting until the 240hz sets (really I think I would end up at the hospital blind if I watched 240 Hz) / LED sets (which are RIDICULOUSLY over priced, and still in their infancy) come out before buying these due to the expected price drop in the 120's, but there will always be something new coming out and no matter how long you wait, eventually the price of something electronic will drop. I know that this will most likely be the last TV I buy, unless of course it just craps itself which will probably happen at some point down the road, but until then I can crap myself watching it.

Reviews.Title: Love the TV!
Reviews.Author: Leslie E. Thomas "Lizzie"
Reviews.Content: I've had the 52-A650 for a few months now and just love it!  The picture is gorgeous, and the sound is amazing.  I have a relatively low light room and barely even notice the red bezel, even though I really like it.  I also love that the TV swivels, which the 750 didn't do.  I chose this TV from the excellent reviews on here and consumer reports.  The delivery was wonderful as well, and it's relatively easy to set up.  I was hesitant to order a TV online, but this is the best thing I've ever done.  It saved me at least $700 that I would have paid to Best Buy or another company.  Would recommend this TV to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture! Amazon was great!
Reviews.Author: A. Wentzel
Reviews.Content: I thought my LG upstairs had a good picture until I got the LN52A650.Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of ColorThe picture is crystal clear and looks 3D when watching HD channels. I thought about the 750, but did not like the halo affect the bezel created on the picture screen when I looked at if BestBuy.I would highly recommend this TV to anyone. 850 added the ability to wireless connect to my home network and steam my media directly to the tv. I opted to save the additional $1000 price tag and moved my laptop, that is my home network computer, to my family room and connected it up directly to the tv. Now I have the same capabilty for no extra money. You could also buy a cheap laptop for $300 connect that to your tv, tie that to your network wirelessly and share the meida files so you can pull them up on the TV.One other quick note: When it was delivered, the shipper told me they deliver at least 50 of these tv's per month and usually take one back for an issue. On the flip side, he told me they deliver about 10 Phillips and usually take back 3-5 of them for issues.Consumer reports rates the 650 high and the repair history for Samsung is low. I was able to get this tv from amazon with an extended 3 yr in house warranty $1000 cheaper than if I bought it from a local retailer. Plus they delivered it my house, carried to the room of my choise, unboxed it, inspected it for flaws and made sure it worked b4 leaving. Amazon made an easy choice.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52-inch LCD HDTV-GREAT HDTV
Reviews.Author: 65mick "65mick"
Reviews.Content: Great experience purchasing the Samsung LN52A650 52-inch LCD HDTV through Amazon.  After researching models and recommendations I ordered the HDTV on Sunday and it arrived on Wednesday via Pilot.  Saved over the national chain stores by a couple hundred dollars.  The Pilot driver was friendly, courteous and helped unpack and position the HDTV on our entertainment center.  Due to the temperature being in the teens the driver suggested I let the unit acclimate to room temperature before turning it on.  So far so good, still learning all the ins and outs of LCD HDTV ownership. No problems so far although did experience a popping noise when turning the unit off for awhile but think this was due to fine tuning settings with Charter Cable HD cable box and LCD HDTV.  Purchased HDMI cables through Amazon also for a LOT LESS than the national chain stores and the picture is GREAT! Decided to go with the Samsung 650 vs 750 as I wanted the swivel stand and didn't really want the additional bells/whistles that come with the 750.  We have located our Samsung in our great room which has southern exposure to the sun most of the day and lots of windows, two skylights and glare has not been a problem at all.  The TOC Bezel was really a no issue with us but it does look great with the darker woods of our furniture as it turns out.  I have not as yet adjusted any of the picture settings as the factory default settings have resulted in a GREAT picture so far.  I was a little leery making a big ticket purchase, especially a 52 inch LCD HDTV over the internet. But based on the comments of others I decided to go for it and it has been a painless experience so far ordering through Amazon and we couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650
Reviews.Author: Eleanor Moellers
Reviews.Content: It has been over a week since we received our Samsung. The only thing I can say is. Bravo Samsung and Amazon. Bravo to Samsung for an absolutely amazing TV. Bravo to Amazon for CEVA Shipping. They did everything the Amazon White Glove Service promises. The delivery men (2) were cordial, efficient, very careful handling the set and unpacked and set the unit in place quickly. They then collected the box after asking if we wanted it and were on their way. We couldn't be happier. The TV itself has an amazing picture, and the TOC everyone seems to have an issue with is non existent with me. You don't even notice it if the TV is positioned in the right place. My family room where the tv is ensconced has red in it so either way we were good to go! We will wait to see if the good experience still exists after a more lengthy time in use. However, right now I'd buy Samsung again through Amazon without reservation

Reviews.Title: Great picture, excellent connectivity, and Auto Motion Plus is awesome
Reviews.Author: Eric H. Lee
Reviews.Content: I researched a wide range of 52" LCD's and came to the conclusion that the LN52A650 fit my needs the best.  It also helped that it was CR's top rated 52" LCD.  Picture quality is exceptional, and the auto motion plus anti-juddering really gives the image a three-dimensional quality.  It doesn't look unnatural to me at all, but rather, immerses one in the scene.  The touch of red feature is just red plastic - its not backlit.  It is unobtrusive and you only notice the red if sunlight is shining on it.  As for glare, the picture is so bright that I do not see glare as an issue even with the afternoon sunshine right on the screen.Negatives?  I wish the remote had preset buttons for picture control - for example, I like to use different settings for watching movies vs watching broadcast cable HD channels.  Also the remote's scroll wheel tries to mimic an ipod, but is far less responsive.  This doesn't detract from the outstanding performance of the television though, and I would recommend it to everyone.I actually compared the LN52A650 to the Sony 52" XBR6 at the local BB and the pictures were essentially identical.  The XBR supposedly has better speakers but I don't know any home theater enthusiast who doesn't feed sound through a surround system, so the television's speakers don't get used anyways.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Happy with my new TV
Reviews.Author: Adrian "-ACB"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 4 months now and couldn't be happier. Picture quality is outstanding and the TV looks fantastic. Sure blacks could be better, but for an LCD they are pretty much as good as it gets. (At the moment in 2008) I've convinced three other friends to buy a Samsung 650 (of various sizes) and they are all extremely happy with their purchases.The 650 series is the sweet spot of Samsung TV's because it has the same great picture quality of the higher models but with a lower price but blows away the lower models in picture quality.You won't be sorry if you buy one.

Reviews.Title: Only the Best !
Reviews.Author: Gerald L. Russell
Reviews.Content: White glove delivery was Stellar,  Could not have been any better from start to finish. Two men in a truck.  They put shoe footies on so they would not track dirt in my home.Samsung has it all with their TV's.  Only wish was that they had a SD card slot.  Other than that the 6 series is perfect !What else can I sayGood job Amazon !Jruss

Reviews.Title: Finally, after lots of research....
Reviews.Author: Lawrence J. Konis
Reviews.Content: Amazon continues to amaze me.  After many years of eBay and Price Grabber shopping, I have come to the realization that Amazon generally has the best prices with the best service.  That lead me to eventually make this large purchase with some trepidation.  Boy, am I glad I did.  They delivered the set and placed it for me, and they honored a subsequent price reduction after I had already purchased the unit.  Now, the set:  The TV is brilliant, with a great picture, remote and menus.  It was the top choice in Consumer Reports and deservedly so.  the sound quality, while rated very high is a bit disappointing, but my expectations were probably unrealistic.  Great TV, great seller.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture Quality, Great Feature set
Reviews.Author: G K "gkidaho"
Reviews.Content: Bought the 52 Samsung 650 series after looking at the Sony, Toshiba and LG and very carefully at the Sony W series and XBR.  The picture quality is truly superb and very hard to discern from the Sony XBR and a cut above the Sony W for black levels and contrast.  Had great concerns over the more reflective screen on the 650 but it really is a non issue in the setting I use it and this issue is way overblown, I believe.  The TV "sees" exactly like a mirror so use that as a guide (the screen itself is not nearly as reflective as a mirror or the old CRT tube, though).  The matte screen on other models is actually a diffuse screen which diffuses the LCD output as well as absorbing and reflecting light around the room so it has it's own issues with the net result of lower contrast and less deep black.Features:  The USB port slide show from a thumb drive is great, easy to use and recognizes everything I plug in. Amazing picture quality at HD level.Infolink/Internet connection is cute but not that useful as it delivers a simple weather summary and stock quotes.  News is streamed in a way that is far short of being online on a PC so not that great.Bluray (24P or 60Hz 1080P signal):  Startling picture definition and detail especially on scenery and documentaries of landscape/nature.  Can't see any notable difference between 24P and 60 hz but it does work.Std DVD (480p)- Very nice picture quality and nearly as good without close study and 1080P.Broadcast tv- 720 to 1080i signals are really crisp although a short of Bluray due to compression artifacts (pixelization) more apparent.  480 broadcasts are OK/acceptable but seem weak compared to 720 and up.Cosmetics- TOC or red molded in edges on frame are apparent but not so strong as to be a concern to me.  I'd be more concerned with the glossy black frame as it will scratch easily without care.  Stand works really well to rotate the TV easily.I'm probably a more critical user than most due to engineering work in the printing/digital imaging field so consider that in this review.

Reviews.Title: The glare is not bad, the touch of red is not bright, the size is worth the money.
Reviews.Author: JamminJonah "Jonah"
Reviews.Content: I debated and researched this purchase until I was ready to give up.  These were my fears about this television:- Glare - the room this television is in has skylights, end table lamps, and a window directly opposite the screen.  The old CRT had TONS of distracting glare.* The glare is way less intrusive than the old CRT and is no longer an issue in the room unless the sun is coming directly through the window onto the TV.  Just have to shut the blinds though.  Do not be overly concerned with the alleged glare issue.- Size - I couldn't decide between 46 and 52.  Cost was my main concern.* Go 52 if the room can handle it.  The additional cost was TOTALLY worth it.- 120 hz - would it even make a difference?  Is it worth the extra couple hundred dollars?* Haven't had a ton of experience with this outside of gaming but compared to my 60 hz sharp this one is smooth as butter.  I have the motion thing set on low.- Touch of Red - is it going to look dated in a few years like the 80's sony trinitrons?  Would the style be overwhelming?*  Touch of red is subtle and only really evident on the top and bottom edge.  It looks much more pronounced in the Amazon photos.  I'm fine with the design and do not suspect it will make the set look all that dated though there is always that danger.  Touch of Red is subtle not radical.So how do I feel about it now?  I guess I should explain what I upgraded from and what I use this television to do.I upgraded from a bare bones 1997 Samsung 30 inch or so with 2 A/V composite inputs.  No S-Video, no component, and rough sound.I use this television to play Wii and Xbox 360.  I use this TV to watch DVD's and high def cable through Comcast.  I also stream Netflix  through my 360.  The only sport I really watch on TV is the occassional Bears football game (when I can stomach it  lately - or if they're playing the Packers) and quite a few Blackhawks hockey games.Love this TV.  Totally happy with my research and decision.  Movie mode is pretty close to perfect.  Also, even though there is no such thing as a replacement for callibration of your individual set you can get some pretty good settings here:[...] - link was tweaktvObviously an in home callibration is necessary to get the most out of your TV but the settings here are much better than factory default.*** update.  STILL love this thing. *** 1.07.10*** update again.  This TV still gets comments from my friends about how good the picture quality is.  I'm shocked by how good this TV still looks.  Would buy it again in a heartbeat.  Go Samsung!  You've impressed me! ***

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: S. Buchner
Reviews.Content: I ordered from the Warehouse Deals from Amazon.com.  The TV arrived 4 days after shipment.  It was in the original box.  However, the box had been opened as was noted in the description.  There are no scratches or dents on the TV.  Other than a bit of packing dust, it was in perfect condition.  I would recommend the Warehouse Deals.The quality of the picture is incredible!  This was a top rated LCD by Consumer Reports, so after viewing for a few days, it was easy to see why.The only drawback to this TV that I have found is that there is no output jack from the TV tuner.  As a result, I am unable to record a DVD using my tunerless Samsung DVD Recorder.Overall, a great TV for the price!

Reviews.Title: After two months of use....
Reviews.Author: Bobby Z
Reviews.Content: I've had the set for two months now.From ordering to delivery to product quality, this was a very pleasant online purchase experience.After narrowing my selection to Sharp, Sony, and Samsung, the Sammy won out based on picture quality and overall cost per feature.  In deciding between the 650 and 750, the bezel on the 650 has a more elegant look.  I thought the clear frame on the 750 looked and felt cheap, and prone to scratches, plus, I didn't need the additional features of the 750.  The red tint of the TOC bezel on the 650 is barely noticeable, and provides subtle warmth to the frame.  I have TV mounted directly on the wall and it looks like a piece of art.The picture is excellent and I have had no problems with this set.  Since my viewing room has windows on both side walls, I was concerned about reflection.  Like other reviewers noted, this is not a problem (unless you sit at an extreme angle with the screen black.)I recently tried the photo view mode.  It was seamless.  The TV recognized the camera device plugged into the USB port and displayed a slide presentation.  Using the remote, I easily navigated through the pictures on the camera.

Reviews.Title: It's Like Having Your Own IMAX Theater
Reviews.Author: Sea Hoss
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching this purchase online, as well as staring at different sets in the box stores. In the end, my only deliberation was between this set and the A630. The difference being that the A630 has a more matte finish to the screen (resulting in a slight drop of contrast 50,000:1 vs. 40,000:1) and has one less HMDI input (4 vs. 3).I had read some people's complaint that the A650's screen was distracting with the more glossy finish. I can say that I have this set in a room with windows on three walls, allowing in plenty of natural light regardless of the time of day, and there is zero problem with reflections off of this screen. Go for this set and enjoy the ever so slightly better picture (than that of the A630).The picture is mind-blowing. It is like having an IMAX theater in your family room. Whether it's HD cable, or Blu-ray movies, the picture is incredible: deep blacks, rich colors, great detail even with fast moving pictures. Another nice feature is the ability to plug a thumb drive into the USB port and the A650 will run a slide show of any jpeg's it finds on the drive.

Reviews.Title: Perfect quality and service from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I am not a gamer. I am a regular ol' TV watchin' gal.Wonderful TV. Would buy again in a heartbeat.Picture is beautiful. I've never seen anything more crisp and real.Sound is great. I like the sound bar on the side instead of at the bottom of the screen.Doesn't come with HDMI cables, but DirecTV (if you plan on getting it) will provide.I wish I could rate Amazon's service.  I'd give it a million stars. The white glove service was spot on.  The CEVA guy arrived and did exactly as stated, hooked everything up and removed all evidence that the TV arrived that day.  He left me with a remote and a manual.  No plastic, no boxes, none of that. He was friendly and polite. I inspected it for "obvious damage," which is what is required and signed the delivery slip and off he went.Later that night I noticed small scratches and gouges (through the metal and plastic) on the rear/side upper left corner of the TV.  I immediately called Amazon.  Because it was late on a Friday night, I had to wait until Monday morning to speak with someone in the "TV department."  Instead of waiting for them to call, I called.  They appreciated my quick attention to the matter, asked me a couple questions and then gave me two options: (1) keep the tv and accept a discount for purchasing a slightly damaged one or (2) get a perfect new one.I chose (2).  Within 24 hours, they shipped a new TV to me.  When it arrived, the CEVA guy took the old one and replaced it with the new one.  Once again, completely professional and it was like you never knew he was there.I would highly recommend using Amazon simply because of the service (without regard to their low price--the lowest I've found anywhere).I'll buy all my large/expensive electronics from Amazon from now on.

Reviews.Title: It's tack sharp, but you'll need to learn some stuff
Reviews.Author: D. Fraser "Mojo88"
Reviews.Content: OK, I've had my LN52A650 for a week now. Amazon delivery was great. The guys brought it in and we turned on the TV and watched a couple of channels, just to make sure everything was OK. This is a wise thing to do, as they can take it right back if something isn't right. My screen seemed fine.Previously, I had a 50" Samsung DLP, so I was used to HD pic quality, but the new LN52A650 is noticeably sharper than my old DLP (which crapped out after only 4 years). I watched Russel Crowe in "Gladiator" using a Samsung 1080P7 (non-HD) DVD player and I swore it was in HD. It was incredibly sharp and clear. I have watched football games in HD and I could detect no motion blur at all, the games looked awesome. Some programming in SD is not so hot, but it's livable.The LN52A650 setup is somewhat complex, so you'll need to educate yourself on calibrating and such. There are a number of sites that offer calibrations from others to get you started. I recommend joining a forum or two, something like "AVS Forum" where you can ask questions about calibrating. If you want the best picture this thing can offer, then you will definitely need to do some adjusting (calibrating).The remote is OK. I love the fact that the backlight is motion-sensing. As soon as you pick up the remote, the backlight comes on. The remote has a funky scroll wheel, which is overly-sensitive and it will mess you up in the beginning, but once you get used to it, the remote works fine.The LN52A650 screen is highly reflective. If your viewing area has strong lighting, then you may need to add some blinds or curtains. The TOC (touch of color) is barely noticeable and I like the deep red. But it mainly looks black.Overall, a fabulous TV, with a tack-sharp pic that won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: After a lot of research, I picked this one
Reviews.Author: Chip L "chip1978"
Reviews.Content: This TV was CNET's editor's choice back in the spring.  It also scored highly in consumer reports.My personal experience has been very good. For the price, this TV is a bargain.  I don't think you'll find another 1080p 52" for this price.  It's much bigger in the living room than on the show-room floor.I'm no technical guru, but the picture looks great.  When the 120 Hz processor is turned all the way up, it can make some shows/movies have that distorted "soap opera" look.  On sports (e.g. the Olympics or football), it looks great.I researched TV's for almost a year before buying this one.  You won't find a better deal.  The picture is great.  If you've been looking to make the jump to a big screen TV, this one is for you.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and an excellent purchase experience
Reviews.Author: Dr. Nydia Welles
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV with red touch on August 6, 2008.  It was delivered in 5 days in perfect condition.  The purchase through Amazon.com was quite easy and the transaction was finalized as expected.  The TV was set in place and left functioning by the delivery people.  They annonunced their arrival early morning and on the road a few minutes upon reaching our home.  We had an excellent service and are delighted with the TV set although it is smaller than the old TV we replaced. It delivers a rich picture with good sound, although not all channels are equipped yet with HD, still the lines and colors are sharp and when we get a HD program, it seems we are sharing the scene with the actors.  We purchase this TV at an excellent price and will be able to pay it on payments, using the Amazon credit card, without interest if we complete our obligation in two years.  Furthermore, we were able to get a price adjustment and reduce the bill a bit more.  Sorry to hear that Amazon has discontinued the refund under the Post-Order Price Guarantee.  This was the icing of the cake, but still we did a good purchase and dealt with excellent service. Dr. Nydia Welles.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing
Reviews.Author: Julian G. Romero
Reviews.Content: Wow.  That's the best way for me to describe the TV.  I went from a tube TV to a 52 inch Toshiba DLP and thought the transition was great.  When I bought this Samsung, I felt the DLP I had was my old tube TV.  The picture is phenomenal.  I hooked both my Xbox 360 and PS3 and played games and was amazed how clear, and crisp the picture looked.  The detail and picture had me speechless but that was just the beginning of it.When I placed a Blu-Ray disk (Alien vs Predator) into my Playstation 3 and played it, I was in awh.  I couldn't believe the clarity, the detail...I'm still speechless.  I felt this TV just put my DLP to shame.  One of my gripes about Alien vs Predator was the scenes in the movie when it was dark.  I had a hard time making out what was going on.  Not with this TV.  I could see the Aliens running around in the tunnels where as with my DLP, I could barely make them out.  It was a frustrating experience to watch on my DLP, not anymore with this Samsung.  You can see what was going on in the intense action scenes with perfect motion clarity and no haze or blur.  Another thing, with such clarity, I could see just how fake the Aliens were.  Something I couldn't do with the DLP.I gave the TV a 4 star rating because the sound system was less than spectacular.  It really doesn't bother me since I have a Samsung surround sound system.  It also would have been nice to up date the firmware with the network (internet) connection instead of having to download the firmware onto a usb flash drive and then plugging it in to the TV.If you are in the market for an LCD, buy this model right now.  I swear you will not be disappointed.  The price may make you look at a cheaper model and/or brand, but I guarantee the price of this Samsung is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Critical review
Reviews.Author: Zeppelin
Reviews.Content: Welcome to my critical review of the Samsung A650.After reading all the positive reviews about this TV, and reading about the other Samsung model (A750) I decided the A650 would be my new living room set.  The A750 had some bad reviews about the glare on edges of the screen border.  The A650 did not!This was my first big ticket item I bought from Amazon.  The delivery went well.  I called CEVA and setup a time with them to bring it out. Two guys from CEVA carried the set in, unpacked it and pluged it in.  They were in a hurry but gave me a chance to check it out before I signed off the delivery release.Overall I'm very pleased with this set but I wanted to post the negitives I've had with it.  This is nit picking somewhat but I feel others can gain something from this - read below.Problems encountered: - The firmware needs some work.  I did NOT have the problem of the set turing off as some owners did, but I decided to update the firmware anyway.  The latest is always best, right?  Wrong!  After downloading firmware from Samsung, copying to my USB drive and plugging it into the TV the upgrade began.  Easy enough.  I was watching digital over the air TV as I had not yet got my Sat receiver yet.  When watching over the air the TV would suddenly make a LOUD full volume screaming sound out the speekers, then turn off, then back on for about 30 seconds, and crash again, turn off, turn on, crash... You get the idea.  Oh great I thought!!  Just killed my new tv!  I could not back out of the upgrade because Samsung does not post older versions of the firmware.  I had to search the internet to find it.  When I downgraded the firmware version the problem went away.  Pretty scary thinking I killed a $2200 TV set!  Samsung needs to get their act together on this.  Now that I have my Sat TV receiver hooked up via HDMI I'm able to use the latest firmware without problems.  If I were to guess, the firmware has an issue if the over the air TV signal is weak - causing the TV to crash.  (note to techies - the TV runs a custom version of Linux!!)Other negitives:* When switching inputs from one HDMI source to another, the set will not switch until about 4 seconds have gone by and it has 'locked' on the signal AND you've pressed enter.  A little annoying.  Could be fixed in software - (Hint hint Samsung!)* The remote is just OK, could be better for a set like this.* When watching the TV and the program suddenly goes from white to black for more then a few seconds, you will see the screen fade from a light white color to black.  Its almost like the LCD screen is un-charging.  I'm being very critial here and its not that noticeable.So.... Would I tell my friends to buy this TV.  YES!  Its well worth the money!  I read in the paper that Samsung is losing money for each set sold because they are trying to compete with the bargin brands.  Bad for Samsung, good for us customers!  Plus Amazon was $400+ cheaper then the retail big box stores in town.  Hats off to Amazon and Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Love the HD picture quality
Reviews.Author: Brian D. Garbarino
Reviews.Content: This is my very first HD tv!  I waited as long as I could and finally purchased one that was at the price I was looking for and had all the bells and whistles I wanted.The picture quality is the best i've seen and I do not even notice or see the red tint so that isn't even an issue.  I'm not sure why the big bad reviewers knocked it so hard.The setup of the TV was easy and straight forward.  I loved that it was delivered and setup on my entertainment stand and all I had to do was hook up my AVR receiver.The purchasing experience with Amazon was great.  the only issue is that I wish it would of been delivered sooner.  It took about two weeks to receive mine.  and the other reason I'm giving this review 4 stars is the remote is terrible but I fixed that by going with a universal remote.anyways I love this tv and I'm glad I waited.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: D. Roberts
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the LN52A650 form an old Sansui 27" CRT.  I had some concerns before buying the TV since this is my first set that isn't a CRT and is far bigger than any TV I've owned.After some initial disappointment (due to my cable box being stuck outputting 480i) I have to say this TV is fantastic.  The out of the box picture settings are not fantastic, I found the normal, game and sports settings way too bright, but there are more settings than you can shake a stick at.  I'm no expert but after a lot of fiddling I have a setup I'm happy with.  The blacks are actually black, very black, the picture clarity is sharp and even the TV speaker is not horrible.  I was worried about how standard definition would look but I'm pleasantly surprised.  I've seen a number of other TV's in the same size range that look great with HD but pretty awful with SD.  Although SD is not a patch on HD and there are some stations that look better than others, the SD display is very good.  The most interesting feature on the TV is the 120Hz Auto Motion Plus.  I love it for sports and any other show that realistic movement is not a downside, eg talk shows, food network and cartoons to a certain extent.  For me it's not so great for movies and other shows filmed in the same type of format, it's just too realistic and looks not quite right.  I usually have it off or on low for these types of shows but I hear a lot of people love it.There are some other things that are nice.  Plenty of connections, although if you are hooking anything up using s-video the connection is only on the side, nice looking frame, pretty light for the size, nice viewing angle and nice menu structure.  There are also some downsides.  The "iPod" wheel on the remote feels flimsy and really doesn't need to be there, it's just dumb.  The frame especially does seem to attract a fair amount of dust as well.  None of the issues I have with it really detract from how good it is as a whole though.  One thing I found annoying is that when using the picture adjustments a lot of the features are locked depending on selections made elsewhere.  It would be nice if the manual included something that told you what selections lock others, maybe it's in there but I just haven't found it though.Overall I love the TV and would recommend it.  It's not cheap but I think it is worth the money based on how it performs now and with the features it has that should mean it shouldn't be out of date any time soon.As a final note to a select number of people.  If you are picking this TV up from somewhere, it lays perfectly flat in a Mazda5 with the back seats folded down!

Reviews.Title: All my research paid off--totally happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: MaineFrank "Frank"
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!  All the great reviews on here and on other sites got me thinking about this particular brand and model.  I had little experience with HD TVs so I spent weeks reading about various models, the pros and cons of plasma versus LCD and other such info.  I checked review sites such as Consumer Reports and CNET to gain some understanding as to the quality afforded by various models.  I made numerous visits to the Best Buy showroom to look at this model in person and was blown away by its picture, as was the Best Buy salesperson with whom I spoke.  In fact they had a blu-ray movie playing on a 650 to show just how great the picture was!  Over time it became readily apparent to me that there was nothing out there at the price Amazon offered that I could get that would be any better.I ordered this TV from Amazon on Saturday, June 14; it shipped on Monday, June 16 and was in my living room by 11:30 AM Wednesday, June 18--and the shipping was free!  With no shipping fee, no sales tax and this low price on Amazon I saved hundreds over the best deal I could find at any local store. And over the next 30 days I got 3 refunds totalling $128 because of the price dropping on here--all I had to do was monitor the price each day and email Customer Service to request a refund when I saw a price reduction. It was easy to do and they quickly made a refund to my credit card each time.I find myself just sitting in front of this TV amazed at the clarity, the colors, the depth of blacks, the perfect motion...my friend bought a 52" Sony Bravia model a month prior to my purchase and he wishes that he had seen this model on Amazon as he paid hundreds more for his TV but there appears to be no difference in the quality or performance! I find the surround sound to be very good and the overall sound to be definitely better than the sound on any other TV I have owned--I can't imagine how good it will be to watch a movie with this TV hooked to an ET system. And the Touch of Color? I have had nothing but compliments on the way the actual set looks just sitting in my living room.Bottom line:  If you are considering this TV get it--you will not find any other TV of this quality for this price.  Oh, one more thing--AFTER I bought it Consumer Reports evaluated this TV and gave it their highest rating of all the LCDs they have rated.  One more confirmation that indeed I did make the right choice!

Reviews.Title: Super clear, super bright, some artifacts with Auto Motion Plus
Reviews.Author: L. Szu Tao
Reviews.Content: Been waiting for this tv for months...finally got it yesterday. It was super bright and super clear (with the gloss screen), amazing color too. There are some reflections if you have a bright room, otherwise the brightness of the image will outshine the reflections. I can only find a better picture in Samsung's own 5281f but it does not have 120hz Auto Motion Plus.I love the Auto Motion Plus, (low - high), even it induces some artifacts. For slower motion scenes, everything looks so life like, it is like animated real life motion....some people may not like it cause it is so non-traditional tv like. It also depends on the source material, if the source is blur motion, then the AMP does not seem to change it too much (e.g. 480i tv material), but you can see the effect on 1080i tv material and dvd, and most noticibly on 1080p hd-dvd & blueray. Of course you can always turn the AMP off and it will look like your old tv motion...if you don't mind slight artifacts around your images during fast motions, you will love this feature.This quality, this image, and this size, for this price, it is a no-brainer. Oh the CEVA delivery service in the Bay Area CA was excellent too, they waited for you to tune all channels and hook up to the HDDVD to check functions and picture! I have never seen that in my life. Only complaint is that Amazon did not give them my phone number, I have to contact CEVA to schedule delivery.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: N. Uddin
Reviews.Content: We got ours a week ago.  Came in perfect package.  Installation was straight forward.  I was concerned that HDTV doesn't look as great as they do in the store.  My family room has fair amount of light reflection - but TV picture looks  great and seems to adjust automatically.  I am satisfied 100%.  I also found a perfectly matching TV stand - Techcraft BW25125M TV Stand  - I bought it at local B&B; Appliance in Cleveland area for $269.  Can't get any better than that.I also got 36 months same as cash deal from Amazon card.Also, prices dropped by $95 today.  I called Amazon and they credited my account for the difference - no questions asked.  All in all will highly recommend this TV to everyone.  Great buying experience at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Perfection!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Colson
Reviews.Content: I can only conclude how everyone that rated this T.V. 5 stars was absolutely correct!!  I want to thank them since they were a big part of the reason for going with this T.V.I can only completely agree with the review right before mine.  I already had a Blu-Ray player and it looked marginally better on my old Hitachi High-Def rear project.  Each time I went into the store to view the t.v.'s there I could only yearn for the pictures their sets were displaying.  Yearn no more!!!  My T.V. arrived a week ago and we promptly hooked up our Blu-Ray player.  We also got DirecTV to install a High Def PVR.  With the combination of this T.V. and my Blu-Ray and Satellite box I finally have what the retail shops are displaying.  The picture is so crystal clear you actually think you are there.  It actually takes a little getting use to since it seems so real.  I am used to it now and never going back!!The previous viewer remarked about the blacks.  I saw the same thing at the store....When the T.V. switches in between clips and goes to black it actually goes to black...Not a muddy black, but the truest black I have ever witnessed.  The contast of colors and the clarity can't be beat.  Go to any retail store and stand back just enough so you can't see which name brand you are looking at.  Pick the best T.V. out of the bunch and I can almost bet it will be the Samsung every time.You might want to buy the T.V. right then and there and take it from the store.  Try not to.  Go home, get online, purchase it from Amazon, save a bundle.  When it arrives (ahead of schedule in my case) you won't regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: TV is the Best I've seen
Reviews.Author: James A. North
Reviews.Content: TOuch of Color 120mzh 1080P! Must I say more!?!?I have a Samsung DLP 50" and a Panasonic Plasma 50 inch and this is the best of them all.  The clarity is unbelievable, crazy with BlueRay and from Amazon, its the best deal out there.  Must buy for people looking for a Top-of-the-line TV at a good Value.  Little Red on the outside (but doesn't stick-out)

Reviews.Title: A great LCD, a great VALUE
Reviews.Author: Alistair Sinclair
Reviews.Content: After waiting for YEARS, super LCD, at the right price point, with the right features for me, not too heavy at around 70 pounds, perfect for a wall mount, touch-of-colour matches faux painting scheme on our plaster beautifully, 1080p, great connections, great HDTV viewing on HD channels, and DVD, this is an outstanding product.Look at some Plasmas, look at Sony Bravia, then decide. This TV seems to have motion blur covered, black background, brightness and contrast covered, no speaker bar to look at, a nice color accent, very clean. The pioneer plasmas are great too, and the Sony Bravia's ... you just have to go see and decide on what works for you.  The Samsung is a very nice product that should be on your short list.  I know folks at Best Buy who cannot wait to 'get theirs' :)R we not lucky to be alive now?  Can't WAIT for Olympics, followed by football season, woohoo!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV,  Great Price
Reviews.Author: S. Kraft
Reviews.Content: This Samsung TV is one of the best LCD's on the market.  The picture in both SD and HD is magnificent.  I have always owned Sony TV's and feel the Samsung is much better than the Sony XBR4 at almost half the price.  I performed a side by side comparison of these two TV's in my house and the Samsung had a much more vibrant picture.  The first Samsung I ordered from Amazon arrived before the date promised and the White Glove delivery was excellent.  This TV, however, had a couple of clearly visible flaws from the factory on the top edge.  I notified Amazon and they sent out another TV within a week and took the first one back.  The second TV was flawless and dealing with Amazon was no problem at all.  I highly recommend the Samsung LN52A650 and buying from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650
Reviews.Content: I did buy this LCD -Samsung LN52A650 on May 1st week....I see no issues till now.....Style and process is very great.....Best TV i have seen so far...better than SONY X4 or X5...I have researched for almost 6 monts with Samsung and Sony....Samsung is the best and less price/more features compared to Sony...I will suggest this to all...Thanks Sudhan D.

Reviews.Title: 52: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Sherry A. Merriman Budge "SamB"
Reviews.Content: Large screen LCD TV with a fantastic picture...sometimes almost looks 3D.  Watching this year's AMAZING U.S. Open at Torrey Pines as WOW!!!!  It arrived quickly and safely and has given us many hours of viewing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Matthew Kennedy
Reviews.Content: The TV looks great.  After a little tweaking, the color is fantastic and the blacks and contrast are too.  This TV comes with so many user adjustable settings, it's like a TV for pros.  You can even adjust the white balance!The AMP feature, and similar features from other manufacturers, is a gimmick, so don't buy the TV based on that unless you like the look of unnatural movement that's sometimes jerky.The Red bezel is noticeable but not terribly so.  Besides, it makes it look kind of cool.  My wife said that it looked like a nice piece of furniture in addition to being a functional entertainment item.  So that's cool.Anyway, if you are in the market for an LCD right now, this one is about tops in the market currently and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Overall Great experience - start to finish.
Reviews.Author: Sean M. Latimer "Latts"
Reviews.Content: Shipper (CEVA) was superb...quick response, great communication and tv arrived a full 10 DAYS prior to quote from Amazon!  CEVA even let me change shipping address mid-shipment w/o any issue or delay to shipment.  They scheduled my appointment around MY availability and delivered on a Saturday.  Total order went from purchase on Wednesday - to in my house and setup in my living room on Saturday.  Professional delivery service  and could not ask for more from them.  Very accommodating.TV is outstanding in both terms of external looks and actual display.  When viewing a true 1080p image, makes HiDef look like Standard definitionin comparison.  You can put your eye 1 inch from screen and not see any distortion.  Amazing in terms of a 52" tv.  Next level stuff.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular High Def LCD TV
Reviews.Author: creative art "P.J."
Reviews.Content: I've only had the TV two week, but it looks great on HD channels, it's like you're sitting at the game. I haven't really sat down to figure out all of the adjustments, but it still look good the way it is compare to my other TV. I haven't had any problems and would highly recommend this TV, it looks fantastic and it's at a great price compared to any walk-in store.

Reviews.Title: Happy But
Reviews.Author: Middlebury "Middlebury"
Reviews.Content: This LCD TV was supposed to be delivered with the white glove service.When the product arrived the carrier (Pilot) said the order was changed .I had to help the delivery person (Great Guy) carry the TV into my home.We both unpackaged the unit and lifted it up on the stand.I do not blame the delivery person at all but someone made a change here that was not appreciated.The white glove service influenced my decision to make the purchase with Amazon.The Guy said they normally do not take the box away if the order is not white glove but he did anyway.When I called Amazon to relate my complaint, the offered me  $5.00 off my next purchase.Delivery was very prompt along with much aggravation.In my opinion Amazon does not give their phone people the tools to handle these kinds of issues.I base this on the minutes I was on hold while the phone person talked with a supervisor.The results were not worth my time waiting.The Samsung LCD TV has some issues that are not uncommon to LCD as a Product Category.The main issue is what is called flash lighting.When the screen is black(Gray), what appears on the screen,are much lighter areas , almost as if a flashlight was shinning on the screen.This is most pronounce on very dark scenes.You can see this mostly  at the corners of the set.It is distracting at first.  I believe this is dissapointing at first due to the cost of the unit as well as the high expectations for a TV of this Price.I have calibrated this TV and was able to improve on this condition but it does not go away.If you are really picky this will really bother you.From what I have read on other sites, this may be an issue on most sets.Blacks are not as good as advertised.Room for improvement here.

Reviews.Title: HD @ It's Best
Reviews.Author: W. Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Just received this tv today and let me tell you right off the bat,if your'e looking for a tv that wows you then look no further than the Samsung LN52A650LCD TV.Picture quality is stupendous,color,contrast,brightness and motion are outstanding.I played Blu-ray,HDDVD,DVD,MP4 Files.Just finished watching Transformers on HDDVD And could not believe my eyes,it's like I was watching it LIVE.I have only 1 gripe,the remote control sucks,the middle wheel thingy is too sentitive.Other than that this tv is the best I've seen so far.
