Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, the shiny screen is a slight negative.
Reviews.Author: AZ Mutley
Reviews.Content: I've only just got my hands on this beauty, but the 5 movies I've watched have been breath taking. My old Sceptre 1080p set from 2 years ago made the Blu Ray version of Layer Cake look rather disappointing with jagged motionartifacts.The Samsung works very much better and you get that "almost there" feeling. The touch of red is hardly noticeable, and because of the shiny screen you'll want to keep  this TV in a darkened room anyway, so you won't notice it. That's my one negative, the screen reelects everything.Personally I am not bothered as I have the set back lit and in my old home movie room which is completely dark, but some thing to consider when buying.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV EVER!!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Bravo
Reviews.Content: I just got this tv on 4/29/08 and i love everything about it!!they had this same tv at bestbuy for [...].and i bought it on amazon.com for a way better deal and its worht it. the 1080p on a ps3 is awsome,120Hz is freaking great and also the 50,000-1 contrast ratio is great . every detail of this tv and features is  worht the money!!!. samsung did a great job with this tv.p.s my tv came updated with the new firmware so i had no problem with it shutting off on me!!!. BEST TV EVER!!!!

Reviews.Title: Picture problems after 4 year warranty is up
Reviews.Author: busymom100
Reviews.Content: We have had our Samsung LN52A650 for 4 years 8 months.  Bought a 4 year extended warrenty. So 8 months out of warranty when we turn on the tv the background is red instead of black and she we turn on the cable box the dark areas are a sparkly red.  This lasts for anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes and then goes back to normal.  Samsung's 800 number was absolutely no help.  I called a repair guy, he said it might be dust inside the tv and to bang the back to knock it loose.  No improvement.  I honestly think my tv is dying.  When tv's had picture tubes they lasted decades.  Now we seem to be stuck with inferior "high tech"  replacements.  Or maybe it is just Samsung has products that don't last.  We also have the tv turning itself on and off occasionally, I just thought that is was some weird frequency thing from a business across the street, but I see other people have it too.  I would appreciate it if anyone else has had the red color problem to reply to this.  I would never buy another Samsung.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed in quality
Reviews.Author: scott ettlinger
Reviews.Content: i need to let other prospective purchasers of samsung tv's know about my experience. i bought the LN52A650 52 inch 1080p 120hz lcd hdtv on 12/18/08. it is now 8/16/13 and the tv is now worthless. i understand the tv is 4 1/2 years old and that the 4 year extended warranty is now expired. i took the tv to a local repair shop and i was told the main board needs to be replaced. that is a $1000 part with $200 handling and shipping fee on top. the repairman told me to call samsung and tell them about the problem since he has been seeing a lot of the samsungs come into his shop with the same problem. samsung told me they had a recall on the capacitors (which tells me they have another problem besides the main boards crapping out in under 5 years). samsung told me there was nothing they could do. i recommend staying away from samsung,

Reviews.Title: My diamond has turned to dust
Reviews.Author: ScoobysMyMan "RuckoRaggee"
Reviews.Content: This is about the TV I purchased from amazon.com - Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of ColorMy Samsung LN52A650 TV started having problems turning on two weeks ago. It would click repeatedly for five minutes before finally coming on. Now the TV will not power on. I bought the TV in February 2009. The TV worked great and I was very pleased, up until two weeks ago.I filed a claim with Squaretrade. We'll see how they handle it and will update later. If they can't fix it and compensate me $$, I will not be buying another Samsung, most likely a Sony.Scooby

Reviews.Title: bad power supply
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: First I will say that hands down for the price this set has one of the finest pictures around.And now the bad news - either the quality control or effort in design is horrible.A very common problem with Samsung electronics is to use cheap components and in some cases undervalued components.The Power Supply board is known to generally fail within thirteen or so months due to blown capacitors. In the circuit where 16 to 25 volt caps should be placed Samsung selected to put just 10 volt and the results are blown caps in a very short time frame.The fix for anyone familiar with how to replace board components is relatively easy as this board in question is very accessible from the back of the set. But for the majority it means shelling out a few hundred dollars to get fixed.Will I buy another Samsung - cannot say for sure if it is worth the trouble.By comparison I have a smaller Vizio LCD quite a few years old that is on all the time and has a nice picture - not once has it ever given us a problem. I think the next round is going to be reliability vs. picture quality.

Reviews.Title: I should have listened to the bad evaluations on this product
Reviews.Author: Stratford Boy "video crazy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit back in May 09'.  I had indeed, looked over all of the posted comments concerning the Samsung LN52A650A1F.  I purchased it anyway, and are now suffering with the rest of those poor souls that experience problems with the unit having their capacitors burning out, as well as the unit turning itself off/on sporatically!  The Samsung Technician has been by here so many times, we've become best friends!  Yes, for Pete's sakes, DON'T BUY THIS UNIT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Seriously?
Reviews.Author: Aimers
Reviews.Content: I've had the TV about 3 weeks and it died in the middle of a movie last night.  I went through the troubleshooting steps and still had to call Samsung.  I now have to wait 2 business days for a company to call me to schedule a time to come take a look at the TV.  I'm pretty upset.

Reviews.Title: samsung 52 lcd TV
Reviews.Author: James E. Mcintyre Sr.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV thinking since it was the top of the line there would be no problem. I purchased it April 6,09, it arrived April 15. May 5th we were watching TV with friends.  The TV went blank.  We went through all the troublshootings suggested and nothing worked.  So now the TV we had less than a month is at the shop getting fixed.  It's under warranty but that's not the point!  If I had to do it over again I would not purchase this TV.  My neighbor has the same TV and it continues to cut off, and the warranty is over.

Reviews.Title: What an incredible example of technology at its' best ...
Reviews.Author: Ted Bear "TedBear"
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an incredible example of technology at its' finest. Like most others, we were blown away by the picture quality right out of the box, even with the default settings. Though it's been out for over a year, the Samsung LN52A650 makes one wonder how it would be possible to improve on.That said, we were greatly concerned about the reflection problem, but, we found the Samsung to have much less glare than our older JVC large screen CRT. In fact, it boils down to be an entirely non issue.Price aside, we also purchased the 650 over it's sibling 750 mainly because of the swivel base. The TV, even though under 100 lbs. is still a load, especially when trying to access the connections in the back. The swivel feature obviously makes it much easier. As a bonus, we didn't realize that as in the 750, there is a USB port - in our case a big plus.Bottom line, we've found the TV to far surpass our expectations. Some high def programs are absolutely incredible - almost like what true 3D should be (w/o the awful glasses and bad color rendition). Hopefully, you'll get as much enjoyment out of your purchase as we have. Cheers !!

Reviews.Title: Love it so far.
Reviews.Author: R. Martin
Reviews.Content: I'd been watching the prices on this TV for awhile after reviewing ConsumerReports reviews on LCD tvs (and this Model was their #1 in the 52" category).  I'm happy I decided on this TV.Great Picture, Lots of inputs and lots of options.  Default settings on this TV appear to be great.Pros: Great Picture, Lots of video inputs, swivel stand.Cons: None noticed so far.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: H. Adams "F-1 Fan"
Reviews.Content: Could not be happier, price, delivery, promotional financing.  Great TV picture, sound, user friendly, also the Touch of Color is a very eye pleasing alternative to the standard black. Be hard [if not impossible] to find a better package.

Reviews.Title: A Winning Choice
Reviews.Author: S. Borland "slbwashingtondc"
Reviews.Content: The HDTV just got delivered to our home by CEVA and we are so very very happy with this purchase. First, I would like to thank all the customers out there who take the time to write reviews. Many of the reviews were so helpful in figuring out what works best for our family's needs and wants.There are many more reviewers out there far more eloquent with words in describing the picture, so I will just say *WOW* and *AWESOME PICTURE*. The quality of the TV is just as good as we expected. The sound quality is not an issue for us as we already have a home theater system. We wanted the 120 Hz for sports.The process of ordering and delivery was very smooth.  We ordered on Feb 14 and the set was delivered Feb 20, about a week earlier than promised! The delivery service that Amazon used to deliver our set was top-notch. The guys were so nice. I wasn't sure about ordering a TV through the internet, but between all the reviewers and Consumer Reports and personal positive experience with Amazon, I felt that the risk was minimal. Full disclosure... A big motivator to order from Amazon was the price - about $830 less than the local BB store. I did a lot of research on flat screen TVs and feel that we made a winning choice.  Originally I had decided that a plasma (also Samsung) was the right choice. But when we looked at it in the BB, we felt it was way too reflective. My family liked the LCD better because the reflections in the plasma were just too distracting. I agreed. I had not looked at LCDS, because I was concerned that the blacks would be too dull. We looked at the Samsung LCD and thought it was similar enough to the plasma in terms of the vividness of black, yet was not as reflective. So, back to the internet I went to scour reviews and shop prices on the Samsung LCD. The reflectiveness of the screen was a concern I saw in other reviews, but I hardly noticed it compared to the plasma we nearly bought. The frame is reflective, but I don't notice it though others might find it distracting.We are so pleased with the TV and the service. This has been a winner of a purchase for us.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52-inch 120HZ LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Sherry D "Sherry D"
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the Samsung HDTV.  The picture in HD is very sharp.  It makes you feel like the people on TV are actually in your living room.  The screen on the Samsung TV with the touch of color looks far more classy than any other TV on the market.  We also love the fact that the 650 series TV stand swivels so that you can get a good view no matter where you set in the room.  We looked at and researched every LCD TV on the market and I think this is the best one for the money.  The free white glove delivery service thru Amazon was wonderful.  I was skeptical to order such a big dollar item over the internet but with the great customer service and delivery  we got from Amazon I would do it again in a heart beat.  All of our friends have commented on how great the picture is on our new Samsung.  It is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Stunning Display
Reviews.Author: Ea Gregory
Reviews.Content: Did plenty of research before deciding on the 52" 650 series and it really paid off - it's just about a perfect set.  The blacks are dark and crisp, bright colors pop right out, sports and other rapid motion look smooth, plenty of inputs, subtle red frame is a nice touch, even like the back-lit remote.Gave two local A/V shops a chance to match the price offered by Amazon but they couldn't even come close.  The set was delivered a week ahead of schedule and brought right into our LR - the shipping co even offered to set it up.  Very professional and all-around highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: I, Sam, sing about Samsung
Reviews.Author: Samuel Jay Keyser "Samuel Jay Keyser"
Reviews.Content: Consumer Reports rated this TV the best of the 50" and upwards sets on the market.  I can attest that they weren't just whistling dixie. After examining the field from Panasonic to Sharp, to Vizier to Lg to Sony to Sharp, all with great qualities of their own, I opted for the Samsung. Why?  I just couldn't get all those solid red circles out of my mind, particularly the one that said "great sound system." The 52" LCD HD Samsung lives up to its CR rating.  It delivers an extraordinary picture when the signal is up to it and its Blu-Ray reproduction is nothing short of stunning. The sound is, indeed, great. And the red styling of the case that encases the screen is a knockout of understated elegance. If you are someone who likes to look at the big picture then this is the TV for you.  It is, to this big picture viewer, flawless.

Reviews.Title: I thought this could never happen, but...
Reviews.Author: S. Leal
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with my TV. It's absolutely wonderful. This is coming from someone who researched the hell out of TVs before making the jump. If you're a regular person who wants an awesome TV at a great price, you'll absolutely love this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Brett Cunningham "Brett"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this from Amazon late on Sunday, February 1st and received it on the afternoon of Wednesday, February 4th. Amazing service! As for the TV, it is absolutely wonderful. The best part about this TV aside from the amazing picture quality is the super clear panel, which provides an extra clear picture over most of the other LCDs currently on the market that have matte screens. Also, the TV can swivel 15 degrees both left and right which will help with any glare issues that might be caused from windows/lights. I have not had any of the issues  that are common to LCD technology such as clouding/flashlighting, TBE, motion-blur, or purple haze.Be sure to check out avsforums as there are entire threads devoted to setting up and calibrating this TV. The picture is very good out of the box but with a few calibrations, the picture quality reaches a whole different level. Blu-rays look amazing, DVDs look great, and cable also looks good. High-def cable looks the best, but as opposed to some other LCDs, standard-def TV looks fairly good as well. I definitely recommend this TV for anyone that wants a top-tier TV that's reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: P. Cooke
Reviews.Content: The SAMSUNG LCD 650 product Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color is an excellent value, though there are several nuances to consider. First, the Touch of Color is very difficult to discern in the store - once the set is in your room, it is more evident. Fortuanately, I like it. Secondly, unlike many LCDs, these models have a reflective surface, just like plasma. If the room has a lot of reflective light, then you may want to consider other LCDs or even Plasma. The 50" Samsung Plasma was far cheaper than the 52"LCD. Again, not a problem for my set-up. Third, the set comes mounted on a swivel stand. This capability was an important capability in my room set up. I found that not all sets swivel.The set arrived in a timely manner, though the white glove service was a bit disappointing. While "set-up" was promised, it was far less than that. They take it out of the box, place it on furniture and plug it into an outlet and verify "blue screen". In my case, they said it was too cold to risk plugging it in, so they left. After a couple of hours, plugged it in, connected components and everything worked beautifully. Only have a set top box that is digital, bought an HDMI cable through Amazon, but it did not work with the set-top box. Don't know whether it is the HDMI cable, the set-top box or the TV. I am still trying to verify if the TV is the problem. All of the component connections work just fine; they were well marked, easy to get to (and there are lots of them!), which is a good thing.A couple of annoyances to consider. the TV controls are invisible on the lower right front panel - making them virtually useless. You have to use the remote, which is the other annoyance. It uses a track wheel for Menu set-up and adjustments (setting time, color balance, etc.). It just does not work well, seemingly "jumping" to an unintended, adjacent selection. Basic set-up can take far longer than it should and tests one's patience. The user manual is pretty intimidating, but take your time and it all comes together.I researched models and sales outlets thoroughly before selecting the Samsung 650 from Amazon - looked at LG, Panasonic, Sony and others - off-brand and high-end, the Samsung LCD is the best value and it showed up on all the recommended picks, far more than any other brand. While still a little nervous about warranty and whether everything "works", I am pleased with the quality of the picture, the ease of connections and the overall look. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Best Picture Ever!
Reviews.Author: Craig Rossiter
Reviews.Content: We have had our LN52A650 for about six weeks now.  It was delivered five days after I placed the order.  The gentleman that brought the TV asked for my help carrying it in the house and getting it out of the box.  His helper had called in sick.  It was not a problem.  He was familiar with the TV and got it up and running in just a couple of minutes.  The unit itself is beautiful.  The TOC (red) in the frame matches perfectly our Mexican decor in our family room.  The physical appearance is an issue because our old Hitachi projection TV that it replaced was so ugly that my wife called the company and complained.  (That worked in my favor, because when I wanted a new TV, she couldn't wait to replace it!)Regarding performance, the picture is so beautiful that we are still amazed.  Blu-Rays played on my PS3 and HD programming is nearly 3D.  The color is absolutely breathtaking.  I have done nothing fancy as far as picture setting go--I keep it pretty much on the factory defaults.  We have a window that produces a little glare at certain times of the day, but the blinds we installed to deal with glare and our former TV take care of that issue.  The sound is the only weak area, but everything goes through my Sony receiver ( Sony STRDG820 7.1 with 5.1 speaker setup ) so the TV sound is not an issue.  The combination works well, and I have consolidated remotes with a Harmony remote that works everything but the PS3.I have had no problems whatsoever.  No shutoff problems, so I haven't worried about the firmware update.  All in all, this is a five star product.  I am completely satisfied with my purchase, and wouldn't hesitate to make the same decision again.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" 650 series LCD HD TV
Reviews.Author: K. Perry
Reviews.Content: We've had this TV for about 3 weeks so it is kinda early to give a full review. But it swivels from side to side, making placement easier, it has a cute little melody when it is turned on, and the picture couldn't be clearer in HD, and the regular picture isn't too shabby either! One thing we don't like is when you change the channels, it takes it about 5 or 6 seconds to change and then a few more for the voice to catch up. It seems to be faster going between non-HD channels. Other than that, we like the set very well. And we LOVE the big picture!! Oh, and the touch of color around the bezel is very classy. Before we bought it we would have liked to known more about the 120HZ that is all the rage now. We have it on this set, but it is in simulated 120hz. The only provider, as of now, as far as we know, that can give you TRUE 120hz is AT&T; U-verse, according to Samsung. I called because ours says it is in 60hz, and I wanted to know why we weren;t getting the 120hz, which was a big decision in buying one set versus another. So the sellers aren't telling you that you can't get it everywhere yet. You may want to ask your sales person about that before you buy, although it should be available in more places sometime in the future I hope. If in doubt, and the 120hz is important to you, I would call the maker of whatever TV you decide to buy and inquire about it to see what they say.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: 2cents "steve"
Reviews.Content: I researched tv's for about a month. I went to several stores looked at the tv screens pictures and then researched the features for each tv on the internet. I felt like the Samsung was the best tv I could buy in my price range. It had all the features I was looking for. I bought it at Amazon which was $200.00 cheaper than at any of the retail stores pre Christmas prices. I thought the stores might discount them further after Christmas so I held off. Well after Christmas the stores raised the price $200.00. So I bought from Amazon. I got the TV well before the arrival date shown. I think it took a week or less to appear on my doorstep.  I could go through a lot of the features it has but the main one that I liked  was that the 650 has a volume leveler. I was tired of having to raise and lower the volume from tv programs and commercials or other tv shows. I wired it with HDMI in but then ran an optical digital line from the tv to my receiver. It is not perfect but it does help with leveling out the volume.  The other cool feature that I like is DNEI (I had never heard of it). I came across it in the manual. I turned it from off to on and man I couldn't beleive my eyes. On certain movies it makes it look like you are right in the scene with the actors. I was watching "The One" with Jet Lee. It was an amazing experience. It also worked with network tv when I watched the movie "The Last Templer". (Stupid movie by the way) Mira Sorvino must have been hard up for some money.  This TV replaced my Toshiba 50" which had a good picture and sound but this tv is even better and I got the updated technology and 2 more inches of veiwing space for the same price as the Toshiba I had bought 4 to 6 years ago. I thought it was a bargain and gave my toshiba to my brother. The sound on the tv had some bad reveiws but I tested it out before I wired the optical cable to my receiver. It sounded pretty darn good and plenty loud enough for me. If you don't have a home theater system this tv's speakers are as good as any I have heard. I did not mount it to a wall. I have it on a tv stand with a riser. It is about 8 inches from the back wall which might have helped the sound quality.  Good luck to all in your tv search.

Reviews.Title: another review that simply states - excellent...
Reviews.Author: Paul Liesenberg "pablo"
Reviews.Content: so many excellent review on this TV already here, but i feel complelled my recession-adjusted 2 cents...for many years i have had a 200lbs+ behemoth that used to be the best TV back in its day ('99 or so), the Sony KV36-XBR200. and for several years, every time i was thinking about buying a plasma or LCD tv, 2 things keps coming in the way - there was the price, and the fact that to my eyes, which were adjusted to excellent -albeit SDTV (standard television definition aka 720x480 if you are lucky)- clarity of the Sony the new TVs looked a bit limited - movement seemed to cause a lot of artificial constructs (the whole ghosting thing). but with the last generation of LCD tvs, the price has come down, and the image quality has become breathtaking, especially when we talk HDTV (high definition television, ideally 1920x1080p).the fact that the price has come down is important - because i think that going forward the days when we kept TVs for over 10 years are gone. there will be so many improvements coming our way (OLEDs and such) that we'll probably trash our TVs every 5 years or so. sad, but quite likely.i got the Samsung 52' 650 after close cross comparision within the brand (750/850, the 950 is still priced too high for its value add), and against Sony's models. I went with the 650 because it provides the best image quality for the buck, and because I didn't need the gimmicky packaged-in content (750) or additional thinness (850). the 650 has the same *excellent* image quality, and a straightforward design.i was a bit hesitant about buying it online, and would have got the TV in Best Buy if their sales people had been a bit more competent (they tell me it's out of stock, and called me back an hour later to say they had one in, which screams "return" to me).  i should not have worried - the delivery from CEVA here in the bay area is fantastic. they said it would be a 12-6pm window, but they arrived at 12.15pm. and did a great job, friendly and helpful. i am not sure if you're supposed to tip them, but they were so good that i did. so don't hesitate to benefit from amazon's excellent offers (they beat the best buy price by several hundred bucks).a lot is said about reflections from the glossy screen. it truly makes no difference to me, and our TV family room is far from the perfect TV environment - the entire side of the room is glass. of course we have blinds that can shut it down, but most of the time we leave it open, and it's not an issue with this TV even on sunny california days. the "red touch"? invisible as far as i am concerned...and the Samsung worked great from the get go. my sources are- Comcast HDTV digital cable with DVR recording capability- Roku Netflix box- Panasonic DVD player/recorderMany HDTV channels look stunning. Some barely improve on their STD equivalent and should give them away to those who are willing to do more with the bandwidth, really. But HBO in HD (HBO boxing in HD is awesome!), or the tennis matches from Australia - wow. if you were still having some buyer's remorse it'll fade right then and there. all the stuff they talked about when it comes to LCD image quality (ghosting etc) is *gone*. fast objects move smoothly and sharply. my misgivings and worries about having to live with reduced contrast compared to my old XBR TV are gone - this beats that TV by a mile.the SDTV channels are a mixed lot. some look quite acceptable, but some look downright horrible. i was watching the John Stewart show on comedy channel and it too me a while to adjust - between the big 52 inch and the resolution you are missing out on, you keep wishing for more. this TV is so revealing that it is quite cruel to a poor source. keep that in mind.the Roku netflix box offers an HDMI interface and these days they support both standard and HD content, and both look very good on this TV. it is very interesting to watch what netflix labels 4-star quality SDTV on the samsung, though, because again, it is very revealing. netflix obviously uses some compression algorithm to provide very good quality over the internet. which -even when you get 4 star reception- results in interesting artifacts in very dynamic scenes that reveal both the netflix compression and the way the samsung tries to go about improving quality by interpolating pixels in increasingly small squares. i was watching "apocalypto" (very rich visuals despite the overall depressing content) and it was quite clear in the fast paced scenes, like the jungle escape where the captors make sport of mowing down the poor sods that they encourage to run. if there is a way to optimize performance for this (quality, not the ability to successfully escape captors :-)), i'd be interested to learn. but as a rule, when you have 4 star SDTV reception quality is great (depending on how good the original is), and HD is downright great.which deserves a short detour into setup: i find the standard settings great, the only thing i have done, in the interest of power consumption, is to go for "power savings" to be set to "low", which lower brightness, and power consumption by about 30 Watt or so. the medium and high setting could possibly work in darker settings, or if my electricity bill gets too high. :-) with the old TV the entire setup would consume around 190W when up, with the Samsung set to standard with low power saving the new setup gobbles up 270W... finally, on setup: [...] again, i played around with it, and hardly saw a difference, and kind of prefer the standard settings as a more versatile setting.the panasonic player provides images that reveal the differences in compression you chose to record them. you will really see the difference - again, this TV reveals everything.standard DVDs also look great. some of them, like "walking with dinosaurs", look to be near HDTV quality, the TV does an excellent job in generating the best possible quality when the source is good, even when it is not a native HDTV source, i guess the "upsampling" algorithms are pretty smart, and that the source has to be pretty poor for the upsampling to not provide very good results.i should note that the build-in speakers are actually pretty good - even though i don't use them, i hooked the TV's audio out to external speakers right away. i wish the audio-out provided variable levels that could be controlled with the remote - they are fixed level, great if you go for a receiver/amplifier, less optimal if you are directly driving powered speakers like i do (i opted to invest into a very clean sounding 2:1 setup rather than all-out surround).i should note i use component cables between the cable box and the dvd-r and the TV. the TV does an excellent job in automatically detecting the image's resolution and format based on channel and source.so i am extremely happy with this purchase, the image quality right out of the box is amazing. great TV. and a fantastic price for the size and stunning image quality.

Reviews.Title: can it be too good?
Reviews.Author: Kevin Tipton
Reviews.Content: I have had this television for three weeks now. I expected fantastic video quality when combined with my new blu-ray player (which it has), but was not expecting the dramatic improvement with satellite HD as well. My previous television was 720p/1080i and since satellite HD is at best 720p I thought the image was as good as it was going to get. I was wrong! This TV has far sharper images, more depth and better color than I have seen previously. SD pictures are good as well, although very disappointing in comparison to HD.The cabinet is unobtrusive and the controls are easy to use once you are familiar with them. The interaction between the TV and the samsung blu-ray player is nice as well. Slip in a disc and the TV turns itself on and switches to the correct input for the player.The only question is, Is the picture too good? When watching movies, particularly in HD, I almost feel as if I am watching them film the movie. The magic of film is sometimes lost for me. I have been experimenting with the different movie modes, but have not found the solution. Perhaps as picture quality improves, filming techniques will need to change as well.

Reviews.Title: We love this TV set and Audio-Video Center
Reviews.Author: Desert Denizen "desertkrone"
Reviews.Content: We just love this TV. It is awesome. We did a lot of research before purchasing. My husband is an electrical engineer and is very picky about audio-visual stuff, and he just loves this TV. It does everything it is advertised to do that we have tried. On Christmas day we hooked it up, and one of the first programs we saw over Dish network was an exploration of the Nile in HD. This has changed our lives. We're now taping programs in HD, like The Universe on History channel.Also, Audio-Video Center was wonderful. Our TV was delivered to our door 3 business days after we ordered it on Amazon. The delivery person helped us take the TV out of the box to check for damage. We wanted to set it up ourselves later.It's beginning to look like the big box stores that sell TVs in our town will only serve as demos for the products. We get better prices and better service by ordering from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52 inch HD TV (120 Hz)
Reviews.Author: William W. Arrasmith "Greywolf"
Reviews.Content: Perfect!  Their color system is better than anything out there--that's what sold me.  Sharp, clear, picture.  Hooking up the PC to it was a snap.  Blue-ray is awesome on it.  Got it way cheaper than Best Buy too.  I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Like a window
Reviews.Author: John Schuett
Reviews.Content: The TV is fantastic.  Blue ray's look like you are looking through a window.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Quality
Reviews.Author: Biig Eye Watcher "RichVan"
Reviews.Content: We bought this HD 52" LCDTV after hearing people that I work with had bought one and talked about the picture quality. I did some additional research, (went to Best Buy to pick some GEEK brains)and additionally found Consumers Reports rated this one as a top rated best buy.  The delivery was not as promised but after talking with the staff at Amazon it arrived a week before we were to go on vacation and only a few days later than actually promised.  The delivery was white glove in that the delivery man set it up, made sure it was running and took all the packaging with him. We are really pleased as the price was also unbelievable, about $300 less than Best Buy. We love it and it fits our room adequately. Watching those NFL games is really sweet.  We love it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome TV.  The picture (in HD) is amazing.  I was a little worried about buying it online but it arrived earlier than expected and in one piece.  Amazon.com had, by far, the best price anywhere.  I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone looking to upgrade to a flat screen LCD or Plasma.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" 120 Hz HDTV LN52A650
Reviews.Author: D. Plummer
Reviews.Content: I had researched a HDTV in Consumer Reports that rated the LN52A650 number 1, in the December 2008 issue, in the 52-inch class and I had seen it as well as others at Best Buy.  Finally, after numerous visits and looking at many other brands in Sears, Walmart, Circuit City and BJs, I decided to purchase the Samsung at Best Buy. Ah, but they had none, other Best Buys had none, and they couldn't order it.  When I got home, I decided to check Amazon as I had done business with them before.  Not only did they have one, but it was $125.00 less than the best deal I saw elsewhere, and they shipped it free.  The men brought it to the house, unpackaged it, and set it on the TV stand and made sure it worked.  I absolutely love it. Just ordered, through Amazon, a Samsung Blu Ray DVD BD-P2500 player to use with it, and I am hoping itSamsung BD-P2500 1080p Blu-ray Disc Player proves to be as good as the TV.  So far, doing business with Amazon has been a pleasing experience; I hope it continues to be.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV!
Reviews.Author: Gary Cornell
Reviews.Content: Not much I can say that hasn't been said in the other reviews.  The picture is excellent. One thing you really notice is how great the tv renders blacks.  My old TV was HD but it was 5 years old. It's like going from SD to HD all over again.  Very vibrant colors but it's the blacks that really stand out.Amazon delivered the TV within 48 hours of the order. Couldn't be happier with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome experience
Reviews.Author: J. Taylor "Botay"
Reviews.Content: I worried about this purchase, but I went ahead because of the reviews.  I am so glad I went with the Samsung.  The picture is stunning.  I had a 52 inch old projection and I can't believe what I have been missing. I went to the movies and my picture is better then the big screen movie version.  This is a great looking tv in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Television!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: My comparison shopping for a new TV has finally ended with the LN52A650 and what a great decision it was.  I have researched so many TV's and nothing else comes close to the Samsung 650's feature set and picture quality.  For a lot of people the decision starts with Plasma or LCD and for me that was easy.  I love the picture of an LCD TV/Monitor, the colors seem to be much more vibrant with LCD.  I watched this TV many times and compared the picture to all those around it at my local tech store(It's Blue and begins with B).  The Sony KDL-52W4100 is really the only other TV I was considering because I like Sony products and it has a similar price to the Samsung.  The Sony has a nice picture but after watching both TV's side by side I noticed more detail and richer color from the Samsung.  That was all I needed to decide on the Samsung.  The one thing that bothered me was the "Red Touch of Color" on the Samsung but it does look sharp once you see it.  Picture quality is amazing with very deep black levels and a high contrast ratio (50,000:1).  The 120Hz function is a nice touch but you don't even need to use it to get a nice smooth picture.  The TV does a good job at up scaling your basic cable stations and those HD channels look really nice.  Full HD through HDMI is where this TV really shines.  After hooking up my PS3 and watching the Blu-Ray "Planet Earth" I was floored by the picture.  The scenes from the movie are simply amazing from Mountains to Deserts to The Ocean, it looks great.  Standard DVD's are up scaled nicely and bring out a lot of extra detail than with your standard TV and player.  I heard people talk about up scaled DVD's being as good as Blu-Ray and I think that they may come close but Blu-Ray has a definite edge especially when sitting up close.  I found the sound quality to be pretty good on this TV, while it could benefit from a nice audio receiver the speakers get the job done.  The features of this TV are the best I know of.  There are so many options to adjust picture and audio settings, you have full control over how your TV looks and sounds.  The inputs on the TV are also quite generous with all the standard component and composite connections you would expect on an HDTV along with 4 HDMI ports and a USB port for Music, Pictures and Firmware Updates.  One feature I found really cool is that when you adjust the picture settings on an input source like HDMI those settings stay custom to that source.  This means that every HDMI port can have it's own settings saved in the TV's memory.  This is great because while one picture setting works on a device it may not look as good on another and need to be adjusted.  This also works on cable channels too, when you set your settings on an HD station all the other HD stations use those settings same is true for SD channels.  Shipping was great for me, I live close to the CEVA distribution center so I got it fast(Order on Dec. 19th Delivered Dec. 22nd).  Overall I am very happy with the TV and my experience with Amazon and wouldn't think twice about doing it again.  I hope this review was helpful to those in the market for a new TV and I hope that you give Samsung a look.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color
Reviews.Author: John Dagen
Reviews.Content: Every time that I would go to a store to look at televisions, Samsung would always have the clearest, sharpest picture. This t.v. was easy to set up. The delivery man told me to keep the box in case it had any problems since they had had some problems with a few of the sets.  I have had no problems whatsoever. This is the sharpest picture and it is so easy to use.  This is the way to go if you are looking for a new television. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I can see clearly now
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Friedberg "simondoggie"
Reviews.Content: Outstanding picture.I honestly had no idea what I was missing until I bought this 52 inch LCD television by Samsung. The clarity is unparalleled. TV will never be the same for me. It's tantamount to once you have a car with air conditioning,there is no way you could ever settle for another one without it. I don't think I could ever go back to regular T V.

Reviews.Title: Why Samsung can be much cheaper than Sony now.
Reviews.Author: Kyoungmin Kim "wonderif"
Reviews.Content: Over the last year, Japanese Yen to Korean Won (JPYKRW) almost doubled from about 8 to 15 as of Dec 2008.  That's why Samsung's TVs can be much less expensive than competing models from Sony.  After checking out a local BB, my conclusion was that pricewise AND qualitywise, this is a no-brainer.  "White glove" delivery from Amazon was also hassle-free.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: happy buyer
Reviews.Author: collfive
Reviews.Content: I couldn"t be happier with this product. I am replacing a hi def tv purchased 6 years ago and spent a lot of time researching products. Since I was already familiar with hi def I thought I knew what to expect  regarding picture quality but I must say I was totally blown away with the quality of this Samsung.It is as if I am experiencing hi def for the first time all over again! I coupled this with a playstation purchase and I am now in heaven  I am not a big game player but seeing blue ray on this is quite amazing. Delivery was perfect and company arrived when they said they would .Pricing blew away best buy and all other big box stores. Don"t wait run to purchse this TV

Reviews.Title: it IS all that!
Reviews.Author: TobycW
Reviews.Content: For 52" and 2008 models, this LCD is the best!  I won't talk about it any more than that but let's talk about the Amazon shipping which was free with the price.  I was worried about getting this shipped locally let alone cross country.  CEVA, the shipping company amazon uses, was great.  Box was unscathed.  delivery people were on time and courteous.  TV once unboxed is no problem for a single person to move around.  Bottom line, don't worry about shipping, it will arrive safe.  Before the delivery people leave, make sure the box is unharmed.  Have them unbox and move the TV to a room of your choice if you want--included cost.  THANK YOU AMAZON!

Reviews.Title: The Best Value in LCD TVs
Reviews.Author: soulst0p "-tim"
Reviews.Content: After shopping around for televisions for over half a year, purchasing some, and even returning some, I have become quite satisfied with this TV.  Even among Samsung TVs alone, there are quite a few models to choose from, and I was sorely tempted to purchase the 52" 8 series model, for a pretty good price.  Nevertheless, I feel this TV set is something of a classic amongst LCD TV sets, as the combination of style, picture quality, and price make this an excellent choice for any buyer.For those who may not have as discerning an eye as others, you may not see the difference between this set, and say, a Phillips.  But those who have picky eyes will see that the difference is in the details.  While many TVs from other manufacturers may boast the same features and technologies as this TV (120 Hz, Contrast enhancement, edge enhancement, etc.), upon inspection you will find that not all technologies are created equal.  The greatest part is, that this TV set produces an excellent picture already, WITHOUT these features, whereas other sets use those same features as gimmicks to make a below average picture look mildly acceptable.  And while the menu functions are a tiny bit awkward for the advanced user and avid TV tweaker, you can be satisfied that should you prefer a more accurate, natural picture, or a picture with more "wow", this TV can support excellence in both arenas.It's not the perfect set, but definitely the best value.  There are little things that could be improved on, but don't really hurt the score.  Much has been said about the glossy screen.  I have this set in the living room, next to large windows, and the "reflection/glare issue" does not create any problems for me.  One of the best touches is the Channel List feature for the TV tuner, which makes browsing through digital channels much, much easier.  I only wish the TV supported naming functions for the channels, so that I can name  My biggest gripe with this TV is that the HDCP link for HDMI connections takes longer than usual to be established, but it's a minor thing.

Reviews.Title: Consumer Reports forgot to test battery life on the remote...
Reviews.Author: Peter M. Ranon "Peter R."
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Samsung LN52A650 based on Consumer Reports rating of HDTV of bigger than 46".  We waited until the LN52A750 was out before making the purchase since we assumed that newer versions are always going to be better.  Much to our surprise, the A650 rated better than A750 so we went ahead and purchased it.  The A650 is pretty much what we expected it to be including the intuitive and user friendly remote.  Within a month of purchase, the battery went dead on the remote and we figured that the batteries we put in must not have been fresh and promptly replaced them.  Then within 2 weeks, they went dead again and at this point, it dawned on us that the little light bulb that lights up the buttons when you apply motion is what's using up the juice in the battery.  We are now more careful to ensure that the remote stays on a firm surface like top of the table (and not being subject to motion like on the couch where it could drain the battery).  So watch out for the battery eating remote!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV and delivery
Reviews.Author: S. Halaka
Reviews.Content: First, the white glove delivery service was perfect. They called the day before to schedule a delivery window and called 30 minutes before arriving. Delivery arrived right at the beginning of the delivery window. It was carried in, unpacked, powered on and hooked up to the component video feed to test the picture and audio. Everything worked perfectly out of the box.This unit has a stunning picture with a plethora of tunable controls and features making this television a home run. I have a skylight and 4 windows in the room with the television so I was a little concerned about all the reviews mentioning the drawbacks of the glossy screen but it's proved not to be an issue at all. There is a slight glare during the day but it's actually far less than the glare on my old 32" CRT. Also, the touch of red is barely noticable and the bezel in general is very nice. The included pedestal's swivel capability is very nice as well. Finally, the 120Hz feature can make movies look fake but it's great for sports viewing.Overall, I am extremely satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: If you buy this women will love you
Reviews.Author: M. Talley
Reviews.Content: Or so I've been told (still waiting on this one to see if it's true).  But everything else you've heard about this TV IS true.  The picture is amazing, and blu ray movies are outstanding.  I hooked my computer up to this thing (it's got a dedicated computer monitor input, or you can use a DVI/HDMI cable if your computer will support it).  The picure is great.  I watch streaming videos from the internet without having to get off of the couch (what a great world we live in).  I can't attest to the usefulness of the Infolink system, since I haven't tried it out.  But I was able to buy this TV with confidence from the technical comparisons I made, the reviews I read, and just seeing the TV next to other comparable TV's at the store. I can tell you that this is the top of the line, and you will not have buyer's remorse after getting it.

Reviews.Title: Look no further
Reviews.Author: G. Lucyszyn
Reviews.Content: I did all the research, read all the reviews, found the best price here on Amazon and pulled the trigger. Delivery was on time and flawless. As reported by everyone else, the picture quality is nothing short of phenomenal. One thing to remember is for DVD movies to turn off the "auto motion" setting otherwise it looks like you are watching videotape recordings. I watched Iron Man and the characters looked unnatural, then I switched off the auto motion and it looked the way a movie should.Bottom line, there is a reason everyone is handing out 5 stars. They don't regret this purchase and neither will you.

Reviews.Title: 2 years of TV research was worth it!
Reviews.Author: Baba Booey "This TV Rocks!"
Reviews.Content: As stated in the subject heading, I did research for over 2 years. I looked at every electronics store I could find, talked to sales associates, compared TV's like crazy, and ended up deciding to go with this Samsung. I am so glad that I did! In my opinion, the picture is as good, if not better, than Sony's. And this TV has consistently been cheaper than the comparable Sony.I did most of my research at Best Buy and Circuit City, and ended up buying at Amazon for $2,044. I was nervous about the delivery, but it went well. I expected to have the delivery company call me during the week to schedule delivery. They actually called on a Friday and asked if they could deliver on Saturday or Sunday. I was out of town, so it didn't work out, but a nice gesture nonetheless. Overall though, the delivery people were nice. My only issue is that they did not remove the TV from the box like the white glove delivery description states they are supposed to. But no harm no foul. The TV was in perfect shape. If you're hoping to have delivery made on a weekend so you don't have to leave work, my suggestion would be to ask them if they can deliver on a weekend. They may be in your area on a weekend to make another delivery, so it's worth asking.Now, back to the TV. The picture is second to none. I know some have complained about the sound, but it is not an issue with me. The only thing that annoys me is that the TV makes a sound when you turn it on and off. I need to read the manual to see if there is a way to turn it off. It's not that big of a big deal, but I have a sleeping baby not far away, so I always worry that it will wake her up. I'm sure it's all in my head though, because if the TV itself doesn't wake her, the sound probably won't either!Lastly, I was astounded at how much bigger the TV was in my living room, compared to how it looked in the store. I couldn't believe it, but wasn't about to complain! In my opinion, you won't find a better 52" TV than this one. And Amazon was a great place to buy it. Low prices and good/free delivery - can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: We are very pleased with our choice
Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: We did quite a bit of research before honing in on either a Sony or Samsung LCD TV over 46".  In the end, Samsung had features more important to us and a better price.  We couldn't be more pleased with the 52" 650 series we purchased.  The color and sound are great.  People seem to really like the Touch of Color, although that wasn't a selling feature for us.  The swivel stand is a great feature.  The best part was that this television worked effortlessly right out of the box.  I thought there would be some complicated set-up and I was pleasantly surprised.  The set up menu asked a few questions and we were ready to go.  The remote control is also very handy.  I love the "light up" feature.  We have 14 feet between our farthest seating and the TV and a 12 foot window on the wall opposite.  It's only been a few weeks, but, so far, we are not having any glare problems.  Great product!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV and great delivery service
Reviews.Author: Cedarboy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV based on the reviews at Amazon and CNET. Delivery was super quick, I ordered it on Sat, shipped on Monday and I could have got it on the Wed but I requested for a delivery on Friday. Two guys carried it inside and took it down two flight of stairs to my basement. However, they did not wait before I could check if the TV was working. I would rate the White glove delivery pretty good considering they did not charge me extra for delivering it to the basement. One other internet vendor quoted ~300 dollars for delivering it to the basement :-)The TV indeed is a thing of beauty. I have connected the dish network receiver and the pioneer dvd player using component cables through a Harmon Kardon receiver. HD channels picture quality is awesome so I would assume anything fed to the TV with atleast a 720P resolution would look great. I even used a USB drive to view photos, again loved the way they were displayed and the slideshow functionality. I wish I had opted for the A750 that includes the mpeg functionality through the USB. :-)The only problem that I have faced so far is when I connected the pioneer dvd player, the menu and the initial startup image was not displayed immediately and the message 'Mode not supported' was displayed. However, when I hit play, the movie came on and then I could activate the menu. Weird but probably has something to do with resolution incompatibility.Cannot wait to wall mount and conceal the wiring now :-))Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a 52". Cannot go wrong here...5 stars for delivery by CEVA/Eagle, Amazon for the unbeatable price and Samsung for the production quality.

Reviews.Title: First HDTV has spoiled me
Reviews.Author: O. Gunther "Ooooh! Shiny!"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about 3 weeks ago now (not from Amazon) and have been amazed. I am no videophile but everything positive I've read about this tv seems to me to be true; the color and clarity are amazing and (especially) compared to some of my friends HDTVs that are not 120hz, the motion is smooth.The only issue I ran into with the tv ended up being a mistake on my part where I didn't understand the difference between AV & Component. I was trying to get my Wii to play via Component while plugged into the AV2. Whoops.I contacted Samsung's online support and it was a mixed bag: the first rep tried to talk me into flashing the firmware with the latest version online (2001.3) but luckily I realized rather quickly that the firmware on my TV (2003.0) was newer and thus probably wasn't the problem.So I contacted a second support rep. This one helped explain to me where I was confused and got me on the right track.

Reviews.Title: Great looks and great picture
Reviews.Author: J. Howard
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short.  The picture is awesome.  I love the fact that I can stick a USB flash drive into the USB port and it will play a slide show of photos.  Sound is good, but I generally run sound through my surround sound system.  The only bummer is the wheel thing on the remote control.  But I think that is a dead horse here in the reviews.I researched a lot of TV's before buying this one.  You won't be dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, make sure you turn off 120mhz option for non-sports
Reviews.Author: Mr. Michael S. Mcnamara
Reviews.Content: Lots has been written about the quality of the picture, so I will just say everything written has been my experience also. Awesome picture. It blows away everything else I looked at in the stores and now in our home, it is even better.Spend some time playing with the menu settings if for nothing else just seeing how much control you have over the picture. The menu is pretty well laid out and easy to make changes (although the remote's scroll wheel is a little frustrating). Menu changes take place right away making it easier to see what you have done without having to exit and re-enter the menu systeam again and again.Some notes on my setup so that it may help some others having any issues.TV connected to Comcast DVR (motorola) which seesm to only output 1080i max. Not sure if Comast has newer DVR boxes that offer 1080p or not. Will have to check on that. Might also be a Comcast cable limitation. But  the picture still looks pretty great, so I don't see an issue here. I found that newer HDMI 1.3 cables did not work well with this box. I could sometimes get it to work on the side HDMI 4 input, but usually the TV said no cable was connected. I simply used my older HDMI cable plugged into the HDMI 2 input and I now have no problems.Using a PS3 for games and Blu-Ray movies. At first the picture was really odd looking. Movies looked like video games almost with sharp looking actors against an odd background. Hard to describe but it looks wrong. Same with regular DVDs. Traced this back to the 120mhz refresh being on and when I turned this off, the movies looked great. So you might want to turn this off and on depending on what you are watching. Using an HDMI 1.3 cable here and it works fine.Also got a Samsung HTZ-310 DVD/surrond player. It really integrates well with the Samsung TV, doing little things like changing the TV input to DVD (HDMI 3 in my case) when I put a DVD in.For sound, I use an optical audio cable from the TV to the surround sound. This way I get surround on evrything: PS3, Cable and DVD's. Set the surround sound to Digital In for this set up.I also have a Harmony 550 remote and it has worked well so far. I have used one on my previous TV (moving to the basement) so I got this (only $49 at the time on Amazon, although the price fluctuates a lot). Everything works great. It will turn on the cable box, TV and surround sound, set the proper input and tyhe surround to D.In and I'm good to go. Highly recommended as the Samsung remotes are kind of big and bulky.Delivery was not great, but certainly not a deal breaker (especially for free). You have to wait for the service to call you to set up an appointment time, for me between 12 and 5. Only one guy was doing the delivery (from CEVA) which seems totally wrong on items with such a large box. I did not appreciate the way he turned the box over to get it up my steps. He also took off right away before I even took it out of the box. Certainly not white glove. So, delivery could be better (maybe it varies by city) but I really did not have an issue with the TV related to the delivery, so I guess it was all OK in the end.Anyway, I would not hesitate to buy from Amazon. Wait until you are totally ready however as the price seems to keep dropping every week. I purchased in August while they still had the price guarantee. I called back after the price dropped $130 and got a refund. Now it is $50 cheaper again. Not sure if I can get that back or not - will have to try.

Reviews.Title: very impressive
Reviews.Author: K. Feng
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Sony, but this Samsung LCD TV is just amazing.Very good contrast and HD quality. Highly recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV experience
Reviews.Author: A. Eason
Reviews.Content: We purchased this based on a Consumer Reports rating and reviews here.  Arguably we are easy to please because this is our first HDTV and we've not watched at friends' houses.  In short, this is excellent: easy set-up; great picture, with saturated colors and wonderful contrast; all the connections one would need (including for a PC).  We were not bothered, in the least, by the touch of red that has distracted some people.  We would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: This TV + PS3 = WIN
Reviews.Author: Akira
Reviews.Content: Let me just put it this way, PS3 + LN52A650 = Amazing.  Blu-Ray movies looks fantastic, games like MGS4 looks even better.  If you get this TV, I would get "Planet Earth" and "Metal Gear Solid 4" for your first Blu-Ray and PS3 game.  These two really highlights the HD aspect of this TV and everyone who sees them are amazed at the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: GP
Reviews.Content: Was somewhat apprehensive about making a big $ item online but purchase and white glove delivery from Amazon was effortless, stressless and a day earlier than promised.  Very satisfied and would highly recommend Amazon from this experience. Price difference speedily credited as price dropped two days after my order.  Read reviews, know your vendor and check to see if they tax, offer low price guarantee and white glove delivery.Compared various sets for months and narrowed it down to Sony XB4 and Samsung lnt5265f.  Thought Sony had the edge but felt it was to pricey.  Was waiting for the Sony price to drop when the Samsung LN52A650 came out.  Compared it to Sony and thought the color, sharpness and features topped Sony.  Compared to Sony the price was a steal and free white glove delivery was a bonus.Have had the unit 3 weeks, still in awe of the picture and enjoying the set every time I watch a HD broadcast.  Even when watching the Mets blow a game it's not as painful.  Regular broadcasts will be disappointing (as on any HD TV).Your DVD viewing appetite will become more discriminating and you may find you'll want get a upgrade HD DVD player or Bluray.Until they come up with 3D and smellevision on the cooking channel this will keep me happy.

Reviews.Title: Downgraded and Happy
Reviews.Author: H. Miller "hanahal"
Reviews.Content: I had originally purchased the LN52A750 and found issues with light reflection from the glass bezel. I exchanged it for the LN52A650. Save for a few less features (none that are important), the picture and quality are exceptional. Plus, the best benefit is that the 650 is cheaper than the 750!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic value on a fantastic television
Reviews.Author: Randy Kunkel "Rockula"
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about purchasing such an expensive item online, but took my time researching before hand.  I knew this was the best tv available and I have always had good experiences with Amazon, so I took the chance.  I am glad I did.I compared this TV against everything else so I knew I was getting a great TV, but it is better than I even expected.  The picture is AWESOME, it looks great in my house with it's touch of color, and the sound is very acceptable even without an external surround system - not tinny like I had heard.The only drawback is that the glossy screen, while looking great and making the picture look even sharper, it does tend to reflect if the picture is dark and the room has a light source.  It is very easy to ignore this however.  Don't let it stop you from purchasing the unit.I am very happy with my purchase.  The delivery company was late but called to say they would be, even working until after 8pm at night.  They did NOT however open or unpack my TV as indicated on the order page.I am thoroughly pleased with my purchase and recommend anyone considering this unit go for it!

Reviews.Title: Great product.  Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Chizwheel
Reviews.Content: I researched televisions for 6 months before I committed to the A650.  There are already plenty of reviews here that highlight how awesome this TV is.  Just a few further pointers, I don't have the resetting problem; my firmware came up to date.  There were no scratches, no dead pixels, no purple haze.  I guess I am lucky, but this TV is incredible.  I really feel that for the price, I got the best LCD TV possible.

Reviews.Title: I'm hooked
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Torres "Rob"
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the clarity of this fine LCD TV. The 160 mhz refresh rate really makes the difference. The clarity is just stunning. I didn't notice any pixelation. I bought this tv to replace my aging Trinitron. Samsung really came through on the design. The Menu selection is very easy to use, right out of the box. I can't wait to see it with a Blue Ray disc player. Thanks to the earlier reviews, purchasing this tv was an easy choice!

Reviews.Title: Super TV
Reviews.Author: T. Shanahan
Reviews.Content: I will echo the overwhelming majority here...This TV is 5 stars! The picture is fantastic and the"touch of color" bezel really looks sharp.Amazon.com was great... no tax, free shipping and the 36 month0% financing sealed the deal. The set even arrived well beforethe projected delivery date.Well done!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!  Poor Delivery :(
Reviews.Author: Carlos F. Cruz
Reviews.Content: Everything about this TV is great :)  good looking, picture etc,, I love it,,, my problem was the poor delivery by Amazon carrier called CEVA... CEVA was awful... 1st delivery attempt they sent the TV to the wrong person,,, 2nd attempt they brought me the wrong model !! a cheaper one!!  finally for the 3rd time i had to call late afternoon to check for estimated time of arrival,,, and the tv was still sitting at their location!!!  I got really mad and finally they brought it like at 8pm that night..  I received my TV 12 days after the original delivery date.. very poor communication...  as frustrated as I was,, i didnt want to give this tv a low rating,,

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We shopped around before purchasing this through Amazon.  Best price was on line.  TV picture is incredible - every generation of Samsung LCDs are better than the next.We use a surround system, so can't comment on the sound quality.We have the TV mounted on the wall, no problems, easy to do.  The base is extremely heavy - you need 2 people to remove it.

Reviews.Title: Stunning
Reviews.Author: R. S. Little
Reviews.Content: Really, no more words are required.  Next step is to upgrade the DVD player to fully realize the picture in 1080p.  I watch HD channel content I never did before just to marvel at the images on the screenAmazon service was excellent, received the set in 3 days, no issues at all with firmware.Amazon has processed several refunds as the price dropped after I purchased the TV which makes me appreciate what Amazon has become.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 650 series HDTV. Nice TV but sound is poor no matter what settings I have choosen.
Reviews.Author: Rim Country Man "Ned"
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV based on Consumers Reports ratings which rated both Picture and Sound as outstanding. The picture is very good and I am happy with it. I compared it to the Mitsubushi 73" DLP diamond series and in the shop both seemed good with a slightly better picture in the store for the Samsung. I have a 65"Mitsubishi DLP presently in my living room and have always been very impressed with the great picture quality it has. When I got the Samsung 52" home and hooked it up, it had a very nice picture but in the real world, the Mitsubushi has a better more realist picture. Perhaps the picture size helps. Even the Dish Tech that put in the new box for this set commented on the fact that the Mitsubishi was better. Believe me I am also happy with the Samsung which resides in my loft.  Where the problem comes in is that the sound is very bad. I have gone through all the options, which are many but I can not get any combination that sounds clear. Perhaps Consumers Report had a better set, or the test area they have make the sound  better acoustically then in my loft, but it is really poor in there. I will be looking for a small home theater system to help out with the sound quality.

Reviews.Title: The LN52A650 is a GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: Scott Wilson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon just over a month ago.  At first I was hesitant buying from Amazon in case I needed to return for any reason, I knew it would be a hassle (reshipping the item and all).  So I went to my local Best Buy and Circuit City where the TV was $700 more and asked if they could match it (it would be easier to return it there if need be).  Best Buy would only come down to $100 over the Amazon price, and then you'd have to add the 10.25% Chicago tax, which is another couple hundred dollars (Amazon had free shipping on this item).  Also, Amazon dropped the price $127 AFTER I ordered the TV and BEFORE it had been delivered.  After calling their great support line they were kind enough to reimburse me the $127.  I have absolutely no complaints in ordering from Amazon.I did a lot of research using several websites and publications (CNET.com, Consumer Reports, etc.) and this TV always ranked in the top for 10 for 50" and larger LCD TV's.  Then I went to the stores in person to check for myself (I whole-heartedly agreed).  The TV looks stellar with more clarity than my previous 42" Dell plasma, which had a great picture, but died.  Also, Samsung is listed at the top in television reliability, which is important to me based on my last large TV purchase (Dell was dead last in reliability and no longer makes TV's!!!).  No more glare than my Dell plasma and my living room is surrounded by windows on the East and North sides.  Glare is not an issue with this TV as it is so bright and vibrant.  The value for the money is great too!  I spent about $2500 for my 42" Dell just over 2 years ago, and this 52" TV was more than $500 cheaper!  I ordered the wireless adapter from Amazon that is to provide sports/weather/news information feed from USA Today but have not yet received it.  Do yourself a favor and order this TV from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Sound
Reviews.Author: John Breal
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews also stating sound was terrible but i said it cant be that bad, but it is, if you dont have a decent sound system then dont buy this tv.. it is beautiful tv though, but very poor sound.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional
Reviews.Author: R. Robillard "Verdoot"
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to repeat all the positive things that have been written about this TV. Let me just say they are all true and the Amazon White Glove service was flawless. The big box stores just can't compete. In fact, it's not even close. I don't think most people know that if you charge this on your Amazon Visa card the original warranty is doubled at no cost. By using Amazon,I avoided sales tax, paid no delivery fee and got an extended warranty at no cost. Savings of about $400.This is our second large screen LCD. The first was a Westinghouse 47 inch LCD we bought from a big box store. Let me just say that the quality of the Samsung TV is vastly superior to the Westinghouse. Here again it is not even a close call. My advice to buyers is avoid Westinghouse, get this TV and buy it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV
Reviews.Author: Cindy V
Reviews.Content: Great TV, beautiful picture! The 120 Hz makes a huge difference, compare them in the store, as we did. Samsung reps on the phone have been very helpful and extremely customer oriented. Would definitely purchase Samsung again. This next portion of my review does not reflect Samsung in any way, but I could not find anywhere on Amazon's site to leave them their own rating of zero. I just want other buyers to avoid the hassles I endured. Ordering through Amazon in the past, I've never had a problem, but this was a NIGHTMARE. I applied for the Amazon Store Credit Card for the 2 years,no finance charges. I was approved for two thirds of the purchase price of the TV. When I used another card to complete the purchase, the computer accepted it. The purchase did not go through, but I only found this out because I called them. You can only use one card per transaction,but you can go online to purchase a gift card through Amazon and apply it to complete the transaction. This is crazy since you can use another credit card to purchase the gift card??? And of course none of this is explained when placing an online order, you have to call them to find out after the fact. After days of being on the phone and computer, following Amazon's advice, it still didn't process(they had problems with their gift card site). After a week,I cancelled the Amazon Credit Store card and used another of my cards. What upset me the most, was that not one agent could stay with me through the transaction until the problem was resolved. I would call and explain everything, the agent would recommend something for me to do online, it wouldn't work,I would call back, get a different agent, go through the whole story again. This happened at least six times and with a manager involved one of the times. AMAZON-HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! They're fine as long as you don't have any problems. Get a problem and you feel like you're dealing with a bunch of pre-programmed robots.The only reason I continued with this transaction, was because the TV was so much less through Amazon(about $500).In the future, if I can find what I'm looking for, for even a few more $ somewhere else, I would avoid the hassles and purchase elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: D. Monroe
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound quality are excellent. I'm not an electronics expert but having seen many LCD TVs in home environments, I'd rate this as superior. Set up and install was easy. Shipping was very timely. Would purchase same item from same vender again.

Reviews.Title: beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Jax
Reviews.Content: This TV has a beautiful, clear, crisp picture.  It looks great on the wall. The touch of red looks very cool, and it is very subtle.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Best deal on the best TV!!
Reviews.Author: Robert Myjak
Reviews.Content: Not only did amazon have the best deal on this tv compared to all other store and online prices, but the shipping was free and it arrived 6 days ahead of estimated arrival. The movers were great and i wish that i could do more business with amazon. The TV is awsome with the best picture quality ive ever seen, just go to BestBuy and take a look at it (or at least the 46")

Reviews.Title: Simply Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Tyler Jordan
Reviews.Content: After months and months of research, my girl and I finally decided to buy this TV based on reviews, Samsung's reputation as one of the best for LCD, and the fact that it's a nice black slim frame.We could not have made a better choice.The picture and clarity is amazing. In some cases, the HD is so outstanding that it looks a bit too good. TV shows "fakeness" is truly exposed when viewing some of the programming in HD. I'm not sure how they'll counter this in the future, but that's beside the point.Sports look amazing, no blur that I've been able to detect. I can view my photos from my new Nikon D300 digital camera, or I can hook my computer up to this thing and have the most ridiculous 52 inch monitor in the world... or I can just sit there and look at how beautiful it is even when it's not on.I want to eventually get a surround sound system so I can get the full experience, but I must say that we've been fooled several times in to thinking someone was outside only to discover it was the sound bouncing off the back wall.This TV is so good, so amazing looking, and so comparably affordable that it's a no-brainer - buy it now.

Reviews.Title: Maybe it's my bad luck
Reviews.Author: Ray W
Reviews.Content: I've owned this 52" LCD TV for almost 3 months now.  Everything seemed perfect until 2 weeks ago when I noticed the screen was flicking up and down so I installed the latest firmware from Samsung.com hoping to correct the problem.  Then the TV was stable for one day and it became unresponsive to the remote, and the TV started scrolling through different inputs every few seconds making it impossible to watch anything at all.  I tried unpluging everything but the same problem keeps coming back, often times the TV wouldn't even turn off when I press the ON/OFF button so I have to unplug the power cord to turn off the TV. Contacted Samsung repair and I was told I have to wait almost a week and half for my appointment.  Don't get me wrong, this LCD produces amazing picture but maybe it's just my bad luck that mine has problems.

Reviews.Title: The TV reset by itself while watching Fox Soccer Channel
Reviews.Author: Mack Hodjjatzadeh
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from amazon.com and has been delivered to my house couple days ago. The design and the picture quality is excellent and far better than SONY XBR4.  Today; I was watching Fox Soccer channel and suddenly the TV started to reset by itself. I called the Samsung Tech support and the tech support did not have any clue about this problem and she offered me to reset the TV to Factory setting.  I hope Samsung could be able to fix this problem by offering a software upgrade soon or many customers will start to return this expensive TV.

Reviews.Title: It did not last long enough
Reviews.Author: wy
Reviews.Content: It was beautiful when it worked.  I bought the TV in Oct. 2008.  I was lucky that I did not have the on off problem until late last year.  This month it could not start, just kept the starting sound and then a click.  Googled and found that the TV was in the class action lawsuit settlement.  Called Samsung but was told the law suit settlement ended. 5 years life is not too short for a Samsung TV.  A lot of people had the problem in a couple years. But I do expect it last longer, considering it was an expensive TV in 2008.  I will not buy a Samsung TV again and will try to avoid other Samsung products as well.  There are plenty of other options.  Why risk?

Reviews.Title: GREAT PICTURE
Reviews.Author: Ted Biro
Reviews.Content: The power supply died after 9 months. It was repaired promptly by a factory authorized dealer. At the two year mark a vertical row of pixels became inoperative. After about thirty minutes they light up. The unit is now 5 years old and no other problems. I am not sure I would buy another Samsung. My seven year old 42" Sharp LCD never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect HDTV !!
Reviews.Author: C. Hallowell
Reviews.Content: After 2 years of daily use, our family absolutely loves the Samsung 52" HDTV. Wall-mounted and tilted down slightly to eliminate glare, we find the Samsung to be a perfect balance of picture performance and technological features. The TV is Hi-Def capable, with a 1080i picture on Cox Cable, and a 1080p resolution on the ROKU Video Streamer. Plenty of optional choices for picture quality, sound, and peripherals. My HDTV was delivered promptly and was set up quickly and courteously by the delivery duo.

Reviews.Title: May be eligible for a free repair
Reviews.Author: J. Grosz "JWG"
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV since December, 2008.  Love it.  Great picture quality and feature set.  Most importantly, Samsung has settled a capacitor issue that may allow your Samsung TV manufactured priort to 12/31/2008 to be repared for free.  If your having isues with the TV turning itself on and off, not powering on immediately or cycling call 1-800-SAMSUNG to see if you're eliglble for repair.  Settlment covers the capacitors and, possibly power suppply.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but no longevity
Reviews.Author: Shailendra Mookim "Shailu Mookim"
Reviews.Content: TV has been running fine for 2 years with absolutely no trouble...I thought this was the best TV. However, each summer (for the past 2 years), the screen goes blank (black) after say 15 - 30 minutes of usage!!! This has been happening each summer. If I keep my AC at 70 degrees then the problem goes away. When it turns blank, you have to restart the TV in order to work only to turn blank again in 3 - 5 minutes...what a pain! I wish I did not buy this TV...There are so many people who complain about the same problem...internet is filled with the same type of commnets.

Reviews.Title: Unit broke down in July of 2012
Reviews.Author: Frank Herb
