Reviews.Content: This set worked well, under average use for about 4 years.In July of 2012 it developed a fault, where it would sit there and click for several minutes, before turning on, and eventually would not turn on at all.The problem is well documented on several message boards, and is so common that they even sell a kit to fix it here on Amazon.The problem is caused by the failure of some electrolytic capacitors in the power supply, and can be observed as swollen and cracked open components, in the power supply, by removing the back of the set (Unplug it first!). This kind of thermal failure is caused by either a defective component, a bad design, or both.If it's under warranty, let Samsung worry about it, if not, and you are reasonably handy with a soldering iron, you can fix it yourself with the above mentioned kit.But I certainly wouldn't recommend purchasing this or any other set from this manufacturer, unless they can prove they've addressed the issue.

Reviews.Title: great while it lasted
Reviews.Author: amazon nwfan
Reviews.Content: we've had this tv for 3 1/2 years and it has been wonderful...until today.  it started turning itself on and off continuously.  i looked online and found there had been a class action settlement for this problem and supposedly samsung will fix it.  i'll find out tomorrow when i call the number (1- 888-899-7602)what would have been really great is if amazon would have notified those of us who purchased it from their site about this settlement.

Reviews.Title: Capacitor Problems
Reviews.Author: Orrin Gallop "Gman"
Reviews.Content: I was very happy when I first purchased my 52-inch flat screen in 2008.  I started having problems in 2010.  It was taking the television along time to turn on and it would be a clicking noise.  Finally, the television would not on and I was told it was a manufacturing problem and there was a free one time.  In less than a year I am having the same problem and I am responsible for the cost.  I would not recommend this product or any samsung considering my experience

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650A1F
Reviews.Author: Airborne
Reviews.Content: Defective product that Samsung will not stand behind. Purchased in 2008. Repaired twice for powering up and off repeatedly by itself. Happened for 3rd Time now. Cost of $190-$300 to repair. Recognized problem, but Samsung will not take action to corrct a KNOWN Deficiency in their product. Worst product I ever purchased. Buy at your own risk, Samsung could care less. One Star is too high a rating, you are buying junk!

Reviews.Title: Capacitor problems
Reviews.Author: Atheen M. Wilson "Atheen"
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review shortly after getting the TV and was quite happy with the product.  Lately I've had problems with the TV turning itself off and on indefinitely without ever really staying on for use.  I've been told it's a problem with the capacitor and in doing a little research on the issue have discovered that it is actually a problem known to Samsung and one they're not to really dealing with.  When I called their help number they told me they'd replace the capacitor but would not cover the repair costs.  From other reviews I've seen on Amazon, I see that repair costs range from 300-$400.  I'm on a fixed income these days and the TV was sort of my last splurg.  It's a pain to discover that I was actually one of the lucky ones because my TV lasted almost 3 years; apparently others have had theirs go after mere months.  Not a good long term buy.  Color great, sound good, picture quality wonderful, electrical problems a royal pain!!!

Reviews.Title: Have had since June 2008
Reviews.Author: Coach Hughes
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for a few years now and I have not had any problems.  The set has a very nice picture and the sound is very good as well.  I like how the TV can swivel on its stand, so I can adjust to watch it while I am in the kitchen.  The reason for only a 4 star rating, is the remote control.  The remote frustrates me greatly.  You need to point it directly at the bottom right portion of the set for it to work.  I also think that the TV is a bit delayed when turning on or changing channels.  When you turn the channel, the new channel number will come on and stay on the screen for a bit.  The problem is, you cannot change the volume level or turn to another channel until the channel display goes off.  If you don't mind the delay or where you have to point the remote, this would be a great buy for you.

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Well I just went to turn on my tv after a little over 2 years of moderate use and all I hear is clicking.  I looked online and it sounds like this is a common problem for Samsung TV's.  2000 bucks for a TV and it goes out after 2 years?  Am I the only one that thinks this is a joke?  Previously I had a Samsung DLP that went out after a year or so.  I guess I should have learned my lesson.  So as nice as the sets may seem, the reliability is beyond bad.  Samsung should be ashamed.  They need to back their crap craftsmanship and fix these set's when they go bad and not make the consumer pay 2 - 5 hundred bucks to get it fixed.  I think this will be the last Samsung set I buy or maybe third time is charm??  LOL

Reviews.Title: Stay Away From This Television
Reviews.Author: L. Lambrix
Reviews.Content: We are the frustrated owners of yet another defective Samsung.  We bought this unit in December 2008 and enjoyed it for ... ALMOST two years.  A couple of weeks ago it started turning itself on and off for no reason.  We figured it was our television provider and didn't think too much about it.  Then last week two vertical white lines appeared on either side of the picture before it turned itself on and off.  I called Verizon who checked their box and said it was a television issue.  Since then, the television has been displaying the white lines (which disappear if you manually turn it off and on) and continuing to go off/on.  In the last day or so the sound goes off, there is a buzzing, and then the television turns off and on.  Every 3-5 minutes.  Upon reading other reviews we went to the Samsung site and downloaded and installed the "fix", to no avail.  Samsung Customer Service doesn't want to address the issue that many of their customers are having with this television.  Their mantra seems to be "We are sorry, it's out of warranty.  We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you."  I politely informed the Customer Service Representatives that this seems to be a prevalent problem with this particular unit, and was met with the same response.  The reviewers are all saying the same thing -- Samsung refuses to answer the question and stand by the product when they have a systemic known faulty product line/issue.UPDATE:  TV repair shop came to the house, took the TV, replaced the defective capacitors in power supply, returned the TV two weeks later, plugged it in and IT DID IT AGAIN.  Took the TV for another two weeks, replaced the board, brought it back last week and it started the power on/off issue again yesterday.  Am working with VISA to see how many times I'm supposed to have the TV taken into the repair shop when there is obviously no fix for the problem.  Oh, and so far $410.UPDATE:  1/15/11 (two months later):  TV repair shop replaced the main board in my home and power supply again, turned it on and within 5 minutes it started doing it again.  They scratched their heads, left, and faxed me an estimate for $1,195 to replace the entire screen & box.  WE ARE DUMPING THIS TV FOR PARTS ON CRAIGSLIST.

Reviews.Title: Blown capacitors on the power board Samsung LCD TV.
Reviews.Author: Customer
Reviews.Content: My Samsung LCD TV never really powered up instantly even when new. But the time to power up the TV lately took longer and longer (as long as 10 minutes in some cases). The LED light on the power button would flash with clicking sound. This eventually led to our TV not powering up at all. The TV is less than 2 years old. I have learned that this is a known problem with most Samsung LCD TVs with model number starting with "LN".The problem is caused by `blown' capacitors on the power board. The company apparently didn't use proper ones with ample amount of capacity to handle the load. I haven't yet found any official recall on this issue.I don't want to pay $300-$400 because they didn't use the proper capacitors. They really should issue an official recall on this issue and take care of their customers

Reviews.Title: Samsung lasts only as long as warrantY!
Reviews.Author: Craig Crowley
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the tv for. 15 months, after that I had a dark screen.  I have spent 500 on repairs. I cannot recommend any Samsung product. I payed $1900 and expected at least five years of service.

Reviews.Title: Poor Amazon Customer Service
Reviews.Author: SpaceDude
Reviews.Content: The television arrived defective.  Amazon had no more in stock.  Two weeks later, more arrived, but Amazon would not replace for the original purchase price - new price was $450 higher. No one's fault that the television was defective - it happens, but Amazon should have replaced it when the new stock arrived.  However, Amazon normally has the best prices on products around, so they really don't have to please everyone.  The television itself?  Well, all the five-star reviews speak for themselves.

Reviews.Title: Flippin' awesome display
Reviews.Author: Shane Bernskoetter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television in November 2008 on a Black Friday sale. Over the past 6 months of use I've come to love this set. I have it hooked up to my BluRay, broadcast HD signal and PC using HDMI. As a 52" computer monitor the picture quality is astounding for games, email, spreadsheet usage and for watching TV online through HULU.COM.I've never seen such clarity, definition and beautiful colors in my life. Watching the Superbowl via broadcast TV was amazing, and the tons of inputs and options on this set are astounding.I've never been so satisfied with any electronics purchase as I have with this. Friends that come over are amazed and notice a ready difference between their HDTV sets and mine. I can't recommend this LCD panel enough. The glossy panel makes the picture crisp, vivid and gorgeous. Problems with rear light glare are minimal. The touch of red color is very subtle and not noticed unless the set is in fairly bright light.I can't recommend this as a computer monitor highly enough. Playing MP3's while having a slideshow of digital pictures on this thing is a great way to kill hours - it is that amazing! Buy it and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - great delivery service, couldn't be happier.
Reviews.Author: gretchen
Reviews.Content: My original review is listed below.  I've been watching this TV for the past 5 years.  It is still working perfectly and displays an incredible image.  I've had many friends comment on the quality of the picture and TV watching experience.  Still remarkably happy - and would buy it again.I've been watching this tv for 3.5 months now - and NO complaints.  I have it in a family room with 8 windows, and even on a sunny day, have no problem seeing the picture.  Yes, there is some reflection, but I do not find it a problem at all.  The picture is beautiful, and while the sound is not at all like a stereo - it is adequate.  I also bought the Samsung bluray dvd player and directly stream and watch Netflix.  Fun and easy!  This is now the place where friends get together to watch a movie.  I highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Magnificent picture.
Reviews.Author: Don Bischoff
Reviews.Content: This TV has to be owned to be fully appreciated.  I've never seen a picture this realistic on any other TV.  Images appear so lifelike that it's almost spooky.  I also own a Sony Bravia XBR something-or-other and the Samsung has replaced the Sony in our family room.  The Sony has been demoted to the bedroom.Not only is the picture great, the menu system is very straight forward and easy to navigate and the owner's manual is much better than that furnished with the Sony.Others  have said that the sound quality is poor and I fully concur.  Actually, it's pretty bad.  I wound up running the audio output into a 300W amp connected to a Bose 901 speaker system and that solved the problem.I would strongly endorse this TV for anyone looking for a really great set, and the price can't be beat.  Just be aware that the sound quality is not the best.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: David M. Ewing
Reviews.Content: I research the HD tvs for about a month.  I read all the reviews and figured out what features I craved the most.  I wanted the 120 refresh rate for the sports.  I have not noticed anything about the reflection mentioned in other reviews.  I opted for the 650 instead of the 750 because of the reliablility mentioned in the reviews.I have had the tv about a month and love it.  If you use Dish Network, you may not be able to use the HDMI cable.  Their seems to be some issues with the receivers.  I have seen a few posts on the net and will try to remedy soon. The component still looks good.If you plan on using the pip, it's awkward to get to and turn on.  I bought a Dish Receiver 722k which has it's own pip, so I don't really need it.Yesterday we hooked up the Mac Air Book to the VGA connection and watched Lost off the net.  Not HD quality, but still pretty cool.I may be skewed since this is the first HD tv, but it is really cool.The deliver folks were nice, but don't expect technical help.  They just turn it on to make sure there is a picture.  You are on you own.  If you live in a remote area like I do, the delivery was not when Amazon promised.  It was when the delivery folks had a truck going out your way.  I waited an additional 4 days after the tv arrived in town just to be delivered.  That was the only drawback to the whole tv purchase.

Reviews.Title: 52 inch samsung
Reviews.Author: camera buff
Reviews.Content: Incredible tv!  The picture is clear and crisp and the HD is unbeatable.  I am very satisfied with the samsung TV and highly recommend to  anyone who likes to watch television.  The only problem was the delivery.  Even though the TV had been delivered to the area, it was not delivered to my home for several days.  I stayed home from work on the date it was supposed to be delivered (estimated) and that did not work.  I recommend you wait for a call to confirm the delivery date.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52-In LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Linda R. Knoebel "Linda"
Reviews.Content: This is like having people performing IN your living room.  The picture quality and sound are fantastic, even better than expected.  The delivery was very easy with phone calls telling us when to expect delivery.  The installation was without a hitch.  This is the best bargain we have ever found and can't stop telling everyone we see!!!  Amazon you're the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Functionality, Great Price
Reviews.Author: DeBee1015
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 year old 50 inch Phillips Plasma and when it decided it didn't want to turn on, and the repairman said it would be $1300 to fix it, I knew it was time to buy a new TV.The Touch of red color really makes this TV stand out from its all black competition, if you've never seen this TV in person the red really stands out from the black box crowd, when you put it in your entertainment unit, or on a stand its much less noticeable if not noticeable at all.The Unit itself set up in under 2 minutes.  The swivel base is nice.  The 3 HDMI ports are even nicer.The pictures itself is great, the clarity is fantastic.  I was looking @ the 550 in a retail store and the picture quality between the 2 sets is just unbelievable (the 650 having a much better clarity/color picture), the picture quality between the 650 & 750 was less noticeable.  Also I was comparing it to a comparable unit from Sony, and the Samsung had a better picture, better clarity, and you weren't paying for the Sony name.Watching TV on this set is amazing, the HD channels are so crisp and life like, for sporting events its like being there (except for the annoying announcers).This set also does well with gaming, I have the xBox360 elite with the HDMI ports and playing anything (even just going on the xBox Live dashboard) is fantastic.If your going to buy a new set look at the Samsung 650, its a great TV for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen C. Parker
Reviews.Content: I get a giddy feeling when i sit down to watch TV these days.  This television is, by far, in a class of its own. Many times I am fooled into thinking that I am looking through a window. It is like having the best pair of eye glasses on, the picture is crystal clear and the colors are AMAZING. We have had the TV since January, 2009 and I have not had any complaints. I am not a golfer but I find myself actually watching golf because of the colors of the landscape and the feel of almost being there. Therefore, I amHIGHLY RECOMMENDING this television.  You go, Samsung!  Oh, and of course, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Samsung after 2 months
Reviews.Author: J. Wong
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews from various sources I decided to purchase the Samsung LN52A650. I am not disappointed!  My biggest concern before getting the Samsung was potential glare from our 2 story bank of windows in the family room. We previously had a 55inch mitsubishi platinum series rear projection and we always had to close the blinds in order to stop the glare off of the screen. With the Samsung there is no noticeable glare on the screen and we are able to watch the TV in full sunlit room. One thing I did notice was that there can be a distracting glare off of the frame of the TV. The touch of color frame is very glossy and can reflect some light. The screen itself is so bright that there is no noticeable glare until you get to the extreme angles about 100 degrees off center viewing. The TV was easy to set up, the swivel base is definitely a plus, I have not noticed any ghosting as some described, it was perfect right out of the box. I wish the tv remote was a universal remote though. A great TV I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: Couldnt be better!
Reviews.Author: Cycle Dad
Reviews.Content: Normally I try to save a bit of money and get some similar specs to the top brand and cross my fingers, but I have been burnt by that too many times.  So when I was shopping for TVs, I read the reports and this TV got by far the best ratings.  So rather than buying something with similar features for less, I decided to pony up the asking price and get the best and I am really glad I did.This TV is worth every single penny.  I am spoiled now, I can't watch other people's TVs because the quality of mine make every TV out there seem average at best.  The BluRay DVDs look so lifelike, that the picture is almost TOO GOOD.The shipping was fast, the delivery guys were professional, and the set up was easy.  Couldn't ask for a better TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: W. Carolan
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with the TV. I'm not a high-end user of TV products, but this was delivered on time, in perfect condition. The TV was easy to set up, adjust and begin enjoying. I highly recommend the TV!

Reviews.Title: Almost Great
Reviews.Author: Salvador F. Cozzo
Reviews.Content: After waiting for a TV to come out that meets my wishes I bought a Samsung LN52650 and I must say the picture is very Good,I have had it for about 6 weeks now, but I do have a some compliants, first I waited for a HDTV to come out that had picture in picture (pip) and this one does but getting to it and switching the sound from one to the other is almost usless. You have to go through so many button switchs to do it, it is making me wish I had bought something else with more useable buttons on the remote. I had a Ultimate TV box and that remote was nearly perfect for this with buttons on the remote and very easy to use.If some sort of update was available for the Samsung it would not be to hard to fix but I feel that they have no real concern to fix it.As long as it is selling why fix it.Also the TV does not have a wireless connection for the internet (why NOT).You can buy an adaptor for it (about $40) if you can find it and I did find it. It works sometime and does not work sometime even when my internet works find it will not connect as it should, a waste of money, just hard wire it and it seems OK, But don't expect much weather and stock market, some news is about it but really not very good for much as the interface is poorly designed and many button pushs to use almost everything.The TV inter face is OK but so many color options with no real guide or button to go back to factory settigs it can be overwellmingHow about the inputs in the back? HDMI 4, composit 2, but the use of anything else for imputs such as regular DVD player and Xbox and Wii is not useable with out disconnecting one and reconnecting the other.Low end for a high end TV.I have it hooked up to Direct TV HD and as I have stated the picture is very nice but so do other TV's. The sound is good but not outstanding so use your sourround sound if you have it and it will be much better.

Reviews.Title: great picture but so-so turner
Reviews.Author: J. Wei
Reviews.Content: Looked like Samsung LN52A650 got high-marks on every reviews.  Love the picture.However, I'm very disappointed on the digital tuner.  A $50 no-brand HD converter gotbetter receiving on the same antenna signal.  It's a shame to ignore such fundamentalfeature on such almost perfect product.

Reviews.Title: This TV is as good as everyone says
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Tolstoshev
Reviews.Content: Just received the TV today - Amazon quoted me a week, and they were right on.The shipping was adequate.  They called me last night to say they were going to deliver it, but got lost and never showed up.  They finally called me and told me they'd try again in the morning, which they did.  Even though my delivery service was Pilot, and I'd read all the horror stories on here, they did bring the TV in, put it on the stand and turn it on to confirm it worked.The TV itself is what gets the 5 stars.  Since the digital switchover, I have new over the air HD channels.  When you put it on an HD channel, it looks like the people are in the same room with you.  This TV looked better than all the others in the showroom, and the reviews here are what sealed the deal.For anyone who is trying to decide between the 650 and the 630 due to reflections, go with the 650.  I have huge windows on two sides of the room, and behind me, and glare isn't a problem.  Less reflection and glare than the Samsung CRT I replaced.

Reviews.Title: Well Worth the Wait!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Bastier "WranglerW"
Reviews.Content: Best picture I've ever seen! With 50,000/1 resolution along with  black/white balance, 120hz refresh rate, etc. Why pay >1,500.00 more for other brands? After extensively checking reviews from various sources (CNET.com, Consumer Reports, etc.) for months, I was set on this purchase but waited until Super Bowl week for the price to go down.  Was afraid to deal with other than Amazon after reading other online dealer reviews with complaints not rectified concerning shipping damage.  Amazon's free  White Glove Delivery/Setup Service ensured the TV is not damaged (if so, no having to accept delivery), and adding no tax, and free shipping made this a steal compared to the 'Big Box' stores.  Saved at least  [...]  from the lowest found sale price (Best Buy).  Coupled with a Blu-Ray DVD Player and a Home Theater setup, no need to go to the movies again!!!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: J. Otto
Reviews.Content: The TV is great and the picture is beautiful.  We got the TV within a week from ordering it and the delivery service was fantastic.  The TV and Amazon is well recommended.

Reviews.Title: Awesome television
Reviews.Author: Maryrose90
Reviews.Content: Love this television.  We purchased it as a family Christmas gift for our new family/media room.  Great picture and sound.  Arrived super quick and the guys carried it downstairs, unboxed it, set it in place, and took all the packaging with them.  Great service.  We are very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: 99 for - 1 against
Reviews.Author: D. LeRoy
Reviews.Content: Our 52" 650 arrived at the local delivery warehouse just before Superbowl weekend.  Because they wouldn't or couldn't deliver in time I went and picked it up and the setup was fine.  If anyone is considering a wall mount, I used blue tape on the wall first in order to see how high and left/right I wanted the tv to be.  The picture and sound are superb.  The only annoying item is when the tv is turned on it makes an announcement jingle, kinda like the beginning of windows starting up on the computer.  It does it when you shut it off also, unless the volume is muted.  There does not seem to be a way to shut this off.  The time between turn on and turn off is flawless.  The TOC looks great against my faux brick wall.  You won't be sorry you bought this one.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Loyd E. Eskildson "Pragmatist"
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived two days sooner than originally promised, and was set up in our home as part of the Amazon purchase price. Amazing contrast and clarity - equal to the special arrangements made for store displays. The set automatically finds all available HD channels, allowing them to be viewed instead of the regular channels. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Olga P.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful TV. only thing that could be improved is screw access for the original stand, they were easy to loosen but hard to retrieve. I did not have a narrow enough magnetic screwdriver. Only have to remove the stand once so no big deal, just the only thing I can find to wine about. Am using through theater system so have not listened to built in speakers. Picture is great and set recognizes my Sony Blue ray and switches from tv mode to dvd input as soon as I hit play on the dvd. I love it

Reviews.Title: Big Girl TV
Reviews.Author: S. D. Peterson "Beautifully Human"
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this television.  The quality of the picture is great.  The images are sharp, bright, and extremely clear.  Watching sports on this tv is amazing and it feels like your right there.  I have basic cable now with comcast, but this tv has the ability to find HD channels without actually having the service.  I thoroughly enjoy it!  I would recommend it to others...I did a lot of research before buying it and it definitely paid off.

Reviews.Title: Shipping worries? Don't worry!!
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: First, the TV is great!  But you already know that.  Second - I was VERY hesitant to order such a large item online.  Well, I ordered this at 2:00pm, and it arrived at 8:00am the next morning!  I actually intercepted the package before they could deliver because I saw that it had arrived at the 'Pilot Freight' distribution center very close to my home.  They were extremely open for me to come and pick it up myself (I was anxious to get it!).  The box was in great shape and the TV couldn't be more perfect.  Plus, with Amazon having free shipping for it and the fact that there isn't tax charged for MD, I saved a bucket of cash after their initial sale on this TV.  Don't hesitate, Go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: The Samsung 52a650 has the WOW factor!
Reviews.Author: Richard Reed "Pistol Kid"
Reviews.Content: First, my hat is off to Amazon Warehouse sales.  "Mint" was what they advertized and is exactly what I received.  Great price, great delivery, greatest of all was the product.  The Samsung 52a650 LCD TV worked, letter perfect, right out of the box.I agree, that the input options on the TV could be improved, but there are enough for most applications and everything that I needed to attach.  I did my homework using the tech stuff (like 120 hs refresh rate, or 4 ms paint, and millions of colors) to compare the top sets below $2,500.  The two which seemed always to be on top were the Sony Brava 52-6x and the Samsung 52a650.  Generally, price put the Sony in second place, as it was always $300 to $500 more then the Samsung.Finally, Amazon Wearhouse deals came into play.  I could not be more pleased with top quality, mint contidion, open box sale.  Every aspect of the purchase was as expected or better then expected.  The outside of the box was damaged, but everything inside was brand new, sealed, just as advertized to be in Mint condition.Finally, I came to the acid test, to make my wife happy.  The touch of red case, the overall look, and the ease of operations all were a plus.  Bottom line, though, was the picture quality in 1080p and with Dish HD.  We both agree that viewing non-HD shows on this TV leaves something to be desired.  In fact our older Sony analog 35" is better for that, but clearly the WOW factor is present when you're viewing HD on the Samsug 52a660 LCD set.  Once you have one of these set up in your home, you can never go back to non-HD again.  I am now spoiled.  One of my best desions in years.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: R. Cade
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  I get so many compliments on the picture quality.  In order to have HDTV thru my cable company you have to pay for it.  My friend pays for it and I don't, but my picture quality is better than hers.  I thought buying a 52" would be too big, now I wish I got something bigger.  I don't have a home theater and I don't see myself getting it anytime soon, since the audio is pretty decent. I have my laptop hooked up to the TV, so I can watch movies thru Netflix.  The only negative was the price. I got it at a reasonable price, but the following week, it drop almost $200.  It is what it is.  I had some issues with the delivering company. It was only one guy and I had to tell him to unbox the TV and I had to help him put it on my TV stand.  Also he said it was against company rules to take the box. I kept the box because I need to get the UPC codes, so it's no problem, but unless you ask, Pilot does not do the white glove delivery like Amazon advertises.

Reviews.Title: Why did I wait so long?
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: There has been a lot written about this Samsung TV so I am not sure what I can offer.  However, I will add that I looked for a LONG time reading everything I could about 52" lcd tv's and this model constantly got great reviews regardless where you looked.  It is everything we could have asked for without any troubles whatsoever.  Once we narrowed it down to the Samsung models, we had to decide which model.  The 550 was older technology so it was out (even though it is a great tv for the price) the 850 was really nice but $600 more than the 650 and the 750 was about $100 more but we didn't like the bezel or the possible 'halo' effect that has been mentioned.  After deciding on the 650 and placing the order, everything since has gone great.  Delivery was fine, they called to schedule the appointment and they showed up on time.  I have run through all the menus on the TV and everything was easy to understand.  I haven't tried to calibrate all the color settings but I'll get to it.  I never realized how much better the clarity is on HDTV until now.  Wow is an understatement, it is awesome.  My friend has a really good 720 plasma but this 1080p LCD is so much cleaner.  Great picture quality and the screen material is somewhat glossy but it is not a problem at all.  I highly recommend this TV for the price, quality, resolution, features and number of input choices.

Reviews.Title: Great video, minor connector issues
Reviews.Author: Mario "Test Manager"
Reviews.Content: Pros:  The video on this tv is stunning.  It makes my old 1080i DLP 52" look as if it wasn't even HD.  Also the non-HD playback is very decent.  I priced out TV's at Costco, Samsclub, Best Buy, and this TV which is easily superior in video playback quality to anything the chains carried was significantly cheaper from Amazon, than the lesser quality screens from the big box stores.Cons:  I've had a little trouble with Audio for my PC.  According to the manual if you use HDMI 2 from a pc, you can connect an RCA cord for audio in.  I don't know if it's poor documentation or just a menu setting but I wasn't able to get audio from my pc.  I ended up plugging in pc speakers directly to the PC instead.  The sheer coolness of running 1920x1080 on a 52" monitor made up for any problems I had with PC audio.  Fallout 3 looks amazing!  Oh, one last thing.  It may be worth going with the next model up for better audio quality.  The 650 model has kind of weak bass.  With the 650, I'd recommend adding a 5.1 speaker system.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" HDTC LCD WITH RED TOUCH OF COLOR
Reviews.Author: Margaret Evans "M.Evans"
Reviews.Content: We have had the TV for two months and are thoroughly enjoying the larger screen and we do not miss the glare from the Florida sun that we had on our old TV. Installation was done by our local Dish Network and was accomplished without problems. The HD is a marked improvement from our previous TV. Would recommend it - price was very competative. Delivery was on time and we were able  to track it daily on line. Delivery crew set it up for us on our table and even moved our old media cabinet upstairs for us. We saved a considerable amount of money by using Amazon as our local stores were charging delivery and other fees for items which we really did not need. They were trying to convince us that we needed to have it calibrated for a charge of $200. We saved on taxes too. All in all the local store quoted us over $3,000 vs $1800 on Amazon. Of course this included extended warranty which we decided we did not need. We did purchase a surge protector with battery backup. Guess they thought because we were older that we would fall for this.

Reviews.Title: Would have been 5 Stars if not for having to fix dead line of pixels
Reviews.Author: Jack Handy
Reviews.Content: I would have given this TV 5 stars if I would have rated it when we first got it, but I had it have it serviced.  When we got it, there were a few minor complaints, like the remote is directionally sensitive.  You can't point it anywhere from the middle left, or up.  You have to point it toward the bottom right of the TV for it to work.  At the beginning we would be trying to change something and nothing would be happening.  You can't just have it on a stand like we used to next to your couch and push the volume up a few times.  You have to pick it up and point it at the TV.  My wife would be pointing the remote from her walking machine on the left side of the couch and couldn't get the remote to increase the volume of the TV when she was pointing it right at it, I played with it and got it to work if you leaned over or pointed clear down at the bottom right.  The sound could be better.  But the reason we got it was for the picture and that was amazing, with no complaints.  The delivery was impeccable.  The guys were courteous, set it up, tested it, asked if I wanted the box removed, but recommended I keep it, etc.  No problems there.However, exactly one month after the delivery, it suddenly developed a row or two of dead pixels horizontally across about 4 inches up from the bottom.  It was distracting and annoying.  I called in for repair and by the time they came out and looked and then ordered the part and got back, it was over 3 weeks later before it was fixed.  They guy had to replace the whole screen on it.  I asked if this is a common problem and he said that it is getting to be, so it sounds like they are seeing more of these problems now.  He said that it is more usually for the line to be vertical instead of horizontal like mine was.  I asked how much this would be once it is out of warranty and he laughed and said to just throw away the TV and get another one, that the replacement screen costs more than I would have paid for the TV.It did get fixed and is back to it's former glory, but I am not feeling so great good about this now.  To spend so much and be faced with the thought of it going partially dead after a year and either having to buy a whole new TV or try and ignore a row of dead pixels is not too thrilling.  I just hope that it is one of those things that if it lasts past a year, then it will be ok and last a long time.  I never buy extended warranty, as on the camera I once did, I never used it and by the time it stopped focusing well, I wanted a better model anyway.  However, is it needed or worth it for this TV?

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Taylor
Reviews.Content: For months prior to my wedding in late December, I had been lusting for the 52" Sony XBR6 LCD TV after seeing the XBR4 in Sears last summer.  I even went so far as to register for it, not that I really thought anyone would spring for a gift that expensive.  Once the wedding came and went, my wife and I decided to buy ourselves a big screen TV as a wedding gift to ourselves.Once I got the green light from the Mrs., I began to do more extensive research which included a visit to a local chain store to see my options.  Upon walking in, I was immediately struck by the picture on a Samsung LN52A850 that they had displayed right near the door.  Further investigation showed that the 750 and 850 models had features that I don't need or want and the LN52A650 had the same picture.  The slam dunk came when I saw a 650 displayed right next to the Sony XBR6 -- the Samsung had a much sharper picture with more realistic color tones and more attractive styling.  Then, as if to eliminate all doubt, an issue of Consumer Reports landed in my mailbox the same week and inside was a review of big screen TVs that had the Samsung LN52A65O number one of all LCD TVs.  End of discussion.After checking prices everywhere, Amazon's price was at least $100 less than every other price I found and with no shipping or sales tax.  I paid exactly $1,799.  The price seems to fluctuate daily but I have found it to be lowest on Sundays, for whatever reason.  I bought the TV on Sunday, February 1st with an expected delivery date of Monday, February 9th which seemed fair given the no cost shipping.  The TV shipped early Monday morning via Pilot Freight and, incredibly, I received a call from Pilot on Tuesday afternoon telling me that the TV was in Connecticut and could be delivered to me on Thursday the 5th!  Woo hoo!!!  As it turns out, I couldn't be home to receive it that day so I arranged for delivery on Monday the 9th which is the first day of my vacation.Pilot subcontracted the delivery to a local moving company and, having been given a delivery window of 11-3, the truck arrived at about 11:30.  Two fellows unloaded a very large box, carried it into my living room, opened the box, removed all of the protective wrapping and placed it upon my stand.  They advised me that because the outside temperature was below 50F they couldn't plug it and turn it on.  So I was only asked to sign a statement that there was no physical damage to the TV.After a couple of (long) hours, I finally fired it up and I have to say it is breathtaking.  The 1080i HD that Comcast delivers looks stunning.  And even standard definition is quite good.  I haven't even had a chance to play a blu-ray movie.  I'm sure it will be unbelieveable.  The Touch of Color is a non-issue -- only visible if you look for it and even then it is hard to see.  The screen glare is not a problem but I don't have direct sunlight on it.  The frame of the TV is much more glossy and even that doesn't cause a problem.I would have liked one more AV input (yellow-red-white) on the back as there is only one (there is a second one on the side) but that is a minor quibble.  I've connected the cable box and blu-ray via HDMI which is a thing of beauty.  The swivel stand is a nice feature as is the rubberized bottom of the stand.All in all, one of the best purchases I have ever made.  I bought the 3-year extended warranty which seemed like it was free after saving so much money at Amazon.One more added bonus...I offered the two delivery guys $50 each to haul my massive 36" CRT TV upstairs to our den.  Happily, they took me up on it.  Another home run since I could have never done it myself.  It made a tremendously satisfying purchase all the more perfect.Buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: INCREDIBLE!!
Reviews.Author: Michael T. Grates "MTGRATES"
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazing and nothing shy of spectacular.  I don't find the remote as difficult as some to navigate so there is not an issue there.  Though in MN and fairly cold watching the Pro Bowl it felt warm and sunny yesterday!

Reviews.Title: LN52A650
Reviews.Author: J. Steins
Reviews.Content: After researching various TV's for a few months (including visiting many stores to see them), I chose the Samsung LN52A650. IMHO, it has the best picture by far, compared to its competitors. I had originally wanted a Pioneer Plasma, but just could not justify the expense (cost vs. benefit). The 650 series has every bit as good a picture as the 850 and 950 series, for less money. The picture controls are outstanding, allowing me to satisfy my inner video geek. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable Picture!
Reviews.Author: B. Fernandes
Reviews.Content: I have been shopping for 52" TV's for months and found this Samsung LN52A650 to be the best value in the market.  The picture is outstanding and watching Blu Ray is unbelievable!  I bought it from Amazon because I avoided paying sales tax, shipping charges and they even included basic set up with White Glove Delivery.  I highly recommend this Samsung LCD television.

Reviews.Title: Great color
Reviews.Author: David Brown
Reviews.Content: Found the product to be everything is was advertised to be. Excellent color and audio. Would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Buy Warehouse deals
Reviews.Author: Nike jr "RLW"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung 52-650 from Amazon Warehouse deals.  At first I was a bit reluctant but all my fears were put to rest upon delivery.  I saved hundreds of dollars and got a open box unit that is pefect.  The deliverer helped me place it in my entertainment center and made sure it turned on and worked properly.  All the hype about the picture is right on target! Sports have never looked so good.  The sounds is great for tv speakers.  I researched this product for weeks, afterall, it is a huge financial purchase.  I visited all the major department stores examing both plasmas and lcd's.  All my research brought me to the Samsung 600 series.  Don't settle for a cheaper tv or waiste your money on the Sony.  If you choose this tv, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: owu68
Reviews.Content: I ordered the TV from Amazon on January 29,2009 . The unit was delivered February 4, 2009. The TV was manufactured in January of 2009.I spent weeks researching for this purchase. I compared the 650 and the 630. I went with the 650 52" model. There is no glare issue in my home. Reviews have made a big issue of the mirror like screen. When the TV is on, the picture is so bright and clear you can not see glare. The TOC red tint bezel is also a non issue. The red is so subtle that you have to get up very close and eyeball the bezel to even notice the red tint.The picture is magnificent. The colors are bright and clear.The 630 model is nice and has a semi matte finish but the a650 has a clearer, brighter picture and and better electronics. Go with the 650, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Best 52" HD Flat Panel Choice
Reviews.Author: D. Bursch
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers have posted, I combed the net for about a month looking at all the comparative details and reviews from actual users. Looked carefully at plasma/LCD technical differences and checked out the visual experience in stores. This LCD has more clarity, color depth and vivid picture -even when compared to a Kuro plasma. Finally took the leap last week: Ordered on Thursday, they called to deliver on Monday. One guy delivered it (said he was used to that but I helped him anyway). We set it up, turned it on -everything A OK. Can't believe the clarity, vividness of the picture. The Touch of Red is extremely subtle and matched our decor anyway. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best LCD TV, period
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Johansson
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because it got top ratings from Consumer reports and some other reviewers.  I can say that it is the best TV i have ever viewed. (period).  Best TV of any brand, any size, any price, any technology.

Reviews.Title: I thought our Sony had a great picture
Reviews.Author: Thomas Carslay "aliikai2"
Reviews.Content: This Samsung TV has such life like picture quality that sometime I forget were watching TV. Great set.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" LCD
Reviews.Author: M. Watkins
Reviews.Content: I've been collecting reviews and information on LCDs and plasmas for well over 3 years, but still did not know which would be best due to the pros and cons of each system. Having decided on the LCD I turned to Consumer Report Online and found that this was the highest rated LCD. I've been most pleased from the time that it arrived. The pros that I had read about are all true and the cons are insignificant. I like the red touch, but if I didn't it is subtle and insignificant. The power and volume controls on the set are hard to see at some angles, but that has worked to my advantage since my 5 year old son is yet to find them, and I hope he doesn't. I've only had it for about a month, so I can't testify to it's dependability. The bottom line is that we are most satisfied.

Reviews.Title: WOW Great TV - Good Delivery
Reviews.Author: JDN
Reviews.Content: Delivery was fast. I got the set in 3 days, and had good communication from the shipper. It showed up on time as they scheduled also. They (two of them) did not take the packaging with them or unbox the set, and they couldn't test it either due to the temperature (not their fault#. Overall, shipping was OK, but I kind of wish I didn't have to deal with the packaging.Onto the set which is the most important thing. It is without a doubt, the best. I am floored by how good the picture is. Do not hesitate any longer if you're on the fence. Like most I researched this to death, I read every review, and was worried about an internet order for something this big and pricey. But I am glad I used Amazon who has yet to disappoint me on anything.I mounted it to the wall using a versa mount, and it looks great. The touch of red is minimal, and for me, looks great as we have red in the couches and window valances. Standard cable looks ok, as it would on any set, but HD is just stunning. I have not hooked it to blu-ray yet, but will tonight, and update this report.With the TV off, yes you see reflections, but that is not a problem for me when it is on. I have huge windows right on the side of it; however we don't get direct sun where the set is. If this is a concern for you, it should not be one that makes you miss out on this set.The remote is a bit finicky, but I use it with a harmony 880 universal remote, and the combination is a win win. No problems with all the functions through the harmony remote.The sound is a bit weak, but I run my sound through my Yamaha receiver via optical anyways, so it's a non-issue for me. It's not bad, but it's not great either.I have the set hooked up via HDMI to a Scientific Atlanta 8300HD box using cablevision #optimum). My Blu-ray comes tonight, so I will update this review shortly. The Xbox 360 is just amazing quality as well, and that is hooked up using component ports as I have an older console sans HDMI. Call of Duty looks amazing, like you're in a movie. This set replaces a 32" Samsung tube HD TV.I am very happy with my set, and Amazon, and you should jump on this. I got mine just under 1.9k, and that is the best price, even better than Circuit City who is liquidating stock.Go get it!UPDATE - Blu Ray is really exceptional with this set. I have a Sony BDP-S350 hooked up using HDMI, and I could not imagine it getting any better. 100% SatisfiedUPDATE 2 - 3 Years later, and this TV is rock solid! Love it.UPDATE 3 - 4 Years, cant even get this TV anymore, so don't know why I should update, but the set is showing age a bit with vertical red lines on left and right when you first turn it on. When it warms up, they go away. Once warmed up, this set looks as good as day 1. This TV is well worth it for me, even if it dies tonight. It has been on for ~6 hours a day every day for four years.

Reviews.Title: This is a good purchase
Reviews.Author: N. Reddy "Neehar Cherabuddi"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this TV about a month ago and i am very satisfied with it. It fits right into my apartment and is perfect for gamers and movie buffs.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A 650 most Excellent
Reviews.Author: M. Duda
Reviews.Content: Most ExcellentThe Samsung LN52A650 is a perfect TV for our needs.  We also have a Panasonic plasma 720p that we purchased a year ago that we are comparing it to. Both have their pluses and minuses. The good about the Samsung for one was the size and price. We put the item in our Amazon "cart" and watched as the price changed almost daily from $1,999.00 to the lowest price we saw (the price we purchased it at $1,828.88). We haven't seen it at this price since. This price included all taxes and shipping. The unit is currently selling at stores in our area on sale for $2,099.00 plus tax. The Samsung LN52A650 does include some basics for today's LCD's including the important Full HD 1080p Resolution and 120Hz Auto Motion.  And with 4 HDMI Inputs it is all set up for connecting cable and DVD players. The picture is fantastic about the same as the plasma at 720p, the audio is OK, pump it through a 7:1 unit and you're dialed in. A great unit for the price at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Really Great Price
Reviews.Author: JD Blackwell
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of checking locally and online ... read a bunch of reviews ... and it finally boiled down to a 52" Samsung and to Amazon!  They gave me the best price and free shipping on top of that!  Everything arrived in great shape and I have been super pleased.  I've got it hanging on the LR wall and folks are right - "no one ever wishes they had gotten a smaller TV" ... and I am so glad I bit the bullet and bought the biggest screen I could afford.  We're loving it ... finally I'm going to catch up on all the movies I wanted to see & missed for one reason or another.  This is just like going to the movies but much better ... better popcorn, pizza, potty breaks with out missing a single moment, and I can back it up if I think I missed something critical.  Now try that in a theater - it won't happen!  I'm very happy with the quality of picture and with Amazon.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great TV & Delivery, a couple of minor cons
Reviews.Author: Senior Citizen "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN52A650 HDTVI purchased the TV from Amazon in late Dec '08.  Previously I'd bought only books from Amazon and had some concern about buying a large TV on line.  I decided to go ahead based on the good reviews, Amazon's warrantee/return policies and their service, and the price.  Each was much better than anything local. I'm very happy with the results.The TV is great -- I high recommend it.  The delivery service was also great, beyond expectation -- Seven days total, several calls from the freight company (Pilot) to advise me of the schedule. The delivery man was very experienced with these TVs, knew what to look for (he said he had delivered many and had encountered two with screen damage), and how to safely handle it.  He unpacked it, carried it upstairs, removed my old CRT TV from its stand and placed the HDTV there.  He hooked up the cable and turned it on.  I was able to verify it was in perfect condition before signing anything.  He carried the packing box to the attic (I'm keeping it a while just in case...).  We've used the TV for almost three weeks and have had no problems.  I highly recommend this TV, Amazon, and the shipping service.The picture quality is wonderful. I won't go into that as it is well described in many comments.Several comments that are minor but perhaps of interest --1) As others have noted, that silly ring around the 4-way controller on the remote can be aggrevating -- it makes using the controller difficult.  I solved this by putting a piece of scotch tape over the controller and ring so the ring won't rotate -- problem solved.  (I first thought of but quickly dismissed a drop of super glue.)2)  Connecting a component Home Theater system is turning out to be less straight forward than I expected.  My wife uses the TV more than I and would like to do so without the HTR.  To achieve this result, I thought I could simply connect the TV to my cable box and other components with HDMI cables, and connect audio from the TV to the HTR with component or optical cables.  The Samsung remote has one button that makes selection of a video/audio source very easy.  I now understand that the connection is a bit more complicated.  According to the Samsung manual on page 11 and a big surprise to me, "When the TV is displaying a DTV (air) signal, the TV will send 5.1 sound to the HTR.  When the source is a digital component such as a DVD and is connected to the TV via HDMI, only 2 channel sound will be heard from the HTR."  To hear 5.1 sound through the HTR, component cables or optical cables must ALSO be run from the cable box or other components to the HTR.3) I've found the manual to be very clear in describing how to operate all the features of the TV.  (Figuring out what exactly all the features are or do is less clear.)  An aggrevating part of the manual are the page numbers which are printed in black type and are highlighted (covered) by a dark gray box, rendering them invisible except in good light. If one is watching the TV in a medium dark room and wants to use the manual's table of contents and then find the page number, forget it, or keep a flashlight handy.Each of the above is minor -- none are reasons not to buy this TV.Regarding Touch of Color.  We like it and would think most would like it.  I'm surprised that some do not.  If you are concerned, take a look at a store model and determine this before buying it.  It seems a bit unfair to rate it down, already knowing what would look like.Finally, we have found the sound quality to be poor.  Apparently this is common with flat panel TVs which have little space and no good location for speakers.  I expect to resolve this with the home theater systema and a high quality center channel speaker.Bottom line -- I highly recommend the TV, Amazon, and their delivery service.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Mishich
Reviews.Content: I saved so much money buying my beautiful tv from Amazon.  I am so happy with my tv and I highly recommend shopping through Amazon especially if you want good products at a super good price.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: D. McCartney
Reviews.Content: Awsome picture.Thought we would use the swivel base to improve view from different angles but picture is perfect from most any angle,this was a big problem with the 52" Sony projection it replaced.Our room gets quite bright on sunny days and there are NO proglems with reflections or glare.Could not be happier!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this TV
Reviews.Author: Toy Buyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung a couple months after I'd bought a 32" Samsung for my bedroom and absolutely loved the clarity of the picture.  I was concerned about the Red Touch of Color, but was able to see it in person at a local store and was pleasantly surprised it was so subtle.  Unless you know it's there, it's hard to see - yet gives an elegant slight glow to the edges of the unit.I subscribed to HD programming through Dish Network when I bought the set.  The color and clarity of this TV is amazing.  I've seen no problems with blur or bad blacks in various programming that LCD's sometimes have problems with.  The AnyNet feature (that automatically turns the TV on when a connected device, like a DVD player is turned on) is a great feature, though I'm having a few issues with it.  If I turn on the DVD player - which automatically turns the TV on and sets the source to HDMI Theater, then want to switch TV sources to HDMI Satellite, the DVD player turns off.  I don't like this lack of control, so hope to find a way to disable the AnyNet at my choosing.My parents bought a 46" Sony Bravia XBR4 in 2007 and it's a wonderful TV.  I love my Samsung more.  I like the black frame because it blends better into the backround than silver framed units.I spent quite a bit of time viewing the Samsung 46" and the 52" because my room is somewhat small (12' x 15') and I sit 9' from the TV - I was concerned the 52" would be overwhelming.  It's not.  I replaced a 36" CRT that looked HUGE because of the big box.  This 52" Samsung actually looks smaller.I definitely recommend this television.

Reviews.Title: After several months of research and side by side comparisons
Reviews.Author: Eduardo A. Pineda
Reviews.Content: I had a sony projection HDTV that was about 4 years old and needed to be replaced, so I spent about three months researching HDTVs. Initially, I was sure I would get a Plasma tv because they had better reviews on picture quality, black depth (important if you like to watch movies with the light down), and response time. The Samsung 650 was on my short list but I wasn't going to make the final decision until I saw a side by side comparison. I'm not a pro, but I can usually tell the difference between LCDs and Plasmas when I'm in a showroom especially in fast moving or dark scenes. I thought the 650 was as good as the panasonic 800U plasma which was my first choice at the time. I played around with the picture settings on both, to the point that some B.Buy employees were giving me the stink eye a little. The 650 had brighter colors without loosing the black depth that I like, and the blurring effect from regular LCD was not noticeable thanks to the 120hz processing. The 800U/850U panasonic was just as good so I made my decision based on several other factors.1.  The 650 was cheaper than the comparable plasma by about $100-2002.  You get extra 2 inches with and LCD (52" LCD vs 50" Plasma), 2 inches isn't much but I'll take it.3.  Turns out the plasmas take more energy/$ to run, some energy websites put the difference at about $50 bucks a year.4.  The LCD weight about 70lbs while the Plasmas are closer to 100lbs, makes a big difference if you hang it on a wall, a lighter load sits more secure.5.  LCDs picture looks much better when hooked up to a PC, which I routinely do.6.  The TV design is very elegant, the glass look of the bezel makes it very attractive and the touch buttons are embedded in the frame so the tv looks smooth throughtout.Issues reported by others- The TOC red bezel:  The bezel looks has a dark burgundy rim around the outer 1inch edge. Hardly noticible under normal light conditions, It's not noticeable at night. Unless you point it out to people, they won't see it.- Reflective screen:  This could be a major issue if your TV is placed across from the window as mine is, and the sun is shining right on it. Otherwise the screen is not worst than a any other TV. I solved it by getting darker curtains (brown curtains look nice in an off-white room) and by buying a tilting wall mount, which blocks the light from the top of the curtain where the suns light is brigthest. I have a mount from amazon too (~$40), the stores were selling them for $150+. I got the HDMI 1.3v from here too for about ~$10, not $50+ like at the stores. I guess the stores see the accesories as their way to recover reduced sale prices.- The sound quality: You won't get the same reaction from seeing the tv as you will from hearing it, the sound is simply adequate. The sound is fine for watching sitcoms, the news, or any regular tv programming, but you'll want to hook up your audio systems action shows like 24, Heroes, Sports, and especially dvd/blu-ray movies. To be fair, I would turn on my audio system even if this tv had a better sound system. Who buys this tv and not have at least surround stereo or 5.1 system?Minor Cons,- There's a 2-5 second lag in signal when switching between standard and HDTV sources (my old TV did the switch in 1-2 seconds)- The clickwheel on the remote is not as responsive as an ipod wheel, takes about 1/2 turn to move the menu choice- The push buttons on the TV itself are very well hidden, almost too well hiddenAnyway, the picture is just as great as others describe in this forum. The experience with amazon was very quick and painless. I received the TV in 4 business days after. The delivery company was CEVA logistics and they had their own tracking on their website along with amazon's own tracking system. I got a call the day before delivery and they offered morning or afternoon delivery. You should have the place where the TV will be placed ready because 'white glove delivery' just means that they bring it in, unpack it, and turn the power on to show that it works.

Reviews.Title: Best Shopping Experience
Reviews.Author: Kathy M. Zazzeron "Kathyzazz"
Reviews.Content: We love our new Samsung.  Our delivery service went well.  They brought in the tv and unpackaged it and plugged and turned it on so that I could confirm it was in working order. I did a lot of research on which brand to buy and went with the Samsung.  It is all that I could have asked for.  The price was right and the picture is great.  I would recommend it to anyone who is in the market for a new tv.

Reviews.Title: Amazing LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Frayserboy
Reviews.Content: After months of research,  we chose the LN52A650 mostly for the value.  I would have to agree with other buyers that this is the BEST TV for the dollars spent.After several weeks of viewing, I still find myself amazed at the difference in quality.  I have yet to order the HD upgrade from satellite provider, but when I do, I can't wait to see how much better it will be then.I absolutely recommend Samsung, and specifically this model, to anyone wanting to make the jump, but is budget conscious.Also, the complete transaction and white glove delivery through Amazon was top-notch and the TV was delivered on schedule.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: bkr
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this TV.  I have never had a big screen television before but the picture is bright and crisp.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: G. Dyck "RUEggsperienced"
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with this TV.  The picture is fabulous, especially w/HD, DVD and Blu Ray.  I have no complaints.  Generally I do alot of research and this TV kept coming back.  I think I made the right decision.The only improvement I have is to put a variable output audio link.  I have a bit older amplifier and my old Sony and Panasonic TVs allowed me to control volume on the audio output jacks from the TV volume control.  The Samsung, you physically have to turn volume up and down from the amplifier when using the audio out jack.  I guess I need to buy a new amplifier with HDMI inputs and only use the TV as a monitor - but for now I have to swap back and forth between my TV, DVR, remote controls.This shipping company did an excellent job and was very professional.  Good job Amazon!Note I do like the infolink which is a cool add on.  I can hit a button and see some stocks that I own, and also local weather and news.  I just connected the tv to my home network.

Reviews.Title: Awesome LCD TV for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Rowe
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN52A650 is a tv that really shows what high definition is supposed to look like.  I can't say enough about this tv.  The colors look awesome on TV, Blu-Ray, and Wi games.  It is easy to figure out the remote.  I only have 1 negative comment about the tv but wouldn't drop the stars to 4 stars based on this comment.(This negative being the remote with it's plastic spin wheel for navigation seems very cheap).  They should have given you a much nicer remote for the price of this tv.  Other than that, this tv is the best I've seen.  I saved over $900 by buying this LCD at Amazon and not Best Buy.  In addition, the free White Glove shipping was great.  No complaints.  Two guys brought the tv downstairs to the basement, unloaded it from the box, and set it up on the console.  They then plugged it in and made sure it was working properly before leaving.  The name of the shipping company was Total Trucking Transport.  Enjoy this tv as it is the best one on the market for LCD's according to me and Consumer Reports.

Reviews.Title: Buy this TV - Don't look any further
Reviews.Author: David Bernstein
Reviews.Content: I spent over 6 months researching LCD TV's. Went to every big box store and looked at every brand. I had a budget of $2500 for a 52" unit that I could hang in my den and I read ever published on line and print review. I have now had my Samsung LN52A650 in use for a little over a month and the only question I keep asking myself is why in the hell did I wait so long to pull the trigger on purchasing this unit. Every time I turn the unit on I am blown away. This unit is great and watching my beloved Steelers in 1080p / 120hz is Fantastic! I almost spent the extra 100+ for the 750 unit but the sound on the 650 is just fine. The price on this unit from Amazon, that included a no charge bluray player was unbeatable! $2011 delivered to my door with the white glove treatment. If you are serious about purchasing a new LCD Tv - BUY THIS ONE! I am getting ready to buy another Samsung 42" LCD for or bedroom later this month. I couldn't be happier with my decesion!

Reviews.Title: This is why samsung is number 1
Reviews.Author: J. Schanen
Reviews.Content: I use my samsung to watch blu-ray and play x-box 360. It is unbelievable for HD. The frame rate makes it look more real because it is very quick. It's glass screen makes it so much more HD and is awesome for watching blu-ray movies on. No other TV compares to this one. Great for watching football on also. So much better than a Sony or any other TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Tool Guy
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 46" in the summer and bought another bigger size (52") recently.  I truly believe this is one of the bests sets on the market regardless of price.  Make sure you get the 650 series thought, you'll be disappointed if you don't.

Reviews.Title: Could not be more happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: J. Quinn
Reviews.Content: It is great to be able to read reviews of people that purchase and use different products. If it wasn't for Amazon and their review system, I would have had no idea what HDTV to purchase out of the thousands available.Anyway...I received the TV yesterday and spent the day playing with the new toy. I am amazed by the quality of the picture, paired with DirectTV HD...it is AWESOME!The delivery consisted of 1 guy in a van. There were no problems with having just 1 individual handle this TV. He brought it inside and I helped him unwrap it. He had be plug it in to inspect the screen and to make sure that I was 100% satisfied before I signed.Overall I have had a terrific experience with this purchase. I am really glad I went with the 52" rather than the 46"!You will have no regrets that you bought this TV!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Ong
Reviews.Content: I have been using this TV for about a month and a half now. I used this product mainly with Samsung Blu Ray player using HDMI cable connection. The picture quality is just superb. Besides, the on screen menu is easy to understand and it required minimum deviations from default factory setting.The only minor complain I have is the sensitivity of the remove control unit. I have to point directly at the TV in order for it to work. Other than that, this Samsung TV is as good as it get.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful purchase, amazing quality!
Reviews.Author: N. R. Miles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were researching TV's for months.  He knew he definitely wanted a Samsung.  This was on the top of his list for quality, size, contrast, and lots of other little bits of tech info.  We shopped around and found that Amazon's price beat everyone's by several hundred dollars.  At the time, that was most important until we realize just how much better the picture quality is.  The TV works great in all lighting situations, at least in our house.  We have many different components and having 4 HDMI ports makes a big difference.  Playing video games with the kids is a blast!  The picture refresh speed is amazing, we have yet to come across any situation where we experience any "blur" or "spottiness" on the screen.  We bought the TV a month ago and I just discovered the picture-in-picture feature which is incredibly handy on football days :)  The kids played a video game while my husband could keep an eye on the scores.  When watching a movie there are several options to change the viewing which clears up the movie depending on what you are watching, for instance, we watched The Dark Knight on a different setting than we watched Horton Hears a Who without having to fiddle with the contrast, brightness and tint like we would have in the past.I can't say enough about this TV it is a beautiful unit, the features are amazing and it's an amzing high quality product.

Reviews.Title: TV is a 5; delivery is a 1
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Igo
Reviews.Content: Excellent set, works beautifully and as expected.  The two-man "white glove" delivery from Pilot was a one-man "dirty shoe" delivery, however.  The lone delivery man showed up 15 minutes before the scheduled "noon to four" delivery and did not call ahead 30 minutes in advance, saying that he was "in the area anyway" as an excuse.  Luckily, I was ready for him.He smelled heavily of cigarette smoke and left dirty footprints on my carpet that I will have to clean, and I need to air out the house in winter to get rid of the smell.  While I respect that he was willing to take the TV to our upstairs theater room on his own, I decided to help him carry it up so that the TV wouldn't be damaged on the way, or that he'd give up and I'd have a half-delivered TV on my stairs.  Pilot really needs to send two people to fulfill the "Amazon room of choice two man delivery" as listed on the work order.TV gets a 5; delivery gets a 1.  Amazon needs a new freight company that takes customer service seriously and respects the cleanliness of customer homes.

Reviews.Title: So far very happy
Reviews.Author: Average Joe "Average Joe"
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV on January 2nd 2009.  So far it was easy to set up, delivery was great, got it 5 days and the white glove service was fine. I had read a few bad reviews of that service but in Denver it was fine. They called a couple days ahead to schedule delivery.  They delivered it within the 4 hour window they provided, two guys brought it into the home, removed it from the box, put it on our entertainment center, plugged it in, I helped with the wiring to the cable box and DVD player.  They turned it on, checked to make sure it got tv reception, offered to take the box, you sign some paper work and done.  For this size TV it was much better than buying an item at the store and having to figure out if or how it will fit in our car.As far as the TV, it is beautiful.  I can't really say how it compares to the other brands.  I think there are a lot of good technically oriented reviews on Amazon and Cnet that can help with that.  I was looking mainly at the Sony W series, and the Samsung 750 in addition to this one.  I at least looked at the other brands but they all seemed to be a half step below the Sony and Samsung.  It probably is just based on marketing that I have that impression than on real facts.For my decision, the only important differences between the Sony and Samsung were the matte of the screen and the number of reviews.  There are so many people that have reviewed the Samsung 650 on the site vs any other brand or model of Samsung that I decided these at least had sold a ton and the reviews were still almost the same on average as the Sony.The TV does sit in a room with a lot of windows so glare was a bit of a concern with me.  Now that it is in the room, the colors of the screen are so bright, the glare is not distracting, and at night, the color is incredible, but again, I'm not that picky.  It was so great watching the bowl games and playoff games on this TV.  One other thing I noticed is non HD channels don't look any worse on this TV than our 3 year old 40" LCD.  They may have actually been a little better and they actually were ok to watch.At this time, I haven't messed with setting up the options on the Samsung so I can't comment on any of that, just first impressions.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and Great Service
Reviews.Author: Rung
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in September from Amazon with more than a slight trepidation of ordering such an item online and having it shipped to me.  The delivery service company called me to schedule a time to deliver the TV.  When they delivered it, they brought it into my apartment, took it out of the box, and plugged it in to ensure it was still working.  Since then. the TV has gone through an apartment move and it's come out picture perfect.I'm definitely no videophile who will notice the minute differences between all of the various settings that the TV allows. However, I will say that I'm greatly pleased with the picture quality and number of inputs.  I'm sure it will last me for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV at excellent price
Reviews.Author: Sonny "TV Addict"
Reviews.Content: Touch of red is not at all distraction, infact adds to the looks.Behaves and displays as mentioned in CNET review as well as Home Theatre mag review. I am very happy with the TV.Need one more TV for basement and replace my old home theatre. Looking for 7.1 channel ones.Happy shopping :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Doneda Allen
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on which HDTV is the best value for the money.  This specific set was ranked very high --- and coupled with Amazon.com's great price and service --- we are very happy with it.  I was a little concerned about the Touch of Color feature but it is quite subtle and does lend a bit of class (is that possible with a TV?) to the set.The picture is extremely good and it is easy to set up and use.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase
Reviews.Author: D. Valle
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting since July to buy this LCD. It was definetly worth every click I used to read these reviews, now here I am telling you this TV is awesome. Watching Blue Ray discs is the best picture I have ever seen. I got it just in time for the Lakers Vs Boston game on Dec 25th, and it was a hit with my friends. 1881.00 on Dec 18th delivered Dec 24th. Call CEVA to make the actual appointment once they get it. Search CEVA in these reviews and you will find the 800 number, then have the operator transfer you to their nearest wherehouse (mine Torrance) for appointment scheduling.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dene
Reviews.Content: Out of the box this thing rocks.  I have not calibrated it yet thru AVS forums and I am not sure that I will.  The brick and mortar stores can't compete with Amazon's free ship, no tax, and a considerably lower price to start off.  The white glove delivery was great.  Amazon was awesome to deal with as well.  120hz is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: I MAY NEVER LEAVE THE HOUSE AGAIN!
Reviews.Author: C. Smith "Southern Boy"
Reviews.Content: After exhaustive research and comparison, I chose this TV to lead the way into my HD experience. It was delivered to my home about a month ago and all I can say is HOLY MACKEREL! The picture is simply incredible. I have made only a few minor tweaks to the settings because it really doesn't need much. Right out of the box, it wows with deep blacks, rich colors and unbelievable contrast. I have read several opinions on the screen being more reflective than other LCDs. While that is true, it's also what gives the 650 unsurpassed picture quality. That's a trade I'm willing to make. In short, I wouldn't change a thing. The Samsung LN52A650 has more than surpassed my lofty expectations! Bring on the bowl games!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't Be Happier
Reviews.Author: John Cook
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for 10 days now.  I researched a lot of different TVs and looked into both plasma and LCD technology.  I finally settled on this model as the best bang for the buck.And I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  The picture is simply amazing.  It has a good number of inputs, the optical output works great for my non-HDMI surround receiver and my PC even looks very nice hooked up to the TV.One nice touch that I hadn't considered was that the stand swivels.  Our TV sits in a corner stand and this is useful if we are curled up on the couch to watch a movie.I tried the InfoLink and it is a completely useless feature, but that's OK.  I just don't use it.Amazon beat their own shipping estimate by several days.  I helped the delivery person carry the LCD into the house - this TV is 100 pounds lighter than our old 32" tube TV!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, fantastic price.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: Amazon had the best price we've seen anywhere on the Samsung LN52A650, at least $300 less than other retailers sale price. Free delivery was fine, not "white glove" as Amazon claims. The man who delivered came alone after I told him on the phone I did not want them to set up the TV. He really should have had a second person just to help move the TV from the freight truck into my home, he was an older gentleman and the truck was pretty high off the ground, I was nervous as he slid it off the truck onto the ground. But, it finally did make it safely into the house.The TV itself is awesome, fantastic picture quality. Standard definition TV does look a bit grainy, but this TV shines with high def. We watched the Planet Earth DVD's on our new TV...they are spectacular. Definitely the best quality for price for a television of this size. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV EVER
Reviews.Author: Dorothy J. Marcott
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine that any improvement could be made in the series 7 or 8 tv's. This tv is amazing!  Even before I connected HD the picture was mind blowing. You won't be disappointed with this LCD TV,You don't need to worry about white glove delivery.  The carton is very user friendly, it comes apart at the bottom and one person can unpack it easy.  Only one person showed up to set it up so I had to help him lift it into position. It's light, you and your wife can lift it.Buy it at "Abe's of Maine" and you can get a free wall mount. For your next LCD TV.  You will buy another one after you see what a good TV samsung makes.

Reviews.Title: The best TV so far I have seen in the market
Reviews.Author: Harish Mundre
