The people were friendly, and worked hard to get me the TV.  I was a little frustrated because I couldn't take off work so I missed them a time or two, but in all reality I had the TV less than a week after I ordered it.  I must admit I was a little impatient, but they were great, brought the TV in, let me check it to make sure everything was good, put it on the console for me, and even took the box!Bottom line: GREAT TV and Great Experience.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Ed Crenshaw
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV, so we have very little with which to compare it, but we're very pleased with it. The picture is really great. We use it in a room with quite a bit of light, with no loss of quality. The remote control works something like an iPod click wheel, but without quite the same degree of responsiveness. Sound is OK. Not all of the channels were automatically selected for the channel list. That's not really a problem since we have a Comcast HD DVR and rarely watch live TV, so we use the cable box for channel selection. I certainly have no regrets about the purchase.

Reviews.Title: So far so great !
Reviews.Author: A. Neubauer
Reviews.Content: After weeks of window shopping and internet research, I found this set to be the best. Performance and value 2nd to none(well if you purchase at Amazon of course!)The features are great; pictures amazing. I guess some people don't like the reflection from the screen. I didn't notice much of a differance from my old lcd projection set. FYI  when you order this set, download the lastest firmware from Samsung.com(simply load it on a jump drive and follow their instructions) Also if your interested in a great deal on a warranty check out DTV Express [...]Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: First thing I said was WOW!
Reviews.Author: BJEZ "Mech E"
Reviews.Content: It was like the commercial with even the flea saying WOW.  We went from a 32" LCD to the SAMSUNG 52".  The picture quality in HD is amazing.  The set was easy to hook up, I like the locations of the input jacks.  Everything came up the first time.  Even viewing stills from my digital is simple and awesome quality.  Xbox games are like being in a movie, figures are almost life size. The internal speakers have good sound quality.  The set itself is not that heavy, but recommend two people to lift it because of the size.  It's aesthetic appearance is very pleasing also. The price was, at the time, at least $300 less than the closest competitor.

Reviews.Title: Simply Stunning
Reviews.Author: M. F. Ward
Reviews.Content: This product has the WOW factor straight from the box, It has a cool bezel and the picture quality is 2nd to none. Although I use a Receiver to interface to the TV and only use 1 HDMI connector the expansive I/O on this TV is impressive. I would have no hesitation in recommending this product to  friends. The contrast ratio and white and black levels are very good so if you want to enjoy the Theatre experience then this product will get you there.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Hiatt "Imagination Innovator"
Reviews.Content: I just ordered this new HD 1080p TV and I love it!!! It had extremely fast shipping, nothing wrong with it when it arrived!!  The only concern I had whne I got it was the reflection off the windows since i have windows surrounding my living room.  It does reflect quite a bit of light, but when I close one of my main windows it reflects from even just a little bit, it's  just fine.  I mean, what TV doesn't reflect??  That's just the nature of the beast and I'm sure it's still better than a plasma.  But, I have it wall mounted.  Also, if you wall mount with an extending arm (like I do) just make sure you get one that will support the weight because I got a model that just does carry the weight and I have to angle the arm a little because the TV is heavier on the "input" side on the back of the TV.  Just make sure your "wall mount arm" is mainly on that side to support the weight, or your TV will be crooked.  I learned this the hard way and had mounted the TV, then had to redo it all because my wall mount arm was originating on the other side and it threw off the balance.  Other than that...it's great now and I love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Fantastic Service
Reviews.Author: B. Bolivar "bboliv"
Reviews.Content: As many have stated, this TV is excellent.  I havent's calibrated t yet, so I imagine it will only get better. For those concerned, the Touch of Color looks great, and is well done.  I can't write enough about Amazon's customer service and support.  I originally purchased the 46inch version of this TV, processed a price match when the price dropped on the site, and was then allowed 2 weeks later to exchange it for the 52inch version(without having the original box) for only a small shipping charge.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture But After 1 year
Reviews.Author: SMB
Reviews.Content: TV was purchased on 07-15-08 and is used lightly only for cable and DVD viewing.  Sixteen days(16) after the initial warranty expired (thank goodness I purchased an extended warranty in June) the TV did what sounded like a power reset and died.  I am waiting for the repair folks to examine it, but it looks like planned obsolescence to me.  I will post another review after I talk to the repair folks.  It was great, while it lasted.It took three weeks and numerous phone calls to get the TV fixed.  The power board, that looks similar to the motherboard on a computer had to be replaced.  Total cost zero, due to the service agreement, but without it would have been about $350.00.  Picture is back to normal and just beautiful.  Service is somewhat lacking.If I had to do it all over again I might have gotten a Sony. Lets see if this repair lasts!

Reviews.Title: Samsung doesn't last
Reviews.Author: N. Murray "Big Nance"
Reviews.Content: I bought a 52" Samsung TV one year and 2 months ago. I had to wait until the cabinet people finished the cabinets before I could set it up so I have only used it for 11 months. Recently, a big red line has developed - from top to bottom about 3" across. I called Samsung and offered to show the receipt for the cabintry as proof that I have not used their product for an entire year (I don't watch that much TV anyway) and they said sorry. The repairman I spoke to said that the problem I was describing was so expensive to fix I may as well buy a new TV. Believe me, it will not be a Samsung. Buy a brand that is slated to last more than a year. Poor poor porduct.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" LCD 1080p television
Reviews.Author: B. D. Brown
Reviews.Content: This TV is wonderful! It's my first wide-screen. Price was a major concern, but Amazon's free "white glove" delivery service was the clincher. The TV is infinitely adjustable. There's a menu for everything. Example: The factory adjustments are near perfect, but if you like cooler/warmer colors, etc., you've got them with a simple menu setting. I have two minor complaints: 1) The onboard sound system is marginal. (You were going to connect to a Home Theater sound system, weren't you?) ...and... 2) The user's manual is too thick and overly complicated.

Reviews.Title: Love this set!
Reviews.Author: T. Hanrahan
Reviews.Content: I got this set about two weeks ago.  Our first big screen LCD, and it's terrific.  Great price on Amazon, and easy delivery.I looked around at a lot of screens in this size range, and was planing to buy the Sony XBR4 when I read great reviews of this Samsung model and saw it at BB.  Picture is fabulous, and price is lots less than Sony.  I was wondering how the red "Touch of Color" in the frame would look, but it's not noticeable at all most of the time, and it adds a bit of design interest in bright light.Lots of ways to adjust the picture and sound, and I don't understand all the possible picture adjustments so I've left the esoteric ones ("gamma"???) alone.  You can select several "entertainment" modes with one click.  "Sports" and "games" make the picture brighter; "cinema" reduces the brightness and the makes the sound fuller.  There's probably a way to get that sound quality in other settings, but I haven't figured that out.For movies, a good sound system would help.  The speakers are ok but not different from wnay other TV speakers.The remote control has all sorts of buttons, and the only thing I'm not crazy about is the iPod-like wheel for scrolling through menu items.We have this set up with a Verizon FIOS system.  HD picture is gorgeous, especially for sports.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" 650 LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Yoitsandy
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture and good sound. Spectacular with Blu-ray. Had one episode of shutting itself off, but after updating software (which is easy) no further incidents. Also, looks great in the room. Amazon had great white glove deliver, fast delivery, unpacked TV and set-up on my stand and were very courteous.Also, Amazon also credited my account for a price drop within 30 days of sale.

Reviews.Title: Stunning picture - couldn't be more pleased
Reviews.Author: Thornhill
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung LN52A650 1.5 months ago as soon as I saw that there was a firmware patch for the shut-off issue. We started experiencing the shut-off issue a couple of days after receiving the TV. I installed the patch and have not had the problem again since. (It's been 4 weeks since the patch.) The picture quality is fantastic. The local cable company HD service is 1080i and the picture is excellent. With Blu-ray discs the picture is stunning. We also use it for game play with a Playstation 3 and Wii. Works flawlessly and I have not seen a single hint of ghosting even with the fastest action games. I'm very pleased with the purchse, the Amazon price, and in-home delivery.

Reviews.Title: A very nice LCD in the market.
Reviews.Author: Luke Burri "MagicJack"
Reviews.Content: I have received this LCD 3 days ago and wanted to share my experience here. This is very nice and spectacular LCD available in the market. I have did a lot of research before buying this and compared with sony and sharp. I don't remember how many times I visited BestBuy to see the differnece between these 3 TVs. Finally I have voted for this TV and I am very happy with it now. I would recommend this TV. I don't want to talk about the Technical Stuff but this is worth spending this much money and Amazon's purchase was a  breeze.I received this in 5 days after ordering.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable Television
Reviews.Author: J. Ray
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. The large amount of picture adjustment options makes it possible to tweak out a picture that meets just about anyones standards.  I love the TOC bezel, as it goes well with my living room.I have shopped around for months looking at HD-TV's and this model has more than met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ted D. Pate "TDP"
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the TV.  It has a very clear picture and is all it was advertised to be.  The ordering process was simple and the TV was delivered within a week of ordering.

Reviews.Title: Best LCD on the Market
Reviews.Author: Kevin Burke "Jerseyshore"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN52A650 52-inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of Color .  I've always wanted a LCD TV, and I finally got the go-ahead fom my wife.  After weeks of research, and input from LCD owners, I found what I wanted. This TV is AWESUM!!!!!  The picture, and bezel design are first class. I hooked up my Bose sound-system and away I went. Friends come over to the house and this TV instantly catch's their eyes.  The glossy finish is well worth the choice, even though the glare can be annoying.  The colors on this type of screen far outshine the matte finish screen on different models. And since I really don't watch TV during the day, the issue was a small one.  If your looking for a top-notch LCD TV, then this should be your first consideration.  Shop around for a good price, since prices on any LCD TV vary greatly.  I went with Amazon for this purchase, and from ordering to delivery, everything went VERY smoothly.  The price was great and the shipping was fast.  Its a leap of faith ordering anything on-line, but I found that Amazon was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: I'm returning it
Reviews.Author: Aaron Cohen
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV based upon the excellent Consumer Reports reviews, but am returning it after 27 days because the picture quality with Standard Definition Cable and DVD is so poor as to be unwatchable, even though my Digital Cable box and DVD are both connected to the TV via HDMI.When viewing true HD content from the Digital Cable box the picture *does* look great on this set - vivid colors, acceptable motion (though not as good as CRT or Plasma).  Similarly, Enhanced Definition content from the DVD looks great too.But, the plain fact of the matter is that most Cable content is 480i and many of my DVDs aren't Enhanced Definition, and it is completely unacceptable to me that 480i programming on this fancy new HD set performs far worse than it did on my 10-year-old 36" Sony Wega Trinton, which I stupidly gave away to a friend when buying this set.The SD picture problems include: edge outlines around objects on screen, a grainy picture, artifacts in more-distant objects on the screen, and motion artifacts.I tried to resolve the problem with the cable company, and went through 3 cable boxes, 2 HDMI cables, the 3 HDMI ports on the TV, 1 visit from a Tech with the cable company, many tweaks to the cable box settings, 2 calls to Samsung Support, and hours and hours of tweaking the TV picture settings.  Nothing gave me a substantially better picture for SD cable content.So, I decided that I'd had enough, and since my 30-day return period hasn't expired, I'm ditching this set, and plan on buying the top Consumer Reports rated Plasma in hope of a more-satisfactory viewing experience.

Reviews.Title: great picture, but...
Reviews.Author: Mitchell Gertz
Reviews.Content: I carefully researched TVs and finally decided on  Samsung. I ordered it on 2/28/09 and it arrived exactly on time on 3/6/09. Amazon's ordering process was very easy. It was delivered by CEVA Logistics. They did a great job bringing it in, unpacking it, and making sure it was undamaged and worked. The set up was very easy using an HDMI cable. The menus are easy to navigate and the picture was eye-popping on HD channels.Unfortunately, as a few others have mentioned, this TV gives off interference of some kind that interferes with the infra-red signal on the cable box remote; so much so that it's not useable  (Samsung's remote works fine, but you really don't use it much with a cable hook up). I called Samsung's 800 number. They were very helpful, but couldn't provide a fix. They then set up a time to have one of their service techs come out and try to help. They came out, tried, but currently, there is no solution for this problem. My cable company is RCN and I'm in the Boston, MA area. Samsung said they are working on a solution, though.I also noticed a couple of other "cons". Occasionally, there is a static flash when you change channels, instead of the usual momentary black screen. Also, this TV has a pic-in pic function, but the other picture (the sub-picture) has to be from an analog signal, so this function is pretty much useless, unless you're hooked up to an antenna also. In other words, this TV has only one built in tuner, which doesn't allow both pictures (main and sub-picture) to come from the same source. One must be from an external antenna and the other can be from an HDMI, Component, or PC input. And if you use closed captioning, it is very clumsy to turn on if your TV is hooked up using an HDMI cable because this setup bypasses the TV's tuner where cc is decoded. To use it, you have to shut the cable box off, while leaving the TV on, open the cable box menu, enable cc, then turn the cable box back on again. This is probably true for any TV set up with an HDMI cable.Also, under certain conditions, glare can be a bit noticeable, say, when you are watching during the day, in a light room,  and the picture is a night seen. Even at maximum brightness, the glare wins out during a dark seen.So, because of all this, I am returning this TV. Probably going to look at a Sony Bravia. I'm very disappointed. I think Samsung's quality control needs some quality control. Someone else mentioned that Samsung TVs leave the factory with about an 8% defect rate, while Sony's is about 1%-2%.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy Customer

Reviews.Content: Samsung LN52A650 52-inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of ColorI've had this television for 2.5 weeks now. As everyone has said shipping with CEVA was a breeze. The television is very nice. I have a PS3 attached and standard/bluray dvds are simply stunning. My HD channels look fantastic. I find myself trying to find more HD content. Reviews.Title: Another Samsung Casualty
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: We bought LN52A650A 52" Samsung LCD TV for Christmas in December of 2008. We have never purchased a Samsung product and were surprised that Consumer Reports rated this TV as number !. We researched this product endlessly and saw little to no negative reviews. We bought the TV from Amazon, had great delivery and set up service and loved the tv until now (which is 16 months later). In February 2010, just after it's warrenty period ended, (during Superbowl!!) we had an episode of the TV turning itself on and off once or twice. We thought it was the DVR. IT stopped and we didn't think too much of it.  For the past 3 days (now April, 2010) we can barely keep the TV on because it is constantly powering off and on and, of course, it's now hocky play off time.  We had to connect our 3 year old 19" REFURBISHED Magnavox LCD that we use in our kitchen to our living room cable. It has been one of the most reliable tv's we have ever had.  Thank you, PHILIPS. So much for high end!We called Samsung who has set up a repair technician to call us back and will post results after we deal with them. We went on this website tonight to research whether or not anyone else had this problem and are appalled at how many customers have had the same issue and their lack of success dealing with Samsung!  Bottom line, DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT.  No TV that costs as much as we paid for it should have these problems.

Reviews.Title: Right Choice.

Reviews.Content: I don't know how helpful a review of a product at this time when it is replaced by new product, But I was helped by tons of review of this TV right here on Amazon.com. Reviews.Title: Tv only worked for 41 days
Reviews.Author: J. C. Hertzler
Reviews.Content: We loved our Samsung LN52A650.  The picture was all we expected and more.  On the 41st day the sound icon came on all by itself, and turned the sound off.  We would turn it back up, and it would again turn itself off.  When this was happening we were unable to turn the tv off without unplugging it.  After three service calls they finally replaced the main board and another componet.  Now working, but I'm worried it could happen again.  Would never recommend this tv to others.

Reviews.Title: A Great Way to Keep the Kids Home
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My sons had been watching movies/TV on HDTV at friends' houses for several years and had been begging for months for one of their own.  After extensive research which showed almost universal love of this Samsung LCD HDTV, we finally broke down and bought one.  Both of my sons say that the picture has much better processing than on other flat screen HDTVs they have viewed.  There is no noticeable blurring because of the 120hz refresh rate.  The colors are clear and true.  Even watching DVDs on a PS2 looks a million times better.  We are seeing details in old DVDs that none of us ever noticed even in the theater.  I can't imagine how blown away we will be when the BluRay player arrives next week.  We are having no trouble seeing everything even in a room with a wall of floor to ceiling windows.  There is almost a 180 degree viewing angle which means a huge crowd can watch.  My audiophile husband is happy with the sound.It was definitely a Plug & Play set up.  It has lots of slots for connections.  I just needed inexpensive 4' HDMI 1.3 cables.  I had done a great deal of research on them as well.  We were watching a movie within minutes of getting it delivered.What truly blew me away was my husband with no depth perception saying that he could better distinguish depth on the TV than he could in real life.I believe that I now have the house where the teenagers want to congregate to watch movies.  They seem to believe that there is no need for the movie theater or any other viewing choices anymore.  It is nice for me so I can be sure that they are in a safe environment and not making poor choices.

Reviews.Title: Superb TV after 2.5 years of viewing
Reviews.Author: Adam Scott
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV in the summer of 2009. It is on multiple hours everyday, whether DVDs or Nickelodeon, it still looks great. I still remember the first day watching an episode of Lost and was so distracted by the clarity that I wasn't paying attention to the plot.A huge plus is NO electronic buzzing or hiss like our previous Phillips LCD set. (I have very sensitive ears - I can tell if the Phillips TV is turned on in the basement while sitting upstairs. It drives me crazy...) I'm looking to get a new LED set for our bedroom, and this is one of my biggest fears - buying another buzzing TV set!I am an avid gamer, but I have not connected gaming systems to this TV. Only satellite TV and DVDs (including BluRay).I'm not a diehard videophile, but I am very distracted by little annoyances like poor light distribution, flashing, ghosting, etc. I have NEVER noticed anything like that on this TV.Great job, Samsung.

I only gave it one star because the system wouldn't let me give it Zero stars.

Reviews.Title: BEST AMAZON.COM PURCHASE EVER

Reviews.Title: Owned one of these for over 3 years -- no issues
Reviews.Author: cured
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these TVs back in 2008 when 120Hz was the new thing and I am happy to report I have no desire to replace this TV anytime soon.The TV is light and pretty slim. If it weren't for the sheer size of it, I'd say one person could easily move this TV on their own. The swivel stand is a nice touch, allowing you to turn the TV easily.I could go into all of the specs for this TV but it's rather pointless. I've read that most TVs, if they do experience problems, experience them in the first year. I've had none with this TV. When I bought it, I also bought the screen calibration service from a Geek Squad type entity. They have a special device that attaches to the front of the TV and that device relays information to the laptop its connected to, which then tells the technician what to adjust to make the picture as good as possible. A few tweaks and it was done and the colors were much more vibrant.3 years later and this TV is still going strong. Samsung makes great displays at competitive prices and I couldn't be happier, nor do I have any envy for those with 240Hz 3D LED TVs. This suits everyone in the house just fine. I'd recommend this TV if it can be had on the cheap but otherwise I'd recommend Samsung as a trusted TV brand.

Reviews.Title: Was Good While It Lasted
Reviews.Author: J. Onofrio
Reviews.Content: Although the LN2A650 is discontinued, there are newer generations of Samsung TV's that still get pretty good ratings.  I have no reason to believe that their design and/or build quality is worth your time, money, and piece of mind.  Don't be fooled like I was...I have not owned any other Samsung products and was reluctant to purchase a Samsung TV to begin with, but it came highly rated from reputable consumer and electronics evaluators (i.e. CR, CNET, etc) for picture quality, adjustability, and the like.  On October 21, 2008, I was excited to finally be getting rid of my 10 year old 32" tube and decided to go for the then-well regarded LN52A650.  I enjoyed it thoroughly with my 7.1 surround sound system, HD cable channels, PS3 games, and Blu-ray discs.  Then on May 27, 2010, it began rapidly cycling on/off for no apparent reason.A little online research reveals that this has not been an isolated problem.  After the TV began cycling on/off, I tried various fixes as directed by Samsung (all to no avail): upgraded the firmware, unplugged it for 30 seconds, removed it from the surge protector and plugged directly into wall outlet, etc.  They offered to cover the cost of the replacement of the capacitor, but would not cover anything else. (As a side note, the capacitor was not an issue with my TV in particular, but had been an issue with other Samsung TV's.)Samsung tech support, customer service, and repair people were all very friendly, but that does not make up for the fact that the TV was out of warranty and they weren't inclined to do anything about it.  The earliest appointment was two weeks out and the window was an utterly inconvenient seven hours.  I took a day off from work, paid $95 for the repair guy to spend no more than 15 minutes with the TV, before I was informed that it needed the LCD panel replaced because of the backlight overloading.  The panel with labor would cost nearly a grand and it would take at least a week for the part to ship from California.  He emphasized that this LCD replacement panel is "popular" and might be on back order.  Even if I were to do the repair there is no guarantee that I wouldn't have the same problem again.It is sad that the reliability with these TV's has been so bad.  The repair guy acknowledged that they do give him a fair amount of job security.  He also noted that most people choose to buy a new TV rather than have it fixed.  It is even more disappointing that Samsung doesn't stand behind their products more -- there is clearly an issue with many of their TV's (almost seems like they're following the old Toyota play book).I guess if I had less faith in Samsung from the start, I'd have gotten an extended warranty.  I just thought they had better credibility after having done all of my research before the big purchase.  Now all I'm left with is a $2,000 paperweight and the solace of knowing that as the "go-to guy" for all things electronics with my family and friends that I can effectively prevent a few others from purchasing Samsung products in the future.

Reviews.Title: Might not be good for gamers...
Reviews.Author: M. Millner "MM"
Reviews.Content: I have no problems with the picture while watching regular programming or movies. The picture is absolutely great for that. I'm a big COD gamer and started noticing a difference immediately. I was gaming on my Mitsubishi rear projection before I switched to this and was straight up murdering people on COD. My kill:death ratio was well over 1 and after switching the television I noticed a huge difference. It always seemed like I was a step behind everyone else in the game and my kill:death ratio quickly dropped below 1. I eventually went back to my old TV and things are back to normal again. I tested the lag using Rockband 2 on the Samsung TV and the first results were in the neighborhood of 70ms. I adjusted the TV to the gaming setting and that brought my numbers down to around 35ms, but knowing that my Mitsubishi is a 0ms lag I can't resist staying on that TV.

Reviews.Title: A great TV that adds a touch of elegance to any room
Reviews.Author: buru buru piggu
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for 6 months now and I continue to be impressed by its sheer size and elegance. The Touch of Color is subtle, but it adds a touch of class to the room. At 56", this TV is dominating. Make no mistake, this will be the center of attention in any room you put it in. When friends come over, their immediate reaction is usually a curse word because of the sheer massiveness of the TV.The LN52A650 is the second Samsung in my house (after the 46" in the living room) and my third LCD TV purchase overall. I heartily recommend the Samsung brand of TVs over other manufacturers for the price to performance ratio and for a number of design innovations. Both my Samsungs have a swivel base which is very helpful when accessing the back panel to plug in other devices. I am surprised by just how many other brands do not have this simple design (including Sony Bravia's, Panasonic, Olevia, ViewSonic).Pros:----- attractive and BIG! It's beautiful every time I look at it.- elegance of contours and simplicity of design: TV is completely buttonless. Instead, front right side has touch sensitive controls that detect human contact, like the PS3 power button. Touching it with a pen, or other object won't activate it.- large number of ports and plugs, so you'll very likely have more than you need for all your devices. 4 HDMI ports- Ethernet port for weather updates, stock ticker, and news headlines that overlay on the screen, though I don't use this at all, since I have PCs and Macs.- nicely designed remote that is sturdy, shiny, and big buttons. Not nearly as confusing as other remotes. At 10 inches tall, the buttons are given plenty of breathing room, instead of being all squished up on a smaller surface. Has a motion sensor inside, so the buttons light up when moved -- really helpful in a dark room.- remote battery cover is tethered, so you can't lose it! A small detail, but a very smart design innovation that speaks to the level of care Samsung devoted to this product.- swivel base allows easy access to ports, a design many TVs lackCons----- AutoMotion Plus not very useful and is really just a marketing gimmick. It makes everything look artificial, though when turned on for some games, they do look better. Don't use for movies, unless you want to wash away that look of film and all the care directors put into making a film look the way it looks.- onscreen menus could've been made simpler. For example, turning on and off the AutoMotion requires at least 3 menus because it is buried.Not many cons I can think of. This is a beautiful product and I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good TV but.....
Reviews.Author: Chad D. Hummel
Reviews.Content: This is a very good TV with the exception of the tv controls on the tv itself. There are no buttons, its a smooth panel....black which blends in with the side of the TV. You would have to have an extremely bright lit room to see them. I have often thought I had turned the tv off and come home from work  to see it was on  even after 2 weeks  away for work then come home to find it never shut off. It's quite annoying and  can not think of a reason they would design it like that. It's slow to respond to shutting it off or turning it on almost like a computer waiting for the operating system to load. The tv picture itself is outstanding I have not noticed a glare problem as some have said.

Reviews.Content: Right out of the box this tv is magnificent.  Colors vivid, sports are terrific.  Ceva delivery was great.  They even called me 45 mins. before they would be at my house so I could leave work to meet them instead of waiting for 2-3 hrs.  Brought it in, unboxed it, set it up, plugged it in - were done in 10 minutes. Have had it a month and so far couldn't be happier.  Only issue, 3 days after I bought it, BB had it on sale for 200 less.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased, but I have some questions...

Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture is awesome.  It's almost too awesome. Reviews.Content: Delivered promptly, uncrated and tested by carrier in-home (a great Amazon service).  Purchased it predicated on other Amazon reviews, and boy were they right!!! Reviews.Content: I originally purchased a 50" Panasonic Vierra plasma and was happy (all the guys at bestbuy were raving about it). I went to another store just looking 2 weeks later and was blown away by the picture of the samsung 650 52". I immediatly returned the plasma and the sales guys thought I was crazy. I couldn't be happier with the Samsung. Must be the 120hz and automotion??Pro's: Crystal clear pictures when watching blue ray movies (i use hdmi cables). Makes you feel like your shooting it or almost like your watching it being filmed. Some people might not like it but I love it. Its all in the motion.Con's: Color is not as good as the plasma, but its very good.Overall: I think the picture is better on the plasma when watching sports on cable tv. Little more clear. But Hands down when watching blue ray the LCD wins by a mile. The plasma was very nice but I'm absolutely in love with my Samsung.This is just my personal opinion.

Reviews.Title: great television

Reviews.Content: im really happy with this tv. great picture and nice sound. lots of reviews complained about the sound quality and it not being loud enough. i sit about 10-12 feet away from the 52" model and only ever use 1/4 of the volume. picture is crystal clear and have yet to see any action blur with the 120hz. the info link is a cool feature if u have a ethernet cable to hook up to the back, you can check out weather, news, stock all while you watch your fav show. plenty of hdmi and other inputs, i have surround sound, dvd, xbox 360, playstation 2, wii, and super ninetndo all hooked up at once with room for more. as for the "touch of red"... i never even notice it so im not really sure why they even did it. over all it was a great buy i would get it again if i had to make the choice over again.

Reviews.Content: I researched this TV by reading reports from a major consumer magazine and the reviews in Amazon. I also looked at the TVs from Samsung in the local stores. But locally this model was very hard to find. I did find next model down in 52 inch and comparables in the smaller sizes.Several reviews said the picture was "stunning" or "spectacular". As I read in one review, it is like you are on the set watching the characters and action.Even our standard DVDs look much better than with our old LCD TV.Pros:Excellent picture from Sattelite, Standard DVD and Over-the-air sources.Simple setup and adjustments. There were minimal tweaks to set things up.(but then I only have it hooked up to my home theatre receiver and OTA cable).Cons:- slow to power on to picture, delays in picture appearing when changing channels or sources. (but not a major issue.- Screen is more reflective than most LCDSs I have seen but not as much as Plasma or CRT Tvs. The brightness of the picture does overcome this in my situation but I would check it out if you are using it in a very bright room.If I had to do it all over again I would definitely buy this TV.I bought it from Amazon and the price was much less than what I could find locally. The delivery went smoothly.

There are many more video adjustments available which is always welcomed and it has a better build quality.  You wont be unhappy with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Best HDTV in it's price range IMO
Reviews.Author: Aaron Ward
Reviews.Content: Well the picture is crystal clear. Now it's anoying to watch sdtv, now that I'm used to hdtv. The 120 Hz motion thing is cool for some things but some movies it's just wierd. Sometimes when panning in a movie the background looks jumpy and not smooth but some movies look incredible, I guess it depends on the way the movie was shot.I still don't regret buying this HDTV. The picture is amazing, the $1900 I paid was definately worth it even without the 120 Hz.

Reviews.Author: Rick E. Ruge "Read The Reviews"
Reviews.Content: I spent over 3 months agonizing over my $2000 52" LCD TV.  It was delivered about a month ago and I couldn't be happier. I live on a golf course with a large sunset to the west every night in the summer .. No problem.  Meaning that unless you have this baby pointed towards the sun it's awesome. I see the golfers 100 yards away watching the news on my TV.The only warning I have is my wife hated the "Red touch of color" until she actually saw it. It looks different in every location.  Most of the time you can't even see it. For us only when we open all the blinds in the evening and it's in the summer, we see the glow of red. It doesn't matter to me, but for the rest of you make sure you see it.

Reviews.Title: This TV is a must buy
Reviews.Author: Joseph H. Page "hackman"
Reviews.Content: Spent many days and lots of time researching and comparing various brands of LCD tv's.  I went with the Samsung LN650A and have been wowed ever sense.  I was a little worried about making such a large purchase from a on line vendor and shipper.  I ended up buying from Shop On Line Digital and paid with shipping 500/600 dollars cheaper than any other vendor.  AM Delivery even went through some extra effort to deliver so I could make a previous appointment.  I was impressed with both and would highly recommend anyone to check out the pricing from On Line Digital before you buy from anyone else.  Running the tv through a surround sound system is un believable!  Pop in the Eagles live from Melbourne sit back and prepare to be transfixed for the next couple of hours.  Sound and picture are difficult to put into words.  Samsung hit a home run with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Excellent viewing experience

Reviews.Content: This product has met or exceeded all of my expectations.  Delivery and set up were a breeze and we have not encountered any negative issues thusfar.  Picture looks good from all viewing angles.

With the refresh rate of 120Hz a standard DVD on a standard DVD player looks like blue ray. Some images are close to 3d. Best purchase I've made in many years.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650

Reviews.Content: Consumer Report ranks it very high and I totally agree.  Great pic and no problems.  If I were going to buy another TV it would be this same one

Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is stunning best I have ever had and with my soround sound system you would be hard pressed to beat it.I am very happy.Again the shipping co. unpacked it and plugged it in to make sure everything worked and service from Amazon.com was great.Thank You.  Ray

Amazon.com offered the best price (including delivery), and although I had never purchased such a large item through them before, I have made many purchases through them and have always been satisfied. The TV has excellent vibrant color makes you feel like your there.  My opinion best in the market. Arrived earlier than expected.

Reviews.Title: wow

Reviews.Title: great tv

Reviews.Content: After reviewing consumer reports and speaking with many friends and visiting local electronics store,we selected the Samsung LN52A650 TV. We chose to purchase it from Amazon as their price could not be beat. I scheduled delivery for a time convenient for me and the service was excellent. They arrived within the first 30 minutes of my scheduled delivery (no waiting all day), quickly unpacked the TV, plugged it in, hooked up the cable and tested it. The deliverers were in and out within 15 minutes. I have thoroughly enjoyed watching theater quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL TV
Reviews.Author: T. Waters
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for the family room. The picture looks fantastic with our HD satellite, Blue Rays & of course the REAL reason we bought it, my husband's XBOX 360. We mounted it on the wall and it looks GREAT.  There is a red tint to just the top & bottom of the TV (which I wasn't too crazy about), but, you can't really even see it unless your right by the TV. Alot of the other reviewers complained about the speakers, we used it for about a week without surround sound, the speakers sound fine.  As a bonus, you can also use the TV as a digital photo frame! We love this TV and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Product - Settings Are Cumbersome
Reviews.Author: WW "WW"
Reviews.Content: The picture is unbelievable!  We have U-Verse with HD and a $70 Sony DVD Player that up-converts to 1080.  Through both devices, the picture is amazing out of the box.  My only beef is small - there are many options for changing the picture, and while that is great in terms of providing flexibility, it also brings about complexity.  You'll have to research what others are doing and experiment.  Better yet, leave it as is and enjoy what comes standard.Delivery timline and services was extremely good.

Reviews.Title: Turned out to be as advertised - Nice Television
Reviews.Author: Milo
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple, the TV worked as advertised. The picture quality is excellent, although I was coming from a 10 year old projection TV, but nonetheless, the Samsung LN52A650 series shows better than friends who have purchased the Sony Bravia equivalent. I have HUGE windows in my viewing area, and there is significant glare when the TV is off, but when it turns on, the glare, amazingly enough gets reduced to almost "nothing", LCD's are so different than their predecessor projections. The only downside of this tv thus far is that my 10 year old projection had better sound quality. If you don't have a receiver and speaker system, don't expect the tv will provide movie quality sound...it's ok, but nothing special at all.

Reviews.Title: Everything is better than expected.
Reviews.Author: James W. Marsh Jr.
Reviews.Content: Purchased Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV , HDMI cable and surge suppressor. Each shipped from different locations. All got here when scheduled. Delivery of TV was excellent. Delivery people unpacked and placed on table. Driver would not take a tip, but his young helper did. Cable installers arrived two hours later. They brought wrong box and had to come back next day. They returned,made connections, turned on TV and I couldn't believe the picture. Perfect. Although the reputation of Amazon and their suppliers are rated the best, I was still apprehensive about making an online purchase. This because of my advanced age, the information I received at the big box stores and the cost. I was especially concered about the need of the TV needing calibration because  all the stores I visted had a costly installation and "calibration" fee.When needed, will do it again. Now if I ever get my other equipment connected right, I'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Keith H. Wooten
Reviews.Content: I researched this product for many months, visted all the major Electronic stores including technical specs and cost. This model was recommended as top model LCD by Consumer's Reports and they hit it the nail on the head. I could not be more please with the performance and styling. I replace a 2002 high definition(1080i) projection which with HDTV signal was just fine. In fact I was opting for a replace DLP just because of the low cost. I was more than satisfied with project performance but in my opinion but WOW with this model details came out that had not seen on my old set.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with Samsung LN52A650 and Amazon
Reviews.Author: Tie Flyer
Reviews.Content: This was a big purchase so I spent many weeks researching LCD TVs in general and the Samsung LN52A650 in particular.  I read reviews, looked at TVs side by side in the stores, and finally decided that the Samsung LN52A650 was the best 52-inch LCD on the market.  I was not disappointed.  The picture quality is even better than I expected.  5-Star all the way.  And this was my first large purchase from Amazon and they did not disappoint me either.  Best price.  Delivered one week before first scheduled.  White Glove service was great.  They delivered, unpacked, inspected, set up, and tested the TV before they left. I will surely buy from Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Great set
Reviews.Author: T.  Davis
Reviews.Content: This is a great set. My parents bought a LN52a550 and the sound was awful- my wife said unacceptable audio. I urged them to get a LN52a650 even though it was more. The audio was much better. The picture is great. Blacks are inky black- I liked it so much I got one. I like it more than my PN58a550.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Elias Finch "Ely"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV for about $750 less that we were able to find it at national electronics stores, and have been very pleased with the picture quality, and ease of use.  The red tint is very subtle.  Delivery service was also professional, and made set up very easy.  All and all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: R. Balling
Reviews.Content: This TV is great! It is the best I have ever owned.It is attractive, has a great picture and contrary to some reviews, I believe the sound is pretty good. I use a Samsung Home Theater for viewing all DVD and Bluray(using my Samsung Bluray)

Reviews.Title: 6 Stars
Reviews.Author: AA "unixace"
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short. This TV is AWESOME. If you're thinking of buying this TV or any version of it, go ahead and do it. Rest assured, you won't regret it. The picture quality is awesome. Even the compressed Dish network HD feed looks great. Who knew John Locke of Lost had that many wrinkles?The Infolink thing is completely useless. when connected to the internet, it gives you 3 things: Weather(which you can easily get from the internet or your cell phone), stock market data(yeah..the dow is down) and the news(breaking news, the dow is down). Plus, you can't update the firmware via the network like you can do on the Sony blu-ray DVD players. Don't waste your time connecting the TV to the internet.If you are planning on mounting this TV, make sure you connect the cables before you mount the TV. Once the TV is on the wall mount, it's really hard to connect cables without un-mounting it.Once you get this TV, you HAVE to get a blu-ray player. The sony blu-ray player you get at costco is pretty good. It's Anynet compatible. Anynet is some sort of a media device protocol that lets your DVD player talk to your TV. When I pop a DVD into my blu-ray player, it switches on the TV if it isn't on already and changes the TV to the right input source.WARNING: To people who're planning on mounting this TV: You'll need to remove the base before you can mount it. This is easier said than done. The screws are really deep and tight. Make sure you get a really long screwdriver for maximum torque. It took me 3 trips to home depot/target to find the right screw driver. This may seem like nitpicking but you can't imagine the frustration of having a wall mount all set up and then being unable to get the darn base out.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Design Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: Hector A. Barahona "H3CT1C"
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the picture quality when watching blu-ray movies. Its picture is better than Sony and it's less expensive too. My only complaint is that there is some motion judder but thats expected from a tv that runs on 120hz.

Reviews.Title: LN52A652-SAMSUNG
Reviews.Author: Alex A. Mamaril Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV model based on the ratings from Consumers report.  So far I am very happy with the results and this is my second HD TV.

Reviews.Title: Superb instrument!Absolutely a gorgeous picture
Reviews.Author: B. Johnston
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a gorgeous picture, with sound to match. Extensive capability for "tweaking" or fine-tuning available through easily accessed and understood menus. Many fine features not addressed in the product descriptions. Whole heartedly recommended for those who seek and demand excellence.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable Picture
Reviews.Author: B. Brookshire
Reviews.Content: Ive had the TV for a few weeks and still cannot believe the picture on this LCD.  It looks absolutely incredible.  The blacks are as blace as Ive seen on a LCD.  Combined with a good Blu-ray player and the picture is even more amazing.  I have no problems at all with the set.  Also, Amazons free delivery was awesome.  Anyone thinking about ordering a TV thru Amazon shouldnt worry.  Also, I probably saved between 600 - 700 dollars by not using the local big chain retail store.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Harriet Cohen
Reviews.Content: After tons of research, I decided on this one. The delivery was made quickly, safely and on time. Quality is crystal clear, and design is very clean and nice. It is rated # 1 by consumer reports (LCD category). I couldn't decided between LCD and Plasma, and after I chose this model, I am very satisfied. Every night, I feel like I am in a movie theater. Go with bigger screen. 52 inch is not that big.... I mean if you are not sure btw 42 and 52 inches.I also purchsed Sony soundbar, and am very satisfied with this also. If you ask me if sound system makes really difference, I would say yes. Get monster power surge, hdmi cable, and sound bar. And you are good to go. It is a whole new world now. I am really enjoyin it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" TV
Reviews.Author: Eric F. Schwarz
Reviews.Content: This TV was rated by many including Consumer Reports as the best 52 inch LCD HDTV in its class.  It meets all of our expectations with a glorious picture.  The service including shipment and delivery from Amazon was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding performance, excellent value
Reviews.Author: Cmdr Bill
Reviews.Content: Excellent viewing performance from BlueRay player connected to the HDMI port. When viewing ATSC signals, it automatically resizes the screen to fit the resolution of the channels, so it always maintain the correct aspect ratio. The built-in stereo speakers are decent. However, to enjoy the full benefit of BlueRay, one should always send the sound through a receiver with at least 5.1 channels. Value: it's $400 cheaper than Sony 52XBR6, but it matches the Sony on side-by-side comparisons on displaying BlueRay and ATSC. I don't know how they compare with displaying DVD through component or S-Video inputs, though. What I found was that playing DVD with the Sony PS3 connected through HDMI gives better result than playing DVD with a regular DVD player connected through component inputs. This is the case with this Samsung, but I don't know if the Sony 52XBR6 behaves similarly.

Reviews.Title: #1 Consumer Reports, #1on Amazon.com!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Colucci
Reviews.Content: Okay, simply put... this is the one to get. Yes, its not the cheapest TV available, but its by far not the most expensive either. It IS by far the #1 value television out there. (It has over 700 reviews and still has a full 5 star rating!)PROs:120hz refresh rate makes even old reruns look amazing/smooth. HD looks ridiculously good on this TV... Sharpness cannot be beat. Vibrant, balanced, beautiful colors (out of the box, no fine tuning required!), BLACK blacks-the contrast ratio is amazing on this model. Menu system is user-friendly and looks good as well.CONs:As with every LCD/Plasma, standard definition cable "noise" is slightly annoying, but the 120hz refresh helps to still make a great picture. Also, when naming separate inputs, you must choose from a strange list of preset names... Unless I haven't found it, you cannot name the inputs whatever you'd like... this is strange since you CAN name channels whatever you want.Bottom line: Your search is over. Amazon has the best price online, and most all the time free delivery and install (power up test only).

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52" 120Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Crystal Dekrey "Wheels"
Reviews.Content: This is one great TV, at times I feel like I'm actually there in the scene.Delivery time was seven days.  They didn't set the TV up only took it out of the box because the temp was too cold to turn it on.

Reviews.Title: Think: two dimensional hologram.
Reviews.Author: Mavendetout "El Gato:"
Reviews.Content: Granted this great Samsung 52" is hooked up to a Sony 1080p player with all the right cables. But the output speaks for itself. It is NO exaggeration to say that DVD's take on an eerily three-dimensional quality. Not just the new BD's and SD DVD that are created with electronic wizardry, or the usual animated items. I'm talking "The Crimson Pirate" with Burt Lancaster, or even home-made DVD's off of TCM! Seeing Fred Astaire walk across the room of the Thacakry Club in "Top Hat" and you just KNOW which tables are behind and in front of him, in crystal clarity--off of a home-made standard DVD of a TCM broadcast! Worked immediately out of the box, easy set up, amazing construction quality. I'd recommend pairing this with a good quality upscaling DVD player--preferably Blue Ray--and HDMI cables that support a 120hz refresh rate. The result? Blacks that are absolutley black and colors that are eye popping. Plasma may end up going the way of VHS.One last note. Notwithstanding the brilliance of the images, I'm beginning to suspect that we may hear or read some visual equivalent of the complaints we often hear about CD's sounding "metallic" or "artificial." In some respects, the images are almost TOO good, if one can imagine such a thing. This may particularly be the case with '40's films in black and white. An exmample: watching a standard DVD of "An American in Paris" with Gene Kelley, using a Sony BlueRay player with acknowledged fabulous upscaling capability. At times, certain scenes from this DVD--from 1953, I believe--looked amazingly as if it were videotape! I happened to enjoy the effect, but I can imagine that some purists might find this offputting. Hey. Nice to have such a problem, in many ways.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: E. Speir
Reviews.Content: We've had this TV for almost a year.  It is awesome.  You don't even notice the red unless you look for it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey G
Reviews.Content: Ordered the TV a few weeks back - the shipping company wrote down my phone number incorrectly and so shipping was delayed about a week.  I finally called to setup a delivery time.  The guys delivered it the next day, carried the TV around my house to the walkout basement for us - pretty nice of them...The TV is light for how big it is, I set it up myself, plugged it in with the HDMI cable ($4 on Amazon - just as good as the more expensive cables) and it was ready to go!  Yes - you turn it on, it takes 10 - 20 seconds before the picture comes up, but who cares?  If you need to watch TV that badly, you may have other issues?  The picture is great - well worth the money - I usually get buyer's remorse after purchases like this, but I am doing well! - well worth the $$$It does collect dust quite easily, but use the cloth the TV comes with, get it a little damp and follow the instrux to clean it, it cleans up quite nicely...  All in all - I am very happy with the TV!12/28/2010 - Update!  TV began the power cycling issue 2 months ago that this set is known for.  It worked well - loved it for the first year & 1/2, now it shuts off and turns back on at random times.  Not good for an expensive TV a year & 1/2 old...

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" LCD 650 series
Reviews.Author: Peter J. Dogoda "spleen"
Reviews.Content: Great product. Terrific picture. Only one problem, there is a small (.25" x .015") scratch right in the middle of the picture. Does not affect the picture but is a little annoying knowing that it is there.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: suldes "suldes"
Reviews.Content: Did my homework and made my decision based on Consumer Reports review ("best lcd tv we've ever tested..") and the opinions of 700 amazonians. This tv is just superb. Easy to set up and get going thanks to HDMI simplicity. Out of the box it was ready to go. Only ajustment I made was to knock down the sharpness from 10-8. Also, suggested to change the video setting from STANDARD to DYNAMIC. Also suggest when watching sports you choose one of the settings provided (SPORTS/game/cinema/standard) as basketball games can be really bright and the SPORTS setting tones is down a notch. But that's it! ***One last thing, don't be a sucker and buy the MONSTER CABLES. Look through the ratings here on AMAZON and you can get HDMI cables for less than $10. Same for optical cables. I did as advised by others and my picture is absolutely perfect. (Just get the highest rated cables, I think my were by MEDIABRIDGE). Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Love This TV
Reviews.Author: Eric Capasso
Reviews.Content: Consumer Reports best buy, sold me on this TV. I did a LOT of reviews on a LOT of LCD TV's wanting to get the best buy for my buck. The picture is great. I bought the Spyder 3TV calibration kit along with the DVE DVD and used both to get the best picture, and it works. The LCD out of the box has a good picture, but back light and brightness are set way to high. Alot of pre set setting had to be turned off and a minor adjustments to the color. HDMI cable box with HD shows or movied are good, as long as the sourse is not too over compressed. With a HDMI DVD player the movies are great, even kids movies look great. I agree with others about the remote control and you do get some reflection of surounding lighting on the screan, like lamps and bright outside lights from an unshaded window. It's not that bad, but keep in mind where you put your TV. Keep in mind when you buy a large LCD or any large TV that if your not going to use the HD or have a cable box with no HD the picture will be over compressed and look very bad. Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color This TV is an up-grade from an Olivia 37 inch, not as meny inputs as the Samsung, but has a great picture as well.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, terrible delivery company
Reviews.Author: Ronald W. Crawford
Reviews.Content: I have purchased 4 Samsung TV's from Amazon since Dec of 08. My most recent purchase was for my 87 year old Mother. A 52 inch Samsung. Since my first 3 purchases it appears that Amazon has changed delivery companies and are now working with Pilot delivery company.  In Dec my TV's were delivered to the house, set up, trash, boxes, ect. taken and the  TV hooked up, and operational. Now Pilot called and scheduled a delivery date, didn't show up or call, came the next afternoon and lied  about the previous schedule. Left all of the box trash in my Mothers den, and told her they were't allowed to turn the TV on, or hook it to the cable box. Won't be buying anything else from Amazon it this the the best delivery they now offer on big ticket items

Reviews.Title: our new tv
Reviews.Author: kathy morrow
Reviews.Content: We were evey happy with the delivery of our new Samsung 52 inch tv.  The guys that delivered our tv, were very very nice, clean and set up the tv, and made sure that it was hooked up properly and that everything worked.  They were great. The tv is super.  We have a 40 inch and a 52 inch.  We love them both.Kathy Morrow

Reviews.Title: Samsung A650
Reviews.Author: probe47
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching HDTV's and decided to purchase this Samsung model from Amazon.  It was a great decision.  The shipment was fast and efficient. The TV is everything I had hoped for, bright vibrant color, sharp picture and enough settings to satisfy anyone who feels the need to customize.  Tremendous product and great service

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: I've had the Samsung LN52A650 for 2 months now and I am very pleased. The picture is as good as Consumer Reports, CNET and most other buyers have reported it would be. HD cable picture is superb, as is Blu-Ray and my "old" DVD's are crisp and play with no problems. Sound quality is excellent and I have not experienced any glare problems when the lighting is bright in the room.  Comcast standard definition cable picture is acceptable for the majority of channels (but your spoiled once you see HD) and I have noticed that certain SD commercials and some SD broadcasts display a jittery white line at the top of the picture. Since this never occurs with HD broadcasts I would attribute it to older standard definition programming. The TV was delivered in a week after I ordered, but the so-called "white glove" treatment was somewhat of a joke. Don't get me wrong, the delivery person was courteous and respectful, but only 1 guy showed up with an inadequate hand truck, and I ended up helping him pack the TV from my driveway up the stairs to the 2nd floor family room. Had I not specifically requested his help in unpacking the TV, he would have bolted as soon as we got the box to the room. He wouldn't touch the TV once it we put it on the stand, and watched me as I got everything plugged in and turned it on. Overall, Amazon's "white glove delivery and set-up" gets a POOR rating. On the positive and most important side however, I've had absolutely no problems at all with this Samsung LN52A650 HDTV, it has a magnificent picture, great colors, easy remote, lots of adjustment capabilities, and gets a 5 star, 2 thumbs up rating.  Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: L. Norris
Reviews.Content: I did a LOT of research on TV's over the past couple of years.  Several have come along but where either too expensive or had major drawbacks that I didn't feel like living with.The technology got better and the price dropped finally enough for me to justify buying a large HDTV.  And I'm glad I waited.  This TV is excellent.We are still adjusting it but the colors are deep, the motion is flawless, and the TV has, so far, been a joy to have.  We where concerned about the glare but that really hasn't been an issue at all.  Much LESS glare than the CRT it replaced.  The room also has windows to the side of the TV and we where concerned about picture washout.  But that hasn't been the case at all.  Actually, we had to turn the brightness way down.  We where also concerned with what seemed like wimpy little speakers underneath the TV but they are also performing well and are plenty loud enough without distortion when we don't feel like turning on the whole home theater system.The only downside is the non-universal remote which really isn't an issue at all.FYI, we have digital cable tuner HD DVR, DVD (non-upconverting), Wii, and a MythTV DVR hooked into it and all look great.  Can't wait to try Blu-ray.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 2253BW
Reviews.Author: J. A. Phillips "TweakerXP"
Reviews.Content: OHHHHH BABY!!! This thing is just what the doctor ordered!!  HD is so life like. Now the shows we watched look so hokey it almost comical and the makeup on the actors. It's funny to see. I never knew that was going on till I got the big bad boy! My wife said "it too big"!!  Few days later..."I really love this tv".  :)Colors are brilliant! Setup a breeze! Installation a snap!  Hooking up DVD player and Tivo in a flash. I was watching HDTV in 10 minutes!!Would I buy this TV again!!  YES IN A HEARTBEAT!!!

Reviews.Title: Most Bang for your Buck
Reviews.Author: Bakowski
Reviews.Content: My setup is a dedicated home theater room with a 6.1 speaker setup.  Until I purchased this screen it was simply an extra living room with good sound.  With this one simple purchase I was able to transform my home theater experience from simply watching a movie on a TV in a living room to something more akin to a state-of-art movie theater.  Please be aware that the LN52A650, although it has speakers, obviously was not designed for superior sound.  You should match this screen with a dedicated home theater audio system to get any sort of movie house experience.I put the television through the ringer as far as video playback.  I played several Blu-Ray movies through my PS3 and the image quality was spectacular.  When I turned the Motion Plus on High for the Nightmare Before Christmas the transformation was unbelievable.  I feel I lack the words to describe the difference it made, but it made me feel as though I were walking inside the miniature stop motion universe.  If you have this screen try watching the Nightmare Before Christmas on Blu-Ray with the different Motion Plus settings and you will understand what the 120 Hz does for you.The HD-DVD playback over component video (1080i) out of my Xbox 360 looked as flawless as the Blu-Ray version of the movie over HDMI (1080p).  Standard unconverted DVDs played well on the screen, and looked better than they ever did before, but you can still tell it was not a HD formatted material.The color reproduction on the HD content is on par with the best HD CRT monitors.  The blacks truly do come through as true blacks without grey tones.  I was able to set the screen only 7 feet away from the viewing location without any visible pixels, so the resolution is very good.The digital tuner works well.  I was able to receive all the local channels in crystal clear digital and in many cases high def.  The picture quality of the HD content over the air is quite good.  I am very tempted to cancel my Dish Network subscription because of the quality of the local programming. Overall, if you are upgrading from a non 1080p screen this will be a mind blowing upgrade to your viewing experience.  I can think of no better way to increase your home movie watching experience especially when you consider the very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: W. Stonecipher "Stoney"
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv for the price.  The picture is crystal clear and blue-ray looks amazing.  Definitely plan on buying a suround sound sytem or sound bar if you are going to put this in a large room.  The two small speakers just will not fill a room.

Reviews.Title: Perfect experience
Reviews.Author: Warren H. Douglas
Reviews.Content: My first major purchase with Amazon and I could not be happier. Everything went fine after I ordered the Samsung 650-52.  Delivery was on time and the carrier was great to work with.  Would do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Jimmiejt
Reviews.Content: This tv has the sharpest,cleanest picture I've ever seen!Viewing in dynamic mode is incredible!I would highly recommend this product.The touch of red color is very nice,not overwhelming! Blueray DVD's look awesome,and if you use a Samsung blueray player,the Anynet feature syncs player to tv.Only need one remote! 52" 1080p LCD 650 series!BUY IT! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Perfect in nearly every way accept potential glare issues
Reviews.Author: Napoleon Lajoie
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality. Black levels are very good to near excellent. Only minor gripe is the glare issue. You can avoid this by having an articulating wall mount. Just tilt and position accordingly and glare issue will be reduced greatly.I do understand if this had a matte finish you would loose 10000 contrast ratio. Overall, a near perfect tv.The perfect tv...Pioneer elite pro-111fd for $2800 shipped as of March 2009

Reviews.Title: Basking in the warm glow of my new LCD TV
Reviews.Author: whitebreadtoast
Reviews.Content: I've had this a month and I don't have too much new to add but another vote for the beauty of this tv.  I had originally planned to go with another brand, but after comparing at Best Buy, I was really taken aback by this Samsung.  I tried to figure out how to wrangle my budget to buy this tv, and in the meantime did a lot of research online, just like everyone else.Through my research, I saved a ton of dough buying on Amazon - I could've almost bought 2 compared for the price Best Buy wanted.  I was a little nervous about delivery after reading some of the reviews but mine went flawlessly.  Delivery took 3 business days and the Pilot guys arrived an hour ahead of schedule.  They were quick, courteous and helpful in removing an gigantic old dinosaur of a CRT tv I had.I hooked up my cable, Wii, PS3, and PS2 and all look great - Blu-ray is totally amazing.My one and only minor gripe about the tv is that if you hook it up to a receiver via the optical audio out, it only outputs in 2 channel stereo.  That's not a huge deal for me because I have everything going to a receiver anyway, but it just seems like you could ideally hook up everything via HDMI directly to the tv - eliminating a lot of wire tangle - and then just output one cable to the stereo.  Anyway, it's not really that big of a deal for me, but maybe worth mentioning.All in all, love the tv and would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD Television
Reviews.Author: Kent W. Jobes
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research prior to making the purchase of this LCD television.  Checked with Consumer Reports and read other reviews to see how others liked their sets.  Decided to take the plunge and bought ours thru Amazon.  We were very pleased with the delivery and are totally satisfied with the quality of picture we are receiving.  It is an awesome picture and we are very pleased.....KWJ

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great Amazon experience
Reviews.Author: Hogheaven
Reviews.Content: Ordered my 650 on Jan 31st and it was delivered on Feb 5, 2009.  Much faster than I expected, and with no damage.  Easy to setup and an excellent picture.  I only wish my cable service had more HD channels.  That can be remedied however by simply switching to Direct TV.  I have a slight complaint with the sound however.  I'm used to a Sony DLP with 4 side speakers facing the room.  The Samsung only has two and they are at the botom of the cabinet.  The Samsung is not as clear as the Sony was, a minor complaint though.  With the HDMI connected Blu-Ray player, the picture is awesome, but the sound volume does not increase at all from a level of 50 to 100.  Have tried turning the volume up on the Sony Blu-Ray, as this is what is recommended in the trouble-shooting section of user manual, but to no avail.  This will also be remedied when I finally buy a 7.1 sound system.  As far as the Red TOC goes, it's non-existent, I wish I knew where to find it, I can't see it regardless of back-lighting. Not a big deal.  All in all, a great TV and well worth the[...] it cost me. [...]

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: James Miskel
Reviews.Content: I took delivery of this set two months ago and have been very pleased with picture quality, aesthetics and product generally.  Have use this set with blu-ray, with hi-def cable (Verizon Fios) and with a "Roku" adapter box to view Netflix on-demand titles directly on the set.  Exceedingly pleased in all cases - blu-ray content is breathtaking.  Five stars; money well spent at purchase price of ~$1,850.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV, Breathtaking HD quality
Reviews.Author: P. Kalia
Reviews.Content: After researching over a month for buying my first LCD TV, I finally decided to buy this beauty from Amazon.  Since the day 1, I am totally impressed with the quality and it has 100 percent lived upto its expectations and the 5 star reviews.  The HD quality is stunning. I had to upgrade my dish system to HD but once that was done, I am not spending any money on DVDs anymore.  The picutre is simply awesome.  Worth every penny spent...

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Sunny Patel "Sunny"
Reviews.Content: Delivered few days before scheduled, in excellent condition. Very easy to setup. I made this purchase after a lot of research. This is the best TV for its size and cost. Saved a bundle with Amazon, not having to pay tax and shipping added to the savings.I strongly recommend this TV.Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Great as computer monitor and as TV
Reviews.Author: Ross Binkley
Reviews.Content: I have been incredibly pleased with this TV set since I first bought it. I actually got it primarily to use as a computer monitor (as I am doing right now at full resolution from 8-10' away) and it works great for both that and for watching TV or movies. The picture quality is outstanding. The 4ms response rate makes it great as a computer monitor, also. It's even fast enough for gaming (which can't be said of many actual computer monitor LCD displays.) The 120Hz and AMP features are a very nice addition when watching video sources with a lot of motion, such as sports (although the AMP needs to be turned down a little for movie watching, IMO.)The viewing angle is also very good. The way my room is arranged, people are often watching movies on this thing from 60+ degrees off-center and it still looks great even at those angles. The only noticable difference from being on-center is just the increased distance to the far side of the TV - lol.For those planning to use this as a computer monitor, I measured that a 12 point font at full 1080p resolution at normal (96) dpi is 3/4 of an inch tall - easily readable from 10-12' away (perhaps more.) Also, for those using this as a computer monitor, it should be noted that the output should be set to use YCbCr, rather than RGB. With an NVidia card, this can be done under NVidia Control Panel -> Video & Television -> Select Digital Color Format. I'm assuming that this can be changed easily on an ATI card as well from Catalyst Control Center, but I don't have one sitting in front of me to test it with. This thing has been great for all kinds of computer use. I'm a software engineer, so I'm regularly editing software code from 8-10' away with even as low as 8pt fonts. Programming from the recliner with my wireless keyboard and mouse is very nice. :) The response might still be a little slow for the ridiculously good FPS players out there (I'm not one, so I'm not really sure,) but I've been able to play FPS games on it as well as I can on a regular computer monitor.Also, for the geekish out there, this TV (along with other recent Samsung models) runs Linux and busybox. I want to say that it's uCLinux/ARM arch, but I don't remember for sure. The tools to hack the firmware to your liking are out there. The easiest way is probably to unpack a firmware update image on your computer, alter it, then run the firmware updates. However, it has been discovered that there is a passwordless root shell running on a serial device, but you'd probably have to crack this thing open to get at that UART port (if it even has headers,) so the former option is probably your best bet. Of course, if you can install sshd on an image, then flash this thing, you would be able to just control it over the network, since it already has an ethernet connection in place. Of course, I'm guessing that doing any of this stuff would void the warranty...Overall rating: If this set is in your price range, buy it (or one of its newer Samsung cousins.)

Reviews.Title: love the tv but should have gone with a850
Reviews.Author: N. Stallmann
Reviews.Content: great tv excellent HD picture, SD sub par, but that's to be expected. The picture looks better with a little light in the room, the second the lights go out i see flashlighting in corners of the screen and some purple haze, I'm a little disappointed by that, which is why i give it 4 stars, otherwise I love this tv perfect for video games i love 120hz feature but i keep it on low. I should have gone with the a850 the floor models of those at bestbuy and Ultimate electronics seem to produce deeper richer blacks than my panel, but all in all for the price vs picture I'd say great deal and would recommend to anyone looking for a top of the line picture for a middle of the line price. Hopefully if i get it Professionally calibrated I can get rid of the flashlighting.

Reviews.Title: Stunning TV + Seamless Delivery = Five Stars
Reviews.Author: snohman
Reviews.Content: I was purchasing a TV for my parents, who are not exactly the most tech-savvy people.  I was actually debating between the 550 and 650 series, due to the savings ($400 cheaper for the 550), but really did want the 120Hz LCD.  The features available on the more expensive 750 and 850 did not really appeal to me either, as many others have also mentioned.  So I finally settled on the 650.The Delivery Process: I ordered the TV on a Wednesday, and upon checkout, was asked to choose a timeframe of when the TV would be delivered.  I selected the following Friday between 8am-12pm.  Very easy, simple, and a nice new addition to Amazon's white-glove delivery service, as I had previously purchased a TV two years earlier, and this had not been offered at the time.  The delivery service called once they had received the TV the following Wednesday, and gave me an even more accurate time of 12PM for that Friday.  They did arrive one hour late, but called to alert me of the delay.  They carried the TV to the second floor (for my Mom, as I do not live with my parents), unpacked, set it on the TV stand, and then carried the TV box back down to the garage in case we needed to return the product.  Excellent, excellent service, that saved my parents the back breaking ordeal of carrying the TV upstairs.BEAUTIFUL TV! When I went to help set up the TV to the cable system, the TV absolutely blew me away.  We have an older 46" Samsung LNT4665F, and it makes this TV look ancient.  The screen is noticeably smoother, and has a much more rich feel to it.  One of the biggest convenience factors is the MUCH quicker channel switching.  The 550s has a slight delay when changing the channel, and is a bit annoying to sift through.  If you are looking to get into Samsung's 120Hz LCD series, the 650 is a great great purchase.  And you cannot beat Amazon's price or service.

Reviews.Title: Samsung, 52" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Jack R. Rathjen "jackr"
Reviews.Content: HD channels and movies are amazing.  Too bad I only get a few HD channels with my cable subscription.  With normal channels everything is a little wider makeing people appear heavy.  This can be adjusted by choosing a different screen size, but that puts a black border around the picture.

Reviews.Title: Had a 61" DLP; love this 120hz LCD.
Reviews.Author: C. Six
Reviews.Content: I owned a Samsung 61" DLP (2nd generation) that I had purchased from a membership store. In 3 years I had to replace the bulb twice, the mirror engine once and finally it needed a part that was no longer offered by Samsung. Luckily I had purchased the extended warranty; the store gave me a cash refund of the purchase price (and the warranty). I used the refund $$ to purchase the Samsung 52", 120Hz LCD (touch of color).First - I love the picture quality of this TV. I didn't think a picture could be any better than the DLP TV I owned; I was wrong. Our family watched 'I Am Legend' on BluRay. It looked so good that it seemed strange... it really looks so good it almost seems to be 3D.Second - the major drawback (and reason I originally didn't buy an LCD) is refresh rate. My son and I play Xbox 360 FPS type games together; these are high action games with a lot of fast-moving graphics (explosions etc). The 120hz version seems to have resolved this latency issue. That, coupled with the fact the prices have come down dramatically on the larger LCD screens makes it the time to buy LCD on larger screens (50" or larger).Third - this was my first large purchase on Amazon.com. I've made hundreds of book/electronics purchased on Amazon.com but never bought a big-ticket item. It was shipped directly to my door; the shipping was included and had no sales tax. I recently visited Circuit City's store (going out of business sale). They claimed a 30% savings on a 50" Samsung LCD TV; the price was more than I paid on Amazon for a 52" Samsung LCD (120hz).

Reviews.Title: Good experience
Reviews.Author: Wilassasin "Wilassasin"
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery, Box was delivered undamaged. TV was in perfect condition & works well. Thanks to Amazon I saved hundreds.....

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture
