Red is very subtle, and brings a decorator look to the room vs just some "plastic-y" technology on the wall.  Suggest you look at it in person first, but we love it.Anyway, do your homework, but I feel great about this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Samsong 52 inch lcd 650
Reviews.Author: R. Evans
Reviews.Content: Lives up to it's CNET review and then some Couldn't be more pleased.Delivery was on time. Don't stay away from this set because of its "touch of red color " The frame looks classier than the standard black.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: E. Lozada "Tech"
Reviews.Content: I was thinking to buy a plasma TV because of the image quality, until I saw the reviews of this TV, then I went to see it by my self in the store, then I realise why to many excellent reviews. This TV has the image quality I was looking for. If you are looking image quality buy it.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Philip M. Doherty
Reviews.Content: best tv i have ever had and the price and shipping time were great also.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Wanted
Reviews.Author: J. Thompson
Reviews.Content: My daughter and son-in-law purchased this TV and I was impressed with the picture and features.  I also saw it rated highly in Consumer Reports.  Amazon's price was considerably lower than advertised sales prices here in the LA area, so the decision was easy.  The delivery was scheduled for a convenient time and the whole experience was great.  I love my TV!

Reviews.Title: Best TV. Period
Reviews.Author: F. Ycaza
Reviews.Content: Shop around all you like, but to this date this TV is your best choice for <$3000 big screen HD experience. A word of warning: 120Hz is great, but remember that movies are filmed at 25 frames per second, therefore a 120fps will look a little "too" real modifying the way the movie was intended to look in the first place, if you have seen a movie in PAL format (30fps) you will get the idea. Also there will be a blur every time the movie pans around. In Video games however, is the best quality yet! With that said... 1080p in 60hz (or maybe 120hz set to low)it looks amazing, the overall product is great. And you should stop here and go buy it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" LCD
Reviews.Author: James A. Orrico
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color.With all the vendors out there trying to sell a product at a lower than retail price, then adding extras to the price to sell you the product I was pleasently surprised to get this LCD at the advertized price with no hassle and delivered on schedule with white glove in home delivery for free, this really made this a great deal for my family, this is the best LCD at the best price from a great company, GREAT JOB AMAZON!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: F. Kashat
Reviews.Content: After much research to purchase LCD TV, I narrowed it down between Samsung and Sony. The Sony are a bit pricier than Samsung without much more to offer. This TV has the best to offer. High definition 1080P, with 120Hz refresh rate. Images pop out of my screen :)The purchase transaction was smooth. Delivery guys were very professional and friendly.Also, the price dropped after I purchased the TV, but with Amazon price guarantee, I was able to get the difference refunded.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V.
Reviews.Author: Pam Piazzo
Reviews.Content: We bought a sony 32" bravia for our bedroom so we thought we'd stick with the sony brand.  But after reading reviews and looking at the samsung tv we decided to buy it.  Its a great t.v.  The picture quality is really good.  Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I have no regrets of buying this tv. It is so awesome! I am so amazed of it. It is SUPER BRIGHT and CRYSTAL CLEAR(no joke). If you are debating about buying this Tv. ITS THE BEST OF THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: Awesome remote control, perfect performance, and fantastic quality!
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: I am thoroughly satisfied, even impressed, with my purchase.  Not only did I get this gorgeous, high-performance LCD HDTV at a great price, but I got quick white-glove delivery service from Amazon.  Looks great in our family room.  Although I thought I'd want to mount it to the wall, to my surprise, I really like it on the stand that comes with it.  It's also not heavy at all considering how large it is, and the packaging was perfect.Picture and sound are great, and the sound is even better after hooking it up to our home audio system.  I love the ergonomic remote control with different color buttons, as opposed to other remove controls that make you go cross-eyed.  Samsung is a GREAT electronics company, especially for monitors & LCDs.  The picture is superb, clear, and vibrant with fast and blur-free motion as promised.  I have not had to download the software patch and have had no problems/perfect performance.(In order to REALLY appreciate the picture quality, you have to have HD quality data.  Watching cable was good, but watching DVD was GREAT.  Can't wait to see what the picture looks like with Blu-ray!)  This TV (and Amazon) really delivers!

Reviews.Title: Great TV and great service
Reviews.Author: C. Close
Reviews.Content: I am not a technology junkie, I will probably never use all the bells and whistles this tv has.  This tv purchase, from the ordering, to the receiving, to the watching has been wonderful.  It was only 1 day later than the estimate, the trucking firm that delivered it unwrapped it and placed it on my entertainment center (I could not have done that myself) and took the box and wrappings away.  I plugged in the TV, attached the one cable from our RF modulator (which controls our DVD and VHS), and turned it on.  After the Plug and Play process which sets up your television, I was watching Judge Judy 20 minutes after delivery.  The picture is amazing, the glare from our dining room windows is non-existent, and the fact that it rotates toward our dining room is just a huge plus.  You really have to look for the red, it's very subdued.  This is a wonderful purchase.

Reviews.Title: My Dream TV!
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah Johnson "Tv addict"
Reviews.Content: This Tv is awesome.  I bought it because of the reviews I read from the others who bought it.  Delivery was great.  They brought the set into my house, unwrapped it, set it up and turned it on to make sure it was working!  At first I thought it wasn't so great, till I went out and bought new cables and a new splitter (to the tv and the tivo)  Wow!  The picture is great!  The only thing that's not great is the picture from the tivo, so now I have to get a better quality one!  I don't have blue-ray yet, but the dvds from my cheapo dvd player are awesome!  We still plan to buy a surround sound system, since the basic tv sound just needs to match the great picture.  We have a home theater, and the sound in there makes it more of an experience, so I know that once we get better sound on this tv it will be an even more amazing experience.Followup: In November of 2012 the TV suddenly stopped working and made a clicking sound. We had to pay 250 to get it fixed, but it's working now. I have less faith in it after that, however.

Reviews.Title: Product and seller get an A+
Reviews.Author: Jacob Schema "Newbee"
Reviews.Content: The item arrived way early and in perfect condition.  The picture quality is absolutely incredible and the amount of money I saved from buying on amazon was absolutely asstounding!  You can find this item for slightly lower prices on other sites, but they will try and lure you in with the old "bait and switch" and by annoying you with trying to sell you all these add-ons you don't want.  When buying on amazon you get what you see and even more!  The free shipping and setup was awesome and seeing the delivery men unpack that gorgeous TV will bring a tear to any man's eye.  If you are looking for a great deal on a great TV here it is!

Reviews.Title: Best Deal LCD TV
Reviews.Author: the "golfmeister"
Reviews.Content: I just got mine 2 days ago and amazon did a great job shipping it. They actually remove it from the box, put it on my TV stand, hook up the connection test it to make sure everything is good and even offered to take the boxes. They even delivered it earlier. Great job AMAZON.As for the TV its crystal clear just like what everybody said. I can see now why the glare can be an issue. In mine there's not much light and I can still some of the glare but it does not bother me since I only see it if the screen is mostly black otherwise its great.The RED TOC is hardly noticeable you would not even know it unless someone tells you.

Reviews.Title: The best LCD TV on the market!
Reviews.Author: Oliver Chang
Reviews.Content: This LCD TV is the best on the market by far as of now.  I have one and it is great.  The red color hue in the frame is so subtle and classy that I think it adds a great touch to the Television. I would recommend this set for anyone in the market for LCDS.  This is the best value for the dollar in the market of LCDS.  The Sony's are good, but overpriced.  This 2008 Sammy is the best that has come out this year.  Samsungs must be great right.. Sony's are using the Samsung Lcd Panels in their sets..  Once again if you want a LCD TV this is the set to get.

Reviews.Title: Real nice
Reviews.Author: J. Paul
Reviews.Content: Love this TV and it looks great on the Samsung TV stand.  Picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Pat by the Sea
Reviews.Content: We obsessed for months and read countless reviews before we purchased the Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color.  It is amazing!  The picture is awesome - even with blinds wide open. The red touch of color is very subtle and gives it added class. We also bought the Samsung home theater system w/5 dvd changer and IPOD dock (I think that's what cinched it for my better half) The sound system equals the TV in quality and performance.  We could not be happier with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Jared Black
Reviews.Content: Delivery was great, price was better than anywhere I looked, no tax, and this TV is nothing short of beautiful.  I really enjoy Amazon, too!  What more is there to say.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love this TV
Reviews.Author: M. Sloan
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tv.  We decided on this tv after looking at it at Sears and Best Buy.  We found the same tv on amazon and saved ourselves $600.  It was delivered super fast and in excellent condition.  We are now looking at buying 3 more HD samsungs for all the rest of the rooms.  Run, not walk to get this tv.  You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Martinjm
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the free shipping that Amazon offered at the time for this product and the price could not be beaten.  Overall, great LCD especially when compared to the much higher XBR Sonys.  IMO the picture was better on the Samsung when compared head to head.  THe TOC is not an issue at all and can't even be seen unless pointed out.  My reason for a 4 start vs. 5 is that the speakers sounds a bit tinny (I realize most will hookup surround sound/alternate sound methods) and it would be nice if it had WiFi or a full fledged ethernet card to work on a home network.  The ethernet connection allows for the downloading of news, weather, stocks, but commo with a home network would make this TV unstoppable.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC TV
Reviews.Author: Michael Waltenspuel "MIKE ,"
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS TV AFTER SHOPPING AND CK ABOUT 10 DIV MODELS OUT. I COULD NOT BE HAPPIER WITH THIS TV, I HAVE NOW FIOS FROM VERIZON AND THE PICTURE IS JUST AWSOME ABSOLTELY GREAT, PLAYSTATION 3 AND BLUE RAY LOOKS LIKE YOU ARE IN THE MOVIE WITH THIS TV, I HAD DISCH NETWORK AND A SOLALA PICTURE BUT AFTER I SWITCHED TO FIOS VERIZON ITS THE BEST TV EVER( NO I DONT WORK FOR SAMSUNG ) REMOTE CONTROL IS A KIND OF LONG AND THE I POD STYLE WHEEL IS OK NOT THE BEST BUT EASY TO HANDLE. I SAVED ABOUT$ 1100.00 SINCE I BOUGHT THTE SET OVER AMAZON COPARED TO BEST BUY. HAD THE WHITE GLOVE DELIVERY WHICH WAS QUICK AND THEY UNPACKED THE TV AND HOOKED UP THE POWER( NOT THE ANTENNA ) AND TOOK ALL THE PACKAGE MATERIAL WITH THEM . GREAT SERVICE , THEY CALLED THE DAY BEFORE DELIVERY .IF YOU ALWASY WANTED A FANTASTIC TV GO AND GET THIS ONE, I EVEN THINK THE PRICE FOR THIS SET IS TO LOW FOR THE GREAT QUALITY .AWSOME PICTURE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for this price range
Reviews.Author: Eric Morgan
Reviews.Content: I was debating between the samsung 650, 550 and TN71F.  It came down to this one and I just got it a week ago.  I am SO impressed!  I was worried about glare because our tv sits in our frontroom with large windows that shine directly on that wall and the tv and I never notice it ever.  The picture is very clean, great hookups, etc.  As with others the only real drawback is the sound is not great, but if you get speakers its not bad.  Blacks are black, HDTV look extremely crisp and non-HD output looks great as well.If you have any questions about this tv feel free to email me at ericmorgan80 at yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: Love the TV
Reviews.Author: M. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV for about 3 weeks with no problems.  Great picture from the get go. I have not had to adjust the color or picture.  Lots of features to play with.  I like that you can enlarge the picture to fill the screen when you don't have full 1080 without it looking bad. The standard TV looks good also. You can and I have upgraded the software on TV. It was easy.The white glove service is nice.  They bring it in and set it where you want and turn it on to make sure it works.  You will need to be ready for them we they bring with a stand and cable hookup.

Reviews.Title: The Best Picture Out there !!!
Reviews.Author: Omar G Rios
Reviews.Content: I usually spend way too much time researching and try to get the best Quality and Price..... and this Samsumg lcd TV really does, the best picture you can get, Black level it's almost perfect, The PS3 Games looks amazing and the sond it Good , this one really beats any Sony LCD Out There !!!Abouth Amazon 'm Impress I place My Order on June 23rd and the Tv was at my place on 27th the service (by CEVA) was superb....Thank you ...

Reviews.Title: Samsung No Help
Reviews.Author: Fred Nichols "HD Buyer"
Reviews.Content: I bought the 650 on recommendation from friends and forums. Don't do it. brand new $2000 TV that switches inputs randomly and often and then won't respond to the remote. the local repair people now have this piece of junk. I have contacted Samsung and they have indicated that they will not replace the TV until service determines it is not repairable, so while they run up charges for Samsung to pay, they are on their third attempt to fix it, I am watching all the football games on my old Sony that has been beaten, kicked, rained on, heated and cooled to extreme and still works......but it ain't high def. Second recommendation is don't ever get high def because going back to old def is incredibly painful.

Reviews.Title: Many Samsungs Fail After 1+ Years 10/25/09
Reviews.Author: wlkalong "wlkalong"
Reviews.Content: Do not buy a Samsung TV. My 40 inch Samsung LCD lasted just a little over 2 years. According to multiple internet sitesSamsung built a bunch of LCD TV's with bad capacitors that fail after a year or more (right after warranty is over).You can do a simple Google search and find many people who have had the same problems. After a year or two, the TV'sno longer turn on. Samsung has been made aware of this issue, but refuses to correct the problem. There are multiplesites that even tell you exactly how the problem is corrected. I am sure the number of people with this problem willincrease as time goes by. Even with the extended warranty, it is not worth the hassle of buying a large TV from acompany that does not support its products. I did a lot of research before choosing a Samsung, but since it wasearly in the production cycle, the problem did not appear. Don't take a chance, get another brand.

Reviews.Title: Picture Flicker on indoor Sports
Reviews.Author: Buzz07
Reviews.Content: Just bought the 650.  Love it, except that it flickers when watching indoor sports, like hockey and basketball.  Like flash bulbs are continually going off.  Anyone else notice this?  Any suggestions on how to eliminate the flashing?  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Research cable box interference problems before purchase
Reviews.Author: Darrell
Reviews.Content: Our TV delivered last week interferes with the HD cable box remote.  Control of the box is unpredictable.  It varies from only being able to contol channel selection, to no control.  If one researches the cnet and avs forums, it becomes clear that this is a widespread problem.  It was originally detected in the 850 series, but is now appearing in the 650 series as well.  Firmware upgrades have not proved to be a viable solution in the 850 series and now it seems that parts are being replaced.  Our set has newer firmware than that which is now being provided as a fix and it still has the issue.  The latest advice that I received from two Samsung reps today was to put tape over the TV sensor...the set will be going back.  Other than this inherent flaw, the TV was great in all other aspects...all the more disappointing.  I can't believe that this issue was not a problem for the many reviewers of this highly touted product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Kurleytop
Reviews.Content: This tv is too much for my cable and other equiptment. I guess I need to update. The colors are marvelous. I am very happy with my purchase. Delivery took too long. Reno to Sacramento took 7 days. Delivery company had it in thier warehouse the whole time. I had to call and make them deliver. Otherwise it was a thousand dollar savings over local stores.

Reviews.Title: TOO Shinny a Screen
Reviews.Author: LCD convert
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry a bought the TV now. The screen is definitely too glossy and reflects objects and light, especially when off, but also when it is on. I wish I had bought the 630 now with the matte screen or the Sony 52w4100. Look at the user supplied picture of his TV setup and all you see is reflections. If you want the glossy look, go with plasma, otherwise pick a matte screen 120hz model.

Reviews.Title: You may not be lucky enough
Reviews.Author: M. Zhao "mike zhao"
Reviews.Content: I bought it in August 2008 and now it has a dead line 5" below the top screen.

Reviews.Title: Another unhappy customer
Reviews.Author: John Thibodeau
Reviews.Content: Have had this tv for 2 plus years and it has been great - until a few days ago. I also experienced the same off/on problems previous posters have noted. When I called customer service they said they were aware of the problem and would have a tech come out for a one time "free" of charge visit. Of course it would only be free if the issue was the capacitor. If not, I would have to foot the bill. Luckily I got the three-year warranty. Unfortunately I purchased a second samsung (the 46" version) last January. Can't wait until that goes on the fritz too. No more samsungs for me.

Reviews.Title: Amazing unit...I can't believe its only $1k
Reviews.Author: Kevin Moser
Reviews.Content: Went in with my roommate to get this TV about 2 years ago.  At the time it was going for $3600, but we bought it from Circuit City for $2100 before the stores closed.  I mounted this puppy on the wall of our apartment and never once had an issue with it.  The controller that comes with the unit is crappy, but we used a universal one so that didn't matter.  I did a good amount of shopping around and no set came close to consideration compared to this one.I can tell you right now, this is a steal at just $1k.  The gimmicky sellpoints are so mundane now.  There has hardly been any noteworthy advances in the television industry in the past two years.  Especially to warrant considering a new model upwards of $2k when you would be hard-pressed to notice any clarity difference or quality improvement over this set.  240-hz is just a selling point and hardly makes any difference.  And the notion that 3D is going to take over soon is ridiculous.  Common consumers were just forced to upgrade their tube TVs to flat panels over the past 5 years.  Whoever believes that they would be willing to shell out more big bucks for a 3D-compatible TV is kidding themselves.  3D isn't even on the horizon at the moment.Anyone looking for a large flat panel with a beautiful picture, great contrast, and reliable construction...do yourself a favor and pick this baby up.  Your wallet will thank you.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this product - Power problems make it useless
Reviews.Author: Black Eagle
Reviews.Content: I bought this set in January 2009.  The picture quality has been great, and it is a good TV set in general.  However, after about 10 months, the TV started to have power cycle problems.  When we tried to turn the TV on or off, it will keep turning on and off repeatedly.  When this happens, we have to unplug the power supply, and wait for some time before we can plug it back and use the TV again.  I contacted Samsung service, and got the latest firmware.  You know what?  My TV was built in late 2008 and it has already the latest firmware.  The firmware Samsung service sent me is identical to what my TV has.  So it is not the firmware problem.  Here I made a critical mistake:  I didn't follow through and request a repair service from Samsung while it was still under warranty. I thought the issue was still manageable, so it was not worth wasting time to get the service.  Big mistake.  Now 3 months later, the power problem got worse, and we can no long even turn the TV on.The TV looks great when it is working.  But there are fundamental quality/design issues with its power supply. A great TV without power is useless, and you will be better off with a lesser TV that is more reliable.I will wait and see how the service/repair works out and comment more afterward.

Reviews.Title: As Good as it gets!  Excellent Picture, Great Sound Poor Remote!
Reviews.Author: FLY 4 God "flyingbroker"
Reviews.Content: This is as good as it gets for the year and price, I am picky and have no complaints other then a weak remote, oh well everything cant be perfect.......

Reviews.Title: If you can find this TV buy it
Reviews.Author: jray
Reviews.Content: I bought this about 8 months ago and have never seen a picture on another set that compares to this model. Its really is stunning. I can't even count how many people that have been over and commented on how great the picture is on this set. One person told me they never really noticed or cared about a tv picture but said that this one was so good that even she took notice.I read a few months ago that this model is the benchmark that is used to judge the picture of other sets. Not sure if anything changed with the newer models but I feel lucky to have this one in the house. I have two other lcds and while they have great HD pictures this one is at a whole different level.

Reviews.Title: This TV is well above expectations
Reviews.Author: Rosemary T. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in April and have been more than pleased with it and believe it should be rated 5 starts.

Reviews.Title: A Super HDTV...
Reviews.Author: C. A. Trambley "Spymaster"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV at the end of January after the Super Bowl. The purchase price has since gone up some $400 on Amazon so I count myself lucky I got such a great deal. The delivery wasn't exactly white glove but the boys got the TV out of the box in one piece and placed it on my stand.  As the other reviewers have noted, the picture is absolutely superb.  Deep blacks, bright whites, stunning color contrast.  If you've bought this TV and want to "wow" your friends, pull up the daylight tracking shot of Hong Kong from "The Dark Knight" on Blu ray. No words can describe the clarity and picture quality.  At its current price, I can't say I'd recommend buying considering you can get the 52 inch Samsung 750 240hz version of this TV for only $200 more. If you do decide to take the plunge, you won't disappointed.  I'm one happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 - Great TV -Great Price - problem free Delivery
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: I waited until I had the TV for almost a month to write a review, so I could ensure I had no problems that might occur.  The  TV has worked flawlessly, the picture quality is fantatstic.  The remote is no where near as bad as some reviews have suggested.  The price was a great price, no local electronics store or National chain even came close.  Also other major web based stores' prices were not as good as Amazon.  The White glove delivery was perfect. The driver brought the TV in to the house, unboxed it, set it up attached cables, turned it on and checked many channels.  He also asked me to examine the TV from top to bottom for any scratches or flaws.  I can't say enough good things about the servcie.  I absoluetely love the TV.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG  LN52A650
Reviews.Author: yankee  catman "paul"
Reviews.Content: THIS IS OUR FIRST BIG PURCHASE WITH AMAZON. THIS TV IS STUNNING. IT LOOKS GOOD OFF AND IT LOOKS GOOD ON ! THE PICTURE QUALITY IS EXCELLENT. THE SOUND IS VERY GOOD. IT IS GOOD ENOUGH THAT I WONT BE BUYING AN ADD ON SPEAKER SYSTEM.THE SWIVEL BASE IS ANOTHER NICE FEATURE.IN HOME WE HAVE NO GLARE OR VIEWING PROBLEMS,AND THE 120 MHZ MADE THE STANLEY CUP SERIES ROCK .ALL THE ACTION WAS A PLEASURE TO WATCH. WE LOOKED AT THE LN52A550, IT'S SOUND IS MARGINAL AT BEST AND THE PICTURE IS NOT AS CLEAN/CRISP IN MY OPINION.SEE THE TV'S AT THE RETAILERS AND COMPARE.I WENT TO BEST BUY,SAMS CLUB, AND SEARS. I BOUGHT  THE LN52A650.

Reviews.Title: Adjust to reduce IR interference
Reviews.Author: Keir Keightley
Reviews.Content: This TV is the top recommendation from Consumer Reviews (for its value and quality).  I agree and I also used the recommended settings found online at tweaktv.com.  I use it with Vista Media Center and it works very nicely.  I use the screen zoom feature found in VMC to accommodate the various aspect ratios found in broadcast and movie sources and leave the TV set to 16:9.  Make sure to adjust the resolution and any overscan settings (e.g. using the video card settings) so that you get the full benefit of the size and resolution (Nvidia does a great job of providing the proper software for this).  The only big issue I have come across is the excessive interference with the VMC IR receiver.  This TV will flood the room with IR noise when certain settings are being used (I am pretty sure its the energy saver settings).  This IR noise makes the VMC remote virtually useless.  I found some posts regarding these settings and corrected the issue.  Now, I am happily viewing with full control of my systems.  It is an impressive TV and I am happy with it so far.  As for size and weight, I can see how even at 52", I will eventually be interested in something larger but will likely go to a projector system.  I think this unit weighs perhaps a few lbs less than my 27" Sony Trinitron (and it is sooo much better)!  I have been viewing analog signals on it at SDTV resolutions...this leaves something to be desired.  Switching to a digital signal and hopefully higher resolutions (for normal broadcast/cable programming) will greatly improve the quality of the image.BTW, the 120Hz settings make a movie look like it was shot on video (very sharp image with little inertial smoothing).  This is great for sports type programming but not to my liking for feature films.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Merritt
Reviews.Content: Great picture even on non-HD channels. I had a 32 inch hd Sharp and was worried the standard channels would be really grainy and blurry but this picture was great. The screen does have a high gloss but when the TV is on it has little affect. I have both cable and satellite and the TV displays 60Hz on every setting but from what I hear the picture is still at 120 HZ, so that can be confusing. I did a lot of research between this TV the Sony and LG and for the money this is the best TV.

Reviews.Title: Above and beyond expectations
Reviews.Author: J. Achter
Reviews.Content: Ordering as usual was extremely simple, and the savings over purchasing locally was very significant. Then came the service which was superb. TV was delivered timely, brought in to house, unpacked, set up where I wanted and tested for operation before delivery person left. Way more than I expected and very welcome. As for the tv - totally blows my mind, wonderful picture, easy to use, remote is very user friendly, and tv rotates on its base which is not disclosed in promo material, but is very useful. I cannot find one negative with Amazon, price, delivery or product.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: Gary A. Seaton
Reviews.Content: I've been more than pleased with my Samsung purchases in the past (40" LCD HD TV, Home Theater, upconverting DVD etc) but this new 52" TV is the very best I've ever seen much less owned. Blu-Ray is great, and the upconverted DVD's are nearly as sharp. Dealing with Amazon direct is a pleasure, simple and quick. Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: Stunning quality image for a surprisingly good price
Reviews.Author: Andrew Knight
Reviews.Content: Like most other reviewers, we shopped carefully before settling on the Samsung LN52A650... we compared it to others in several brick-and-mortar retailers, and read lots of reviews, including one from a national consumer magazine which rated the 650 higher than its newer siblings.  In the end, we opted for the 650 as the best compromise of picture quality and price.  We have not been disappointed in any way (we now have two 52" Samsungs, and one 46" A650 as well).  The picture quality is flawless with our DirecTV satellite feed (running at 1080i), the set-up and software are excellent, and I am looking forward to connecting it to our home network to take advantage of its connectivity features, and to a BlueRay DVD player as well.  Stepping up from a 14-year old Sony XBR 53" rear-projection TV, the improvement in image quality is nothing short of stunning.For what it's worth, the "Touch of Color" red bezel is very subtle in our installation, barely noticeable at all and certainly not as eye-grabbing as I feared.Other reviewers have noted that Amazon's "White Glove" delivery service is everything promised, and we would have to agree... our TVs were delivered very quickly and with no fuss to our new home (which was still under construction when the units arrived).  I would not hesitate to purchase large/bulky big-ticket items from Amazon based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Neal Clark
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for over 6 months now and couldnt be happier!!! This tv is the cream of the crop!!! I reviewed many different tv's online. I did like a year's worth of research before buying this tv and everyone said this was the best! I usually dont believe what the manufacturer says so I rely on the "honest" peoples reviews say. I'd say almost 95% of the people said this was a great tv and they were right. I also use cnet to get a good idea of what I am buying bc they are an independent organization that does reviews and are usually right on with their reviews.The only bad thing about this tv I would say is that non HD tv shows look like crap to me. I have a Tivo HD and HD DVR from my cable company. When watching in HD the picture is perfect but when watching non HD it is very grainy. Thats only bc my expensive crap cable company (Comcast) doesnt have all the HD channels yet. But I can deal with it bc this tv as many options to make the picture look semi decent.The delivery service was top notch! They called me a day before it was to be delivered which I thought was great! They came within the time specified. The 2 men brought it in took it out of the box for me and plugged it in to make sure it works.The setup was very easy. I did it myself. I bought all the wires before hand so I could hook up all my components at once.I also bought PS3 the day it came. I bought it mainly for the bluray player bc many people including cnet says its the best player on the market. And thay are not wrong. The piture in 1080p is flawless!! I love my PS3 and this tv!!!All in all I would have to say this is the best TV and I am extremely happy with it and couldnt have asked for a better tv!!I hope this review helps. I dont usually write reviews but I thought this tv warranted a review....

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for my space
Reviews.Author: G. Smith
Reviews.Content: I almost bought this TV 3 months earlier, but decided to wait because I could not make up my mind about the red "Touch of Color."  I wanted the TV because of the high ratings and features, but I was not crazy about having something this big that is RED in my living room. Well, after receiving the TV I changed my mind.  The color is so subtle, you really do not notice it unless you have a light shining directly behind it.  I actually think it looks great.  It is so very subtle.  Higly recommend this item.  Picture quality is amazing so far.

Reviews.Title: Freakishly Realistic Looking!
Reviews.Author: Steven G. Rupert Jr.
Reviews.Content: I spent about 6 weeks looking at TV's and researching them while saving money to purchase one. This would be my 3rd HDTV so I wanted to make sure it was the best. This is the only TV I could find that had a tremendous amount of people who were just absolutely happy about it on many different forums. Consumer Reports also rated it #1 and CNET.com still lists it as an Editors Choice pick with an "excellent" rating.After purchasing the TV, I was shocked at how much better it performed than my previous Toshiba HDTV. I still have that tv but it's now in my bedroom. In summation, I'm just SO happy with this purchase. When watching HDTV and especially Blu-Ray on my PS3, this TV looks so realistic that it appears as if you're looking out a window and watching it live. Also of importance is that my best friend has the LN52A550 and he and I both agree that this TV looks much more realistic looking, almost freakishly realistic. The difference between his TV and this one is mainly the 120hz Auto Motion Plus. I have become a very big fan of the 120hz Auto Motion Plus and very much like that Samsung was thoughtful enough to let the user adust it to "Off, Low, Medium or High" to ensure that it can be tuned to the user's preferences.In fact, the only real problem I could find with this TV was that when I played my PS3, XBOX 360 and Wii on it, the timing appeared to be off. It appeared as though there was a signifigant video delay or lag between what was really happening and what appeared on the TV. Below is the solution for this:SOLUTION: I have a LN52A650 and have also noticed that when I play my PS3 and XBOX 360 on this new TV, that there is a signifigant delay as compared to my other two HDTV's. In particular, while playing golf,baseball, Guitar Hero and Rock Band on PS3, I noticed that I have to hit the button much sooner than in the past in order to perfect my 'timing' on these games. As you know, when you have to change your timing, it changes the playability and can even ruin some games. There is deffienetly a delay. I've had this TV for a month now and until last night, was unable to figure out the problem.Here is the solution: Hit the menu button on the remote control to bring up the TV's general menu. Next, scroll down to 'Setup' and hit enter. Then scroll down to 'Entertainment' and hit enter. Finally, you'll see a sub-menu come up that says "Off, Sports, Cinema, Game." Select 'Game' from this menu and the caption will tell you that this option will now provide "The optimal picture and sound quality for games. This mode accelerates the playing speed when using an external game console connected to the TV."After selecting this "Game" mode, it completely changed everything. The games are playing better than ever and the timing on games like Rock Band 2, Golf and Baseball are now right on!My problem, like so many others, is that I was looking for this 'game' mode or something similar to it in the "Picture Options" menu because there was a video delay problem. I hope this post helps others who have Samsung TV's because they really are the best.I am so, so happy with this TV and am extremely glad I brokedown and finally paid to get it. This TV is FREAKISHLY realistic looking and now that I've discovered this 'game' mode, It really does seem to be perfect. Everyone who comes over is just so impressed with the extreme clairity of this TV!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Gadget freak in SF "Gadget freak in SF"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for exactly a year now. I love it! Haven't had any issues with it. Great brightness, contrast, color, all are beautiful. Blu-Ray DVD's look amazing.One tip, if using the 120hz mode, don't use the highest setting, use the low or minimal setting. When I used the highest mode, colors would "smear", especially lighter colors on a person's face, etc. The low setting works perfectly, no smear and no motion jitters.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Julie (TriGirl) & David
Reviews.Content: The picture is simply amazing on the TV.  I was delighted with the purchasing experience.  The TV arrived on time, the Amazon white glove installers set it up and made sure it was working before they left (taking the boxes with them).  I picked the time that I wanted it delivered.Setup that I am using: samsung LN52A650 PS3 (for games and blue-ray), Tivo HD, older Yamaha rx-v995 receiver.  I route all the video inputs directly into the TV (via hdmi), and all the sound directly into the Yamaha (via optical inputs).  At some point I should upgrade the receiver.I sat the TV on my fireplace mantle, I put several of wood screws through the plastic and metal base of the TV to secure it, then put an earthquake strap attaching the back of the TV to the wall just in case.  This works really well for viewing from all angles.Strengths:-Picture quality.  The most important feature of course.  This picture just looks stunning no adjustments required from the time that it was setup.  You can tweak it for Games vs. Movies and that is about all that it requires.-View from all angles is fantastic.-TV is very slim, and relatively light, swivel is very useful.-No glare: I have the TV in a bright room with multiple light sources (windows, lights, skylights), there is no reflections off the screen.-I would definitely buy this again.Areas for improvement:- If you use the HDMI into the TV, then try to route the sound out via the TVs optical out, it will only output stereo sound and not surround.-Flipping between the TV inputs with another remote (Tivo remote) doesn't work well.  I can select between the TV inputs, however I am left with the overlay showing the different input devices on my TV for about 5 minutes...I would prefer if this disappeared in 5-10 seconds.  (If you use the samsung remote, you just click select).-The Auto-motion 120hz...i have tried enabling this feature with movies or sports or different types of shows.  I find that it makes everything appear very unnatural, so I have just turned it off.  The video coming from the Tivo and PS3 is great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jean Paschal
Reviews.Content: This was a BUY from Consumer Reports and we couldn"t be happier.Excellent picture and sound quality plus Amazon service and free shipping made this purchase a slam dunk.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Entertainment product
Reviews.Author: L. A. Harris III
Reviews.Content: This Tv is amazing. I've only had it for a little over a month and I've already hosted a get together for the Final four and have plans of hosting the Hatton/Paquiao fight. I haven't even hooked up my HDMI cables yet and the pic looks too real. I recommend this TV to everyone. This swivel base allows for easy viewing no matter where you're sitting. SWEET!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 52" LCD Television
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Chavez "Major Bob"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the purchase of this item.  I was skeptical about purchasing an electronic item on line in case there was a problem.  However, after reading reviews I was confident if I did have a problem it would be taken care of.  The TV was a little over $250 less than Best Buys best price and carried the same warranty.  I couldn't be more happy with the result.  I encourage you to give Amazon a try.

Reviews.Title: This is the TV !
Reviews.Author: Alemaker
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review on any product before, thats how positive I feel about this TV. I had a 52" Sony projection before, that I thought was good before we got this. Picture is like night and day in comparing the two, in fact it isn't fair to compare them because there two different animals. Doesn't matter if the Sun is shining on the screen, you can still see the picture just fine. On the projection the drapes had to be closed to see the screen.I also did a lot of research before clicking the Submit Order button. Should have done it sooner. No regrets at all. Only thing is the glossy stand and frame likes to attract dust. Seems like the 120 Hz makes people pop out, low is the best setting for that.Seems like the price on this TV is like the Stock Market, up and down. Not sure why that is. I paid $1799.99 Buy this TV, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: This TV Rocks!!!!
Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon and it was a smooth process and CEVA delivered the tv and set it up!  Unbeatable and unmatched service from Amazon!  I saved $1000 buying from Amazon!The TV was stunning and picture quality is amazing!  I have a Plasma and this LCD out performs it in every way!  The options in the menu are so detailed and it has the meaning for each option in case people dont know what the option you highlight does.  The sound out the box is amazing and clear.  the 120 Hz works well and looks cool depending what you are watching.  cartoons on Blu-Ray look so real with the 120 Hz on Medium! but not recommend for all you watch, if u must have it on Low works best!  I own 3 Flat screen TV's and this is the most watched and best looking one!  I recommend this LCD TV!  And don't waste your money on the 750 or 850 models!  they the same other than the speakers and that they come with internal storage memory!  the speakers on the 650 are the best of all 3 models!The only downside is that the remote is kind of sluggish!  nothing a Harmony remote cant fix!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A650 52" TV with Touch of Red Rocks
Reviews.Author: Howard Walters "H"
Reviews.Content: This tv is beyond awesome; best picture I have ever seen.  I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: I love it, I love it, I love it!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Smith
Reviews.Content: I think I've already said it all!! I finally treated myself to a "real" TV! I had a 27" CRT with picture problems for over a year and I told my wife, "When this TV craps out, we're getting a real one." Here it is! The picture quality is phenomenal, much better than any TV I've even seen in local stores, even on the same model. I can't get over what I've been missing all these years. I am very proud of my purchase and have become the envy of all who have dared view this machine, including my 2 family members who have smaller HDTV's. They all say "I want it!" I am more than pleased with this television and highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for one in this size or price range. All of our A/V equipment has traditionally been Sony, but I could not find one with this picture quality. The touch of red is actually a nice touch as it accents the screen nicely and even goes with our living room furniture. I have yet to be disappointed with any of this TV's features.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture
Reviews.Author: G. Schott "-g-"
Reviews.Content: Probably the best LCD picture I have ever seen to this point.  This television is just about perfect except for a couple of small complaints.  First off the screen is highly reflective so any ambient light in the room will be reflected and the tv does take a little while to power on and then function compared to other hdtv's I have dealt with. Other then those two complaints the tv is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal TV
Reviews.Author: Brandon Z. Dehaas "dehaasbz"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Best Buy over the weekend, and I can't express in words how amazing it is.  The only bad thing about it, is that I had to watch my Eagles lose yesterday in 52 inches as opposed to the 32 I was watching before.You can read all sorts of rave reviews online, so I won't bore you with those.  I will just help with some questions/concerns I have read and been able to look for now.  The Touch of color is not noticable at all.  It isa dark TV, with a dark red, that you really have to stare at the edges to see.  I am about 10 feet from the screen now (until I move furniture back in the room), and I dont even notice the border around the screen, which is really beatiful.  I love the clear border around the perimeter, and I have watched this is bright, medium, and no light, and I have not seen any halo effect at all.Lastly, have a friend help you with it.  It is heavy enough, and awkward enough in the box to not try it on your own.  I had to get it up a flight of stairs, and was too excited to wait for my landlord to get home, so I moved it my self.  When I managed to get about 1' of the boxes corner up on to the landing, and was trying to pull, from the front of the box, the box up onto the landing (with the other 3-4' hanging in mid air above the steps, I thought I was going to lose the box and watch it bounce down the stairs and slam into the wall at the bottom.  I luckily got a secure enough hold on it (thanks to the unbreakable plastic straps that secure the box) and pull it in to the room.Then, it is too big of a screen to place one hand underneath it (near the tv's base/stand) and the othr hand on the top center of the unit and easily lift it (like I would do with ease on my 32"), so it was a hassle to find a way to lift it, and not strain my back, to get it onto my entertainment stand.  Please use caution and get help, as I thought that I was going to lose my unit twice by trying to be a hero.

Reviews.Title: Amazing deal!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Thomas
Reviews.Content: Samsung 52" lcd, 650 SeriesTv is amazing, picture is amazing, price WAS amazing. I bought this tv during Christmas Sale time (black friday) - and Amazon.com had the cheapest price! Although shipping is pretty slow, it was still the cheapest price and the tv came in mint condition!The tv that I was going to get was the Sony 52" lcd - W series, but the Samsung 650 has a much better picture, and it was a few dollars cheaper.I highly recommend this to anyone in the market for a nice LCD tv that won't break your wallet. The functionality of the tv is extremely easy, and I'm not a electronic geek/freak whatsoever.- JT

Reviews.Title: HDMI Issues
Reviews.Author: W. Sandberg
Reviews.Content: Before buying this model (or any model for that matter), I would suggest that you check with your cable company to see if they have had any problems associated with this model. After setting it up I began to have immediate and intermittent problems with loss of picture and sound.  This was supposed to be fixed with a down load from Samsung and I was aware of it before purchasing.  I down loaded it but the problem persisted.  Samsung set approved warranty service at my home which took about seven days to arrange.  I had to take part of the day off to wait for the repair service.  The main board was replaced but the problems persisted.  Samsung approved a second visit which was to replace the screen and power supply.  Samsung and perhaps others who produce these TV's have "compatibility" problems from time to time with companies that provide the cable services (all of them). After a lot of persistence and before the second visit I was able to determine from Surewest my cable provider that they had an internal memo about Samsung TV and their HDMI issues with the "HDMI handshake" that goes on between the cable service and the TV. I was told that Samsung had this problem previously with the major cable companies and that they were able to straighten them our working with the companies to correct the code.  Surewest told me it was the TV and not their fault so I am stuck with a TV that can't be hooked up to the cable provider via HDMI.  Instead I am using a Surewest provided component cable and the problem has not reappeared since I switched away from HDMI.

Reviews.Title: LCD purchase
Reviews.Author: Eileen Bartow-rives
Reviews.Content: THe LCD arrived in great shape and on time. The quialty of the product appears to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great product!  Great deal!
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv!  I was very nervous about buying such a "big ticket" item online, but Amazon was great.  The White Glove delivery service was better than what you'd probably get with one of the major retailers.  If you've been waiting to pull the trigger on a LCD, wait no longer!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: P. Ferry
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing.  The picture is so crisp!  I would definitely recommend this TV.  GREAT purchase!

Reviews.Title: Good value for money - may be not
Reviews.Author: Anurag Jain "Anurag"
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, would have been much better if USB interface can play videos.Update on 5/13/2009:I bought this TV along with 2 more friends and we all got a line in the screen on top of the screen while playing HD channels. We do regret not buying sony.

Reviews.Title: great out of the box
Reviews.Author: J. Johnson
Reviews.Content: beautifully designed.  Colors are good right out of the box.  Tons of controls to adjust picture quality. Black levels are pleasantly deep especially when gaming (think dead space ps3).  Infolink is novel but not useful everyday.  Picture quality on 1080i/p is truly world class.  Automotion feature gets annoying and I leave it off.  Firmware history is a bit confusing.  This tv gets it done where it counts...picture is phenomenal.  I owned a 52a550 which was given to my parents.  I would buy this tv again no hesitation or samsung for that matter.

Reviews.Title: Look no further - SAMSUNG
Reviews.Author: C. silbert
Reviews.Content: I no longer bother looking at anything other than Samsung; the prices are reasonable (and usually best on Amazon) for an excellent state of the art product, their TVs are easy to set up and overall, terrific. This is my third Samsung and the largest I've bought: the quality of the picture in this size is different from anything I've previously had.  Sports and news (debates, especially) are just live, live, live.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV.....Can't find any fault with it
Reviews.Author: Rakesh Nandivada "Mountaineer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV last month (sep 2008). This is the first that I bought a LCD TV. After reading a lot of reviews, doing research, comparing the TV, visiting the stores,etc I bought this TV which gives the max for the price (compared to Sony).When I turned on the TV for the very first time with HD box, wow.....amazing!!! Its clearer than watching people standing in front of you. The picture quality is awesome. I mainly bought for football season. You can see even the glass blades of the field turf. It is crystal clear.I gave 4 stars since I don't know what Sony might be offering. I did my best research and bought this. Since I can't be perfect, I gave 4 stars. But it is worth every penny.Next...I have to buy home theater.Before you this expensive TV....do lot of research. Go to stores. Compare the prices. Don't buy TV just based on one review. Some people like some TVs and some don't. But for sports......this is THE best TV as it has 120 hz option.

Reviews.Title: mounted memories a joke
Reviews.Author: pinkfish "pinkfish"
Reviews.Content: I just ordered the Samsung 650 lcd 52" tv. It has not arrived yet, but I thought I would go ahead and check out what I could get with the $200 gift cert. at Mounted Memories. Please be advised that the site is a Joke.  I literally clicked on a hundred items they had for sale and on every one from the Indianapolis Colts to Bill Elliott it said "We no longer carry this item." I tried to find a single Item ranging from $70 to $7000 and never found one single item they offered. Don't count on anything from this supposable offer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!
Reviews.Author: Mike P "mike90069"
Reviews.Content: First, this is an awesome tv.  Great picture, beautifully designed case.It's basically the same as the 7 series with a few less bells and whistles.  There's about a $150 price differential between the 6 and 7 series.  I would doubt most people would use the extras on the 7 series.Delivery was a snap; as fast as Best Buy.  Ordered it on a Thursday; it was delivered 10 days later on a Saturday.  I could have had it as early as Thursday (7 days.)  Best Buy is about the same in terms of a delivery time frame.Guys showed up on time, unpacked it, put it where I wanted, turned it on to make sure it worked then took the box and walked out the door.  10 minutes tops!Amazon's price is about $700 below Best Buy.Here's the negative stuff:REBATE:  Absolutely worthless.  It's $200 credit at some collectible store.  Rebate is actually false advertising.PRICE GUARANTEE:  There's no more 30 day price matching which is not good.  Given how fast the price of flat screens are dropping you'd be advised to wait for the Christmas season when prices will really drop. I paid $2099; a week later the unit was $1950 for a day or two.  Bad, bad move on Amazon's part.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but audio delayed
Reviews.Author: Darren & Florence "PPP Progressive Proximity ...
Reviews.Content: The picture can be adjusted in enough ways to satisfy, though some of the settings are excluded when in Standard, Dynamic, or Movie modes. There are also some overriding modes of Game, Sport, and Cinema. None of them completely corrects the audio synchronization. The video processing takes a few frames (100-150 ms) and while the internal speakers and headphone feeds are delayed, the audio outs on the rear jack panel are not. Using the headphone jack doesn't solve the problem because the only control on it is volume/gain, though it is independent of the internal speaker gain. No equalizer on headphone port and it's internally adjusted to boost bass to compensate for headphones. I have to try a delay box. Maybe Motron RTS-100C for another 160$. This makes it unacceptable for WoW (World of Warcraft) but the picture sure looks fantastic despite insufficient glare reduction. And it's too large at 25.5" high for standard matte film (24") from Photodon.

Reviews.Title: The lcd tv I have been waiting for...
Reviews.Author: High Plains Drifter "Joe"
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before ordering this tv. I was strongly considering a Panasonic 50" that was similar in price. What I liked about this tv was the contrast and 120 hz refresh. I got the tv and I ordered the Peerless tilt mount with it. I set the mount on maximum angle, because I was mounting the tv three feet off the ground and I didn't want to strain my head watching it. I was installing the TV in a new home which I had a built in made above the fire place for. The mount kit was easy to install and the tv just hangs on the mount. My tiny wife helped me connect the wires while I lifted it and hung it. I would recommend two men to install. I tuned the tv on and connected it to over the air rabbit ears. I pulled in several HD channels. You can tell which programs were recorded in 1080P because WOW the picture is incredible. The black levels are awesome. The viewing angle is easily 180 degrees. The detail is very crisp and the motion is smoothe. I have been shopping lcd tv's for years and this is the first one that I have seen beat the quality of a picture tube for clarity, color and brightness. Everyone is raving about Samsung being the leader in flat panel tv's for a reason - they are. Sorry Sony, you had your glory days with Trintron. The touch of red struck me as weird, but it looks nice. My wife likes the appearance too. The built in speakers sound great. There are TONS of input connections. My only complaint is that I have to go purchase a Blue Ray DVD and I will probably need to upgrade to HD sattellite. Once you see 1080P on this TV you will want nothing less. That being said it does a good job of scaling up standard definition, way better than my friends Sony CRT projection TV that is also 1080P. There are so many positive reviews on this tv that I don't know why you would not purchase it. One caution about the price. It was as low as $2180 at one point, but I paid $2229. Today it was over $2400 which is more than Best Buy runs it on sale. Just watch the price because it bounces like a superball.

Reviews.Title: Its ok but not the best picture or sound
Reviews.Author: T. Ata
Reviews.Content: I got samsung 650 52 inch tv, about 3 weeks ago. The delivery by ceva was excellent and timely...within 5 days. The picture quality of hd and sd tv transmissions so far is average and not that impressive. The blacks are not as black but the colors are good. The motion blur is also minimal due to 120 hz refresh rate. The sound quality is subpar from the tv speakers.The usb port on this tv does not support mpeg movies. For that you have to get 'wiselink pro' in 750 or 850 models, as I was told by samsung rep. That was a misinformation in amazon's site. The 'pip' function is totally useless and requires 'rocket sceince' extra cables connections. The 'pip' picture is analog and subpar and not worth wasting your time with difficult connections.This tv does not have 'DLNA' and only higher models have them to recieve contents from your PC. I have comcast cable and very few channels have 1080i resolution. Most have 720p and 480i resolution. None of the channel are 1080p. You might be better off buying lower end lcd tv, 720p, to save money if your cable company does not support 1080p.The plastic frame and stand gather dust easily and can get scratched on wiping if you are not careful. Also the frame reflects light badly as it is made of shiny plastic material. I had no problem with 'touch of red' color in the frame. There are tv function 'touch buttons' on the left side the frame but they are extremely hard to see. They do not light up on touch and I suppose only the later models have this facility.The remote is subpar and for most of the common functions you have to go through menu and submenus. The wheel function on the remote is very touch sensitive and takes some practise to master.The tv supposedly has QAM cable box internally but you still need external cable box to get most of the channels. I did not get this? That was a disappointment. The quality of the over the air hd channels was better on my old ctr tv then on this tv. So you have to fork out extra money to your cable company to get HD box. Also there is only one coaxial input jack at the back of the tv and you have to buy a switch and a splitter to change between the input sources... for over the air channels and cable tv.Overall the tv is only 3 stars out of 5. But supposedly, this is the better option than the other brands of tv's at this price at this time....from 'consumer report' and public reviews. I think this tv is over rated. I would have gone for the samsung's 750 model but there were lot of complains about the frame bleeding color and breaking up. If price is not a factor then pioneer's plasma tvs, would be the best choice.And by the way the amazon's customer service is excellent and I got prompt $99 refund on this tv as the price dropped. I would definately buy from amazon site again. But be careful and make sure that you only buy from amazon on this site as other vendors also sell tv's/items also on amazon and their retrun policy and shipping is not free.Also don't forget to buys hdmi and svga cables at the same time of the TV purchase to connect dvd players and pc. Otherwise you will have to wait for their arrivals. They are extremely cheaply priced at amazon and you will save bundle as compared to retail stores. They are of excellent quality.Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Minor color tweaking, weird problem with Tivo and HDMI ports, power usage in watts list.
Reviews.Author: I call them as I see em.
Reviews.Content: I have both the 46" 650 and the 52" 650 sitting side by side and can make some comparisons.  The difference is far less than I originally thought and fixable. The 46" had what I thought was perfect color out of the box but now I think it might be a bit green in the White Balance G-Gain.I found the 52" color on flesh tones and other things like carrots can be too magenta or green but there is something you can do about it.  The fix is NOT to adjust the Flesh Tones or the Colors Space but instead to adjust the White Balance.  The settings that I found to be the best are the R-Offset 24, R-Gain 23, B-Gain 23, G-Gain 26 (all the rest being default 25).  This took a lot of effort because I was originally adjusting Flesh Tones, Tint, and Color Space until I stumbled onto the idea that just the White Balance was the culprit. I guess it makes sense.  The white balance is the canvas all colors are painted on so it will change them all.  It could also be that the tv is new and the back light bulb hasn't had sufficient burn in time to produce it's expected kelvin color yet?After making the minor color adjustments on the 52" I will be keeping it over the smaller 46".One good difference between the two is the 46" needs to be set to a back  light of 7 (143 watts) to equal the 52" in brightness set to just 4 (166).  This makes the power difference of just 23 watts which I thinks is pretty good for the size difference.POWER FIGURESOnly thing that matters with power consumption is the back lighting so that's all I am listing. (@ 117.8 volts ac)1-  101 watts2-  124 watts3-  145 watts4-  166 watts5-  188 watts6-  208 watts7-  230 watts8-  250 watts9-  273 watts10- 303 wattsAddition:  I found an odd problem with a Tivo (possibly a cable box as well) and which HDMI port is used by it.  If the Tivo is connected to HDMI port 1 it works pretty well.  Sometimes the Tivo will suddenly stop responding to the remote and requires the tv to be turned off then back on.  This is not very often and no big deal.  But, if the Tivo box is connected to HDMI port 2, 3, or 4, then the Tivo will not respond to the remote at all once the tv is powered on and starts scanning channels.  It's like the tv starts ouputing some kind of connection signal that blocks the remote signal to the Tivo.  This might also be occurring on cable boxes.  I hope this problem doesn't start occurring more often and it actually makes me a little nervous about owning this and knowing Samsung's service is so bad.Addition:I saw a ln55a950 with the LED back lighting and wasn't all that impressed with the difference.  It made a movie "Air Force One" with Harrison Ford look 3-D but not sure if a LN52A650 wouldn't have done the same thing.  Other than that it was over saturating the colors which isn't good, I just mean that the 650 does colors as bright and clear as they need be so adding any more color makes them too saturated.  I'm going to just keep the $2000 difference and wait another 6 years till something dramatically better comes out that blows even the 950 away for far less. Heck, maybe already the '09 leds are way better and cheaper. time march's on and no sense blowing it all on just the current absolute best, there will be better and cheaper in the future.  Probably 10 years from now they'll have diamond sets out that are unbelievable.
